finding: Variant rs2074356 was identified as a significant new association (beta = 2.85, P = 2.7 × 10^-28) in the KoGES cohort after adjusting for rs671, highlighting its role as a novel finding related to alcohol flushing symptoms.
title: Genetic influences on alcohol flushing in East Asian populations

finding: The locus indexed by rs2138543 was associated with TLA between 6am and 8am, reflecting early morning activity patterns.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: The signal rs7977418 in CCDC91 displayed age-dependent effects, showing differences in effect sizes between children and adults, with a nominal significance (P < 5.14×10^-5), implying its impact on lung function may vary with age.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The locus at 12q24.12 (rs11066015) was identified specifically in East Asian populations and is linked to the ALDH2 gene, which plays a role in metabolic traits and has high LD with a missense variant rs671.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: rs3184504 was previously associated with cardiovascular disease (CVD) and multiple other traits such as leukocyte count, hypothyroidism, smoking status, blood pressure, and coronary artery disease.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of self-reported antidepressant use in Generation Scotland implicates the innate immune system

finding: rs10774624 was found to be associated with eosinophil count, vitiligo, systolic blood pressure, and intraocular pressure measurement, in addition to rheumatoid arthritis (RA).
title: Epigenome-wide association study of self-reported antidepressant use in Generation Scotland implicates the innate immune system

finding: The SNP rs11055602, also located on chromosome 12, acted as a GR-response meQTL. It demonstrated effects both before and after dexamethasone treatment, with a notable decrease in methylation levels for individuals with the major genotype and an increase for those with the minor allele in the post-dexamethasone context, yielding an FDR of 5.1×10^-30.
title: Multi-omics analysis of the molecular response to glucocorticoids - insights into shared genetic risk from psychiatric to medical disorders

finding: Linked with a 310 bp Alu deletion in the intron of TPCN1 at R2=0.73, showing that genomic alterations in this region might contribute to mechanisms associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: Patients with the CD69 rs11052877 AA genotype exhibited an increased response to tocilizumab when compared to those with AG and GG genotypes, highlighting its role in treatment efficacy.
title: Interleukin-6 receptor genetic variation and tocilizumab treatment response to COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs7962636 was associated with an increase in expected baseline weight, specifically a 0.023 SD increase, with a highly significant p-value of 3.7 x 10^-12.
title: The genetic architecture of changes in adiposity during adulthood

finding: The rs7134559_C variant (located at 12q13.11) was associated with lower p-tau levels, noted for being a PD risk increasing allele, highlighting a distinct biomarker profile in PD compared to AD.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding:
The SNP rs2657879 demonstrated a statistically significant association with glutamine at a level much stronger than any other instruments for glutamine (

=3×10^-70), indicating its robust association. Additionally, it was located within the genomic region of the glutaminase-2 (GLS2) gene, which is involved in converting glutamine to glutamate. In a post-hoc single-SNP Mendelian randomization analysis using an independent dataset, this SNP corroborated the protective causal effect of glutamine on Alzheimer's Disease, with a notable effect size (OR=0.035, 95% CI=0.003-0.381, p=0.006). This finding underlined glutamine's potential protective role against AD, further supported by its causative implications in the glutamine-glutamate cycle.
title: Disentangling independent and mediated causal relationships between blood metabolites, cognitive factors, and Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs3138142 was associated with recessive genetic effects on retinal thickness. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic basis of variations in retinal structure.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides epidemiologically informative biomarkers

finding: The rs7134559_C variant was identified as a PD risk increasing allele associated with lower p-tau levels in a disease status non-specific manner.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: This variant linked to <italic>SUDS3</italic> demonstrated strong statistical significance in relation to PSA levels, reinforcing its relevance for prostate health.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The variant rs76687508 was acknowledged with an RD of 0.50 related to phenylketonuria, again a serious AR condition, highlighting its clinical significance.
title: Deleterious Variants Contribute Minimal Excess Risk in Large-Scale Testing

finding: The allele of rs7133378 that decreased BFP was associated with lower HDL, higher TG, and increased CAD risk. This association highlighted detrimental cardiometabolic effects despite its relation to body fat.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs1716407 was identified, associating positively with increased GFAT and demonstrating improvements in lipid levels, which indicates a complex role in fat distribution and cardiometabolic health.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP also linked to increased GFAT while enhancing HDL and lowering TG, reflecting a favorable profile.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: Associated with increased GFAT and improved lipid profiles, aligning with the beneficial associations of several other SNPs.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: Demonstrated associations of the BFP increasing allele with increased GFAT and improvements in lipid levels.
title: Sex-stratified GWAS of Body Fat Percentage after Adjusting for Testosterone and SHBG in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs582975 variant in the PARP11-CCND2 locus was identified as a novel risk variant for DNMT3A-associated CH (OR = 0.93 [0.91-0.95], P = 1.26 x 10^-8).
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The study detailed interactions at rs1431999695 of the ALG10B gene with LTST for PP, attaining significance with P_GxE=2.5×10^-5.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: For rs7955964, the variant demonstrated notable interactions under LTST conditions for systemic blood pressure measurements, conforming to previous results.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs76904798, located at chromosome 12:40220632, raised the likelihood of patients belonging to the 'moderate' PD progression subtype, showing significant association with this progression pattern.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: Similarly, rs11830537 was associated with hypothyroidism and TSH levels, reinforcing its connection to thyroid disorders.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Heterozygotes for GNB3 rs5443 had an increased risk for myocardial infarction/angina compared to CC homozygotes (HR 1.07, p=0.02).
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The rs10774625 SNP, located in an intronic region of the ATXN2 gene at the 12q24.12 locus, was significantly associated with leukocyte telomere length (LTL) and various cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), especially coronary artery disease (CAD). The SNP displayed strong colocalization evidence with a posterior probability exceeding 0.7 across multiple CVDs, indicating its role as a shared causal variant. It was linked with eQTLs in whole blood for the SH2B3 gene, which is involved in regulating cytokine signaling and has implications for longevity and cardiovascular events.
title: Contribution of leukocyte telomere length to major cardiovascular diseases onset: phenotypic and genetic insights from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: For the SNP rs11568563 in SLCO1A2, findings indicated a high protective effect against PSP with an odds ratio of 0.54 and a significant p-value of 1.17·10^-06, consistent with its role in PSP susceptibility.
title: A Novel Susceptibility Locus in NFASC Highlights Oligodendrocytes and Myelination in Progressive Supranuclear Palsy Pathology

finding: Associated with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.24) and tied to testosterone, it exhibited colocalization with an eQTL involved in reproductive processes, reinforcing its importance in neuroendocrine function.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs111970601 was linked to CO sensitivity in pediatric asthma patients. It had an odds ratio of 6.58 and reached genome-wide significance. The finding was validated with significant differences in pre-exacerbation AAP concentrations in the All of Us cohort. This SNP was implicated in the gene RIMBP2, which is involved in pre-synaptic active zone formation and is associated with lung cancer prognosis.
title: GWAS reveals Genetic Susceptibility to Air Pollution-Related Asthma Exacerbations in Children of African Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs1201669374 found at the PRR4 locus showed associations with non-caffeine substances consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The variant rs4149056 was associated with statin metabolism and implicated in muscle pain and damage, with a frequency of 12.5% among Indonesians, consistent with values reported in gnomAD.
title: Validation of a multi-gene qPCR-based pharmacogenomics panel across major ethnic groups in Singapore and Indonesia

finding: The lead SNP rs773111 in the RAB5B locus was found to impact gene expression in blood and was significantly associated with the risk of both endometriosis and GPM.
title: Evidence of shared genetic factors in the aetiology of gastrointestinal disorders and endometriosis and clinical implications for disease management

finding: The variant rs11172113 also had a PIP of 1.00 in the LRP1 gene, highlighting its role as a strong risk factor for migraine.
title: Fine-mapping a genome-wide meta-analysis of 98,374 migraine cases identifies 181 sets of candidate causal variants

finding: The loss-of-function variant Val174Ala (rs4149056: T>C) was associated with increased plasma concentrations of statins by as much as 221% in vitro. Homozygous carriers of the minor C allele exhibited an increased risk of statin-associated myopathy, with odds ranging from 3 to 17-fold higher in post-hoc analyses of randomized clinical trials.
title: Common and rare variants in SLCO1B1 are associated with statin intolerance

finding: The gain-of-function variant Pro155Thr (rs11045819) was found to be independently associated with a 32% decrease in systemic exposure to simvastatin acid per allele. This finding supported the potential role of gain-of-function variants in modulating statin pharmacokinetics.
title: Common and rare variants in SLCO1B1 are associated with statin intolerance

finding: The gain-of-function variant Leu643Phe (rs34671512) was also independently associated with a 36% decrease in systemic exposure to simvastatin acid per allele, corroborating similar findings with the Pro155Thr variant regarding system exposure and pharmacokinetic effects.
title: Common and rare variants in SLCO1B1 are associated with statin intolerance

finding: The gain-of-function variant Asn130Asp (rs2306283) was shown to have an effect in conjunction with Val174Ala on statin responses and adverse drug reactions, highlighting its relevance in the pharmacogenetics of statin tolerance.
title: Common and rare variants in SLCO1B1 are associated with statin intolerance

finding: The T allele of rs3184504 was associated with increased TSH and increased risk of both hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism. It also showed pleiotropic associations with other autoimmune disorders.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The G allele of rs2393717 was associated with increased TSH, reduced hypothyroidism risk, decreased C-reactive protein, and other effects on metabolic traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: Described as a missense variant in SH2B3, rs3184504 was shown to influence DBP concentration and had implications for various disorders including autoimmune diseases.
title: Genetic correlates of vitamin D-binding protein and 25 hydroxyvitamin D in neonatal dried blood spots

finding: The SNP rs11062170 in the CACNA1C locus was identified as MPRA-positive, demonstrating allelic regulatory activity. The alternative allele (C) disrupted the binding motif of RFX5, resulting in significantly lower expression of the gene compared to the reference (protective) allele (G). This SNP was located within a H3K27ac peak specific to neurons but not other cell types, highlighting its neuronal specificity and its association with schizophrenia.
title: Systematic investigation of allelic regulatory activity of schizophrenia-associated common variants

finding: In the SCARB1 locus, rs11057853 was associated with reduced genomic mutation burden, suggesting a protective role against clonal hematopoiesis.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: This SNP, associated with Parkinson's disease (PD), was identified in carriers of the MAPT H1/H1 genotype near EMP1 with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.88 (95% confidence interval [CI] = 0.84-0.92, p = 1.80E-08). The finding indicated a protective effect among these carriers.
title: Genome-wide association study stratified by MAPT haplotypes identifies potential novel loci in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The lead variant rs1626329 was located in the P2RX7 gene and was identified as a trans-ancestry lead SNP associated with chronic alanine aminotransferase elevation (cALT), with significant implications for metabolic liver disease.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: This SNP was identified as the lead variant in a European-only analysis, located in the HNF1A gene. It was also associated with the risk of developing cALT, indicating its potential role in metabolic dysregulation.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: In the context of liver disease, rs1718119 was found to be a missense variant (Ala348Thr) in the P2RX7 gene and showed strong linkage disequilibrium with the lead SNP rs1626329.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: The rs1169288 variant was identified as a coding variant (Ile27Leu) in the HNF1A gene, significantly associated with cALT, suggesting its involvement in hepatic function.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: In contrast to rs62075722, the variant rs11051131 demonstrated a dominant effect on retinal thickness measurements. This suggested that the presence of this variant could significantly influence retinal structure, with implications for ophthalmic health.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides informative biomarkers

finding: This SNP in CCDC91 displayed age-dependent effects related to lung function, showing a significant effect size difference in children compared to adults.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The SNP rs28730284 was located upstream of the KLRC2 gene and was significant with a p-value of 2.20E-07. KLRC2 encodes a protein that plays roles in the immune response, making this variant biologically relevant in the context of Kawasaki disease.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The SNP rs12146713 was identified in the intronic region of the NUAK1 gene at locus 12q23.3, showing associations with cortical thickness, surface area, and subcortical volume. It acted as an eQTL for Lnc-NUAK1-1 and was part of a credible set linking it to brain traits.
title: Genome-wide analysis of brain age identifies 25 associated loci and unveils relationships with mental and physical health

finding: The variant rs12827878-T associated with lower urate and urea levels, implicating genetic factors involved in metabolic processes which may also affect ACEI-induced cough mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide association study of ACE inhibitor-induced cough implicates neuropeptides and shows genetic overlap with chronic dry cough

finding: The SNP rs121913529 was associated with KRAS mutations in colorectal tumors, specifically presenting two amino acid changes: p.G12D (c.G35A) which was found in 68 tumors, and p.G12V (c.G35T) which appeared in 65 tumors. This SNP represented a significant finding in the study as it contributed to understanding the mutational features of colorectal cancer in the analyzed population.
title: Spectrum of somatic mutational features of colorectal tumors in ancestrally diverse populations

finding: The SNP rs112445441, linked to the KRAS gene, was associated with a mutation resulting in the p.G13D (c.G38A) change, observed in 59 tumors. This finding highlighted the relevance of this region in the development of colorectal cancer mutations within the diverse populations studied.
title: Spectrum of somatic mutational features of colorectal tumors in ancestrally diverse populations

finding: The common, non-coding variant rs10774740 at the 12q24.21 locus exhibited a protective effect against posterior urethral valves (PUV) with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.40 (P=7.81x10^-12). This variant was linked to the transcription factor TBX5, indicating its potential role in congenital cardiac and urethral development.
title: Mixed ancestry analysis of whole-genome sequencing reveals common, rare, and structural variants associated with posterior urethral valves

finding: The SNP rs6538618 was implicated in shared risk between endometriosis and clear cell ovarian cancer (CCOC). This SNP overlapped 10 biofeatures and was associated with the expression of the adjacent genes VEZT and FGD6 in endometrial tissue.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs7309252 was associated with both endometriosis and HGSOC, showing high linkage disequilibrium with rs6538618, which overlapped regulatory regions impacting gene expression.
title: A multi-level investigation of the genetic relationship between endometriosis and ovarian cancer histotypes

finding: The SNP rs34330 was connected to multiple target gene expressions involved in proliferation and apoptosis within an SLE context.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: This intronic variant in CCND2 was associated with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.24, SE = 0.029) and had previous associations with testosterone levels. It colocalised with eQTLs and was linked to reproductive processes.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs149212747 was linked exclusively to status epilepticus and was found in individuals of Asian ancestry, highlighting its potential as a genetic risk variant for this epilepsy type.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: SNP rs3782886 was found to be synonymous and located in the BRAP gene, with significant associations noted in individuals of Asian ancestry. This SNP was suggested for further study due to its previous associations with other diseases.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: The intronic variant rs7964859 was previously associated with aspartate levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: The SNP rs12310399, located in the FGD6 locus, was identified as a novel finding associated with ruptured intracranial aneurysm (rIA) in this study, reaching genome-wide significance with a p-value of 3.19×10^-10 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.16. This SNP was shown to decrease FGD6 gene expression in arterial tissues, suggesting a functional role in rIA risk.
title: Integrative genomics analysis implicates decreased FGD6 expression underlying risk of intracranial aneurysm rupture

finding: Though not detailed in this study, rs1442190, as an intronic variant within CNTN1, contributed to the risk for dementia and was suggested to interact with PD-associated pathways.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs10735079 was linked to OAS1, OAS2, and OAS3 on chromosome 12, correlating with less severe disease, but shown to confer less protection compared to risks associated with chromosome 3.
title: Potential associations of selected polymorphic genetic variants with COVID-19 disease susceptibility and severity

finding: The variant rs118078722 near the CD163 gene showed strong evidence of association with endometriosis, marked by a P-value of 1.39E-08 and noted in both the AFR and EUR meta-analyses.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The variant rs12581759, located at 12q24.32, was significantly associated with endometriosis, evidenced by a P-value of 2.64E-08.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The SNP rs73156962, located in the RIMS-Binding Protein (RIMBP2) gene on chromosome 12, had a significant p-value of 0.034. This gene is involved in neuromuscular synaptic transmission and has a direct biological interpretation related to neuronal tissue in the nucleus accumbens.
title: Post Stroke Motor Recovery Genome Wide Association Study: A Domain-Specific Approach

finding: The missense variant rs59502379 (c.1463G>C) was associated with an increased risk of statin-induced myopathy and rhabdomyolysis in Black participants with an odds ratio of 2.45 (95% CI 1.04-5.78, P=0.04). This finding highlighted the significance of this variant in the context of pharmacogenetic testing for statin therapy.
title: SLCO1B1 functional variants and statin-induced myopathy in people with recent genealogical ancestors from Africa: a population-based real-world study

finding: The loss-of-function splice variant rs77271279 (c.481+1G>T) was identified as having an increased risk of statin-induced myopathy and rhabdomyolysis in Black participants with an odds ratio of 3.27 (95% CI 1.43-7.46, P=0.005). This finding underscored the variant's role as a mechanistic determinant of statin myotoxicity.
title: SLCO1B1 functional variants and statin-induced myopathy in people with recent genealogical ancestors from Africa: a population-based real-world study

finding: In the context of alcohol metabolism, rs141043717 was included in the credible sets for alcohol intake, indicating its potential influence on that phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: This SNP was also found in the credible sets for alcohol intake, highlighting its association with this specific quantitative trait.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The association of rs149178839 with alcohol intake was noted, contributing to the understanding of genetic influences on this behavior.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: Rs11066008 was part of the credible set for alcohol intake, reinforcing its relevance in the genetic landscape influencing this consumption trait.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The study identified that individuals carrying the GG genotype of the TPH2 rs4570625 SNP experienced increased subjective anxious arousal when exposed to acute tryptophan depletion (ATD), compared to TT carriers. This genotype-related response was reflected in reduced neural reactivity in the ventromedial prefrontal cortex (vmPFC) towards threat-related stimuli, suggesting that the GG genotype predisposes individuals to heightened anxiety and altered neural responses under conditions of decreased serotonin signaling. These findings highlighted the TPH2 rs4570625 SNP as a significant genetic vulnerability factor affecting emotional regulation during transient variations in serotonin levels.
title: A central serotonin regulating gene polymorphism (TPH2) determines vulnerability to acute tryptophan depletion-induced anxiety and ventromedial prefrontal threat reactivity

finding: Located in the Vitamin D Receptor (VDR), SNP rs551123675 was identified in externalizing-specific regions, particularly the left postcentral gyrus, which has been associated with ADHD and demonstrated a significant association with a p-value of 7.85×10^−9.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: SNP rs114949000, identified in externalizing-specific regions, showed strong associations as part of a group related to ADHD with a significance level of p=7.85×10^−9.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders over a 2-year Period in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The association between the genetic variant rs34673751 from the ACADS gene and butyrylcarnitine was identified as significant. Individuals carrying the A allele exhibited stable higher levels of blood butyrylcarnitine. The ACADS gene encodes the enzyme essential for mitochondrial fatty acid beta-oxidation, highlighting its role in regulating butyrylcarnitine levels.
title: Longitudinal analysis of genetic and environmental interplay in human metabolic profiles and the implication for metabolic health

finding: MR analysis provided further validation for previous reports associating rs4766492 with neuropsychiatric disorders and chronotype, thus supporting its role in these phenotypes.
title: Mendelian randomisation analysis using GWAS and eQTL data to investigate the relationship between chronotype and neuropsychiatric disorders and their molecular basis

finding: The SNP rs7970695 in the HNF1A locus displayed a strong association with hs-CRP levels (P-value = 2.32e-29), indicating its role in metabolic processes affecting inflammation.
title: The combined impact of persistent infections and human genetic variation on C-reactive protein levels

finding: The eSNP rs7294478 was linked to gene expression of TAPBPL in females, showing a significant differential GR-response effect where the major allele was associated with higher expression after dexamethasone treatment. This SNP is located in an intron of C1RL-AS1 on chromosome 12 and relates to the female-biased transcriptional response connected to stress and major depressive disorder (MDD).
title: Autosomal sex-biased genetic regulation of the stress response

finding: The SNP rs934891 displayed significant effects in females, with gene expression of DUSP6 being tested at baseline and after dexamethasone treatment demonstrating a FDR of 0.049. This underscores the sex-biased nature of these GR-response eQTLs and their potential relevance to MDD-related transcriptional profiles.
title: Autosomal sex-biased genetic regulation of the stress response

finding: The rs267607448 variant associated with Epidermolysis Bullosa had a MAF of 0.007 in the Qatari population, demonstrating its relevance as a rare pathogenic variant owing to the local genetic context.
title: Qatar Genome: Insights on Genomics from the Middle East

finding: The SNP rs4767027 was associated with higher OAS1 levels, which correlated with reduced odds of COVID-19 death or ventilation (OR = 0.54), hospitalization (OR = 0.61), and susceptibility (OR = 0.78). The only significant association for this SNP was with circulating OAS1 levels (P=6.2×10−26), indicating its direct influence on COVID-19 outcomes.
title: A Neanderthal OAS1 isoform Protects Against COVID-19 Susceptibility and Severity: Results from Mendelian Randomization and Case-Control Studies

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was identified as influencing OAS1 splicing, with the ancestral G allele increasing expression of the protective p46 isoform which showed higher anti-viral activity against COVID-19.
title: A Neanderthal OAS1 isoform Protects Against COVID-19 Susceptibility and Severity: Results from Mendelian Randomization and Case-Control Studies

finding: A significant association was discovered between ADAM-12 levels at visit 2 and rs6487735, located near the PZP gene (locus on chromosome 12p13.31), with a strong effect size of -0.1 log(ng/mL) and a p-value of 3.03×10^-22. This association suggests that genetic variants in the PZP locus are influential in regulating ADAM-12 protein levels during pregnancy.
title: Genetic Associations with Dynamic Placental Proteins Identify Causal Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs2277413, a likely causal missense variant located within the PZP gene, was significantly associated with ADAM-12 levels at visit 2. It had an effect size of 0.07 log(ng/mL) and a p-value of 3.32×10^-11, indicating its role in the genetic regulation of ADAM-12 during pregnancy.
title: Genetic Associations with Dynamic Placental Proteins Identify Causal Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs3184504 located at the SH2B3 locus was associated with preeclampsia and was in linkage disequilibrium with other known disease risk alleles. It reflected significant involvement in immune-related pathways and was linked to elevated leukocyte counts and the pathogenesis of preeclampsia through mechanisms involving immune tolerance and inflammation.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis identifies novel maternal risk variants and enables polygenic prediction of preeclampsia and gestational hypertension

finding: The SNP rs7488772 was found to be positively associated with coronary heart disease (CHD) by revealing higher genetically-predicted expression of PDE3A, with a significant p-value of 2.25x10^-7. This association was strong based on the colocalization result (PPH4=0.99), indicating that higher expression levels might contribute to CHD pathogenesis. Additionally, an analysis showed associations with several cardiometabolic risk factors such as systolic blood pressure and triglycerides.
title: Transcriptome- and proteome-wide Mendelian randomization to prioritize therapeutic targets for coronary heart disease

finding: The SNP rs28659953 was noted as a new independent signal found within an already known locus, RILPL1. It was associated with the mechanism involving LRRK2-phosphorylated Rab10 and its role in blocking primary cilia generation, relating this variant directly to PD pathogenesis.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs7133378 was significantly associated with GFATadjBMI (P = 5.6 x 10^-29), with implications for adipocyte lipid accumulation.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The SNP rs10877425 was associated with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) and had the lowest p-value of 1.14×10^-10 among the genome-wide significant loci.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies new loci associated with OCD

finding: The SNP rs4766578 was associated with the AF-related heart failure subtype, corresponding to the ATXN2 gene region.
title: Identifying subtypes of heart failure with machine learning: external, prognostic and genetic validation in three electronic health record sources with 320,863 individuals

finding: The variant rs10878269 was observed in relation to different brain network traits, establishing links to snoring.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs28576953 was correlated with specific cerebellar functions in the context of sleep research.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: At a large-scale level, rs61921611 was correlated significantly with many sleep-related phenotypes.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: At the SCARB1 locus, rs11057853 was identified as a common intronic variant linked to reduced GEM and suggested a protective role against clonal expansion.
title: The Genetic Determinants and Genomic Consequences of Non-Leukemogenic Somatic Point Mutations

finding: The analysis found that rs12310519 played a predominant role in the negative causal relationship between chronic back pain (CBP) and reduced physical activity. It was significant in indicating that participants with CBP reduced their physical activity by about 146 MET-minutes per week. Notably, without this SNP, the causal relationship would not have been statistically significant, showing the critical influence of rs12310519 in understanding the impact of CBP on physical activity.
title: Investigating the causal relationship between physical activity and chronic back pain: a bidirectional two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The variant rs3782886 in the BRAP gene was identified in association with AUD in the east Asian population, showing its potential role in genetic susceptibility to PAU.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs1201669374 at PRR4 was newly identified as associated with non-caffeine substance intake, reflecting its relevance.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The missense variant rs1169288 in the gene HNF1A was associated with an increased risk of type-2 diabetes (GWAS β=0.04) and a decrease in circulating ACE2 levels (GWAS β=-0.16). This finding indicated that the variant could influence both diabetes risk and ACE2 levels.
title: Circulating cardiovascular proteomic associations with genetics and disease

finding: The variant rs114578532, located upstream of FGF6, passed the genome-wide significance threshold in the marginal test with a p-value of 2.18×10−8, although it did not achieve significance in the joint test.
title: Summary statistics from large-scale gene-environment interaction studies for re-analysis and meta-analysis

finding: This SNP at locus 12q23 reached genome-wide significance in association with overall lung cancer in African ancestry cohorts, indicating its potential relevance as a risk factor.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analyses of lung cancer in the Million Veteran Program reveal novel risk loci and elucidate smoking-independent genetic risk

finding: The low-frequency missense variant in the histidine ammonia lyase (HAL) gene, rs61937878, was significantly associated with 2 out of 56 selected metabolites (histidine and glycine), with a substantial association with histidine explained by the enzymatic function of HAL.
title: Genome-wide association study for circulating metabolites in 619,372 individuals

finding: Like rs117137535, this SNP was previously associated in Europeans and was just below the significance threshold in the European-only analysis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: This SNP demonstrated a significant association with immune cell types and supported findings from earlier GWAS related to immune system function.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: Associated with NK mature NKG2A+ cells, this SNP had previously been described in relation to immune cells in other research.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals different T cell distributions in peripheral blood of healthy individuals at high genetic risk of type 1 diabetes and long COVID

finding: The eQTL rs2599400 in the gene TAS2R31 showed opposite effects in different populations, suggesting population-specific variations that influenced phenotypes like taste sensitivity.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: This SNP associated with VPS37B demonstrated a notable disparity in allele frequencies, showing a MAF of 0.24 in EAS compared to a mere 0.04 in EUR.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: This SNP was located on chromosome 12 and was associated with age at onset of walking with a p-value of 2.045 x 10^-11. It had previously been linked to reaction time and physical traits such as diastolic blood pressure and hip circumference adjusted for BMI.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis of age at onset of walking

finding: SNP rs3782886, located in the gene BRAP, was associated with GGE including symptomatic and unclassified epilepsy specifically in individuals of Asian ancestry. It highlighted the impact of variations in ubiquitin ligase proteins on epilepsy mechanisms.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: SNP rs11066001, also located in BRAP, shared the association with GGE, underscoring the potential role of ubiquitin ligase protein-encoding genes in the development and maintenance of epilepsy.
title: Systematic review of genome wide association studies (GWAS) of epilepsy identifies common risk variants and associated genes

finding: With a p-value of 1.2×10^-13, this SNP was recognized for its association with prostate cancer-related PSA variations.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs6487735 was located near the pregnancy zone protein (PZP) gene and exhibited a significant association with ADAM-12 levels in serum at visit2, with a P-value of 3.03×10^-22. This finding indicated a genetic regulation of ADAM-12 levels related to placental function.
title: Genetic Associations with Placental Proteins in Maternal Serum Identify Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs2277413 was associated with ADAM-12 levels at visit2 (P=3.32×10^-11) and showed a stronger association when adjusted for rs6487735 (P=2.37×10^-10), suggesting its likely role as a causal missense variant impacting ADAM-12 production.
title: Genetic Associations with Placental Proteins in Maternal Serum Identify Biomarkers for Hypertension in Pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs11832738, located in the CACNA1C gene, was found to influence depression severity. It was specifically associated with spontaneous activity modulation in the right middle frontal gyrus in patients diagnosed with major depressive disorder. This finding was important as it linked genetic variation to both the neural circuitry involved in reward processing and varying symptom severity in depression contexts.
title: Reward circuit function and treatment outcome following vALIC deep brain stimulation in treatment-resistant depression

finding: The SLCO1B1*5 genotype (rs4149056 CC homozygous) was found to significantly increase the likelihood of having raised total cholesterol (>5mmol/L) among females compared to those with the normal SLCO1B1 function (TT homozygous). Specifically, 48.4% of females with the SLCO1B1*5 genotype had elevated cholesterol versus 41.7% in the normal function group, yielding an Odds Ratio of 1.31 (95% CI 1.1 to 1.55, p=0.001). Moreover, female carriers of the SLCO1B1*5 variant were also more likely to discontinue statin therapy (29.5%) than women with normal function (25.7%), reflected by a Hazard Ratio of 1.19 (95% CI 1.03 to 1.37, p=0.01). These findings suggested that the SLCO1B1*5 impaired transport of statins may affect cholesterol management and treatment adherence particularly in women.
title: Statin treatment effectiveness and the SLCO1B1*5 reduced function genotype: long-term outcomes in women and men

finding: This SNP was associated with COVID-19 hospitalization within the OAS1 gene and reached genome-wide significance in the meta-analysis of males.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The variant in the KRT5 gene (rs267607448), associated with Epidermolysis Bullosa, was observed at a MAF of 0.007 in the Qatari population, confirming its relevance to this genetic disorder.
title: Qatar Genome: Insights on Genomics from the Middle East

finding: The polymorphism <italic>SLCO1B1</italic> c.521T>C (rs4149056) was previously associated with statin-induced muscle-related adverse drug reactions (SRM), particularly in patients treated with simvastatin. Notably, in earlier studies, the risk for myopathy in CC homozygotes was found to be significantly elevated compared to TT homozygotes, with an odds ratio (OR) of 16.9 based on a study involving 85 cases and 90 controls. This association was replicated in multiple studies, including the Heart Protection Study. The relevance of this SNP to SRM highlighted its significance in pharmacogenomic guidelines for the dosing of simvastatin and atorvastatin to reduce the risk of adverse effects.
title: Predictive value of SLCO1B1 c.521T>C polymorphism on observed changes in the treatment of 1136 statin-users

finding: SNP rs2887022 was noted as a candidate causal SNP associated with hospitalization outcomes for breast cancer.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The rs11832738 SNP in the CACNA1C gene was associated with depression severity by modulating spontaneous activity in the right middle frontal gyrus in patients with major depressive disorder. This finding underscored the relevance of genetic variants in the modulation of neural activity associated with reward processing, particularly as it relates to treatment outcomes in depression.
title: Reward circuit function and treatment outcome following vALIC deep brain stimulation in treatment-resistant depression

finding: The SNP rs1059513 located in the STAT6 gene demonstrated a significant association in the liability GWAS for asthma, which was undetected in the binary method, echoing results found in previous studies.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: The SNP rs12304921 was identified with a significant association, evidenced by a p-value of 5.05×10^-21 in the context of the 'Hemochromatosis Brain' phenotype, indicating its potential link to metal transporters involved in iron regulation.
title: Polygenic architecture of a novel MRI endophenotype: the “hemochromatosis brain”

finding: The DEC2 (BHLHE41) gene variant rs121912617, which was analyzed for association with short sleep, showed a BinomiRare mid-p-value of 0.03. This variant was more common in African Americans than in European Americans who had a significantly lower minor allele frequency (MAF < 0.001), thus substantiating the association in a population-based study.
title: BinomiRare: A carriers-only test for association of rare genetic variants with a binary outcome for mixed models and any case-control proportion

finding: The eQTL rs2599400 for the gene TAS2R31 showed opposite effects across different populations, a finding that highlighted population-specific variations in gene expression. This variance was linked to differing phenotypic sensitivities to bitter taste.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: This SNP was found to have a significant association in the East Asian (EAS) population, with a high allele frequency (AF = 0.48), while showing a markedly lower frequency (AF = 0.04) in the European (EUR) population, indicating population-specific genetic effects.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: This SNP exhibited a higher frequency in EAS (MAF = 0.24) compared to EUR (MAF = 0.04), confirming that allele frequency differences can explain discrepancies in GWAS results between these populations.
title: Brain eQTLs of European, African American, and Asian ancestry improve interpretation of schizophrenia GWAS

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant associations in both Black (P=0.0495, OR=1.06) and White men (P=0.00024, OR=1.04) with prostate cancer, making it a finding of interest particularly due to its varying frequency between ancestry populations.
title: Variants in Vitamin D-related Genes and Prostate Cancer Risk in Black Men

finding: SNP rs12146713, mapped to the NAUK1 gene, was associated with endophenotype T2:67 and was previously linked to thalamic volume and brain morphology traits including white matter microstructure. The finding established its relevance to brain function and structure in GWAS.
title: New phenotype discovery method by unsupervised deep representation learning empowers genetic association studies of brain imaging

finding: SNP rs2245611 was found to be reallocated from HCAR1 and DENR to HCAR3, highlighting its potential role in bridging trait-associated variants to cardiovascular traits.
title: Multi-omics Integration Identifies Genes Influencing Traits Associated with Cardiovascular Risks: The Long Life Family Study

finding: The SNP rs6489191 was transferred from KNTC1 and HCAR2 to HCAR3, allowing for the inference of its mediating potential between trait-associated variants and HDL traits.
title: Multi-omics Integration Identifies Genes Influencing Traits Associated with Cardiovascular Risks: The Long Life Family Study

finding: The SNP rs117321479 on chromosome 12 was associated with the gene SOX5, which has been identified as having high pleiotropic effects across various psychiatric disorders, including autism spectrum disorder (ASD), bipolar disorder (BIP), major depression (MD), and schizophrenia (SCZ). This indicates a potential genetic link between hoarding symptoms and broader psychiatric conditions, suggesting that SOX5 may contribute to susceptibility to general psychopathology.
title: Meta-Analysis of Genome-Wide Association Studies of Hoarding Symptoms in 27 537 Individuals

finding: The rs10735079 allele frequency was noted to correlate with increased risk for severe COVID-19, particularly in the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The study found that European individuals with early-onset asthma (age ≤18 years) carrying the rs2660845 G allele (AG or GG genotypes) had an increased risk (odds ratio = 3.27) of experiencing exacerbations while on montelukast treatment, compared to those with the AA genotype. This association was found through a meta-analysis involving 523 early-onset individuals of European ancestry. However, no significant association was observed in other ethnic groups such as Latino/Hispanic and African American populations when including them in the analysis, indicating a possible specificity of this effect to the European early-onset group.
title: LTA4H association with montelukast response in early and late-onset asthma

finding: This variant was identified as associated with lung cancer at the 12p13.33 locus, contributing to the body of knowledge regarding lung cancer susceptibility variants.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The missense variant rs1169288 in the gene HNF1A was associated with an increased risk of type-2 diabetes and decreased levels of circulating ACE2. The GWAS beta coefficient for type-2 diabetes was 0.04 and for circulating ACE2 levels was -0.16, indicating an inverse relationship where the genetic variant increased diabetes risk while lowering ACE2 levels.
title: Circulating cardiovascular proteomic associations with genetics and disease

finding: The SNP rs1127787 was documented as an intronic variant in MRPS35, having associations with mitochondrial gene expression changes.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: The SNP rs11064881 was associated with PRKAB1 and demonstrated a significant relationship with mtDNA-CN, indicating its regulatory impact.
title: GWAS and ExWAS of blood Mitochondrial DNA copy number identifies 73 loci and highlights a potential causal role in dementia

finding: This intronic variant in CCND2 showed a positive relationship with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.24) and is known for its prior association with testosterone, indicating significance in reproductive processes.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: The SNP rs17178006 on chromosome 12 was significantly associated with amygdala volume, supporting previous findings by Satizabal et al. (2019). This locus spans an intronic region linked to various psychiatric phenotypes, including cognitive performance and bipolar disorder.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Amygdala Nuclei

finding: The SNP rs11068224 was noted as one of the significant loci shared between the trans-ancestry and European analyses of whole amygdala volume, reinforcing its involvement in the genetic makeup influencing this brain region.
title: The Genetic Architecture of Amygdala Nuclei

finding: This SNP was included in the seven shared SNPs between BMI, WC, and HC associations with PCOS, indicating its importance in the genetic factors contributing to obesity-related disturbances leading to the syndrome.
title: Both general- and central- obesity are causally associated with polycystic ovarian syndrome: Findings of a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs653178 SNP was identified to have the strongest genetic association with splenic radiomics features, specifically energy (P=1.3x10^-106) and run length non-uniformity (P=9.2x10^-72), while also being linked to systolic and diastolic blood pressure, indicating a significant overlap between genetic influences on CAD and splenic features.
title: Deep learning-derived splenic radiomics, genomics, and coronary artery disease

finding: The rare SNP rs532342679, located near NEDD1, was identified as having a significant effect size on AF liability, suggesting its relevance to AF risk despite being novel and unconfirmed in previous studies.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The variant rs7310615 was associated with 38 traits within European populations.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: Associated with both kyphosis and lordosis, rs9651832 was located near the CCDC91 gene, supporting its involvement in spinal curvature traits. It was also noted for its significant colocalization with RNA expression.
title: Aging of the Spine: Characterizing genetic and physiological determinants of spinal curvature

finding: The SNP rs4590952 was noted to reside in a key position of a functional p53-responsive element (p53-RE) in the KITLG gene, a pro-survival p53 target gene. This finding indicated that common SNPs could influence the ability of p53 to regulate transcription, thereby leading to differences in cancer susceptibility.
title: A novel map of human p53 response elements uncovers evidence of selection pressures and variants similar to Li-Fraumeni Syndrome mutations

finding: This SNP was responsible for variations in hippocampal shape features, and it was also noted to have volumetric associations, further supporting its genetic relevance.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: Rs12369969 was found to influence shape measures of the brain, particularly subcortical structures, and matched previous associations with volumetric analysis.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: This variant was linked to multiple shape features, specifically those in the hippocampus, and showed prior associations with overall hippocampal volume.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: This variant was identified as having an ultra-rare association signal for diastolic blood pressure (DBP) with an allele frequency of 9.31 × 10−6 in the FGD4 gene. It was recognized as a novel finding, which underscores the advantage of using the GEL-UKB dataset in uncovering rare variants associated with traits.
title: A Genomics England haplotype reference panel and the imputation of the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10506114, associated with SYT10/ALG10, showed significant association with low T1D PRS, marking it as a relevant genetic locus for type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs75438334, linked to CHST11, was significantly associated with low T1D PRS, suggesting it may be relevant in type 1 diabetes susceptibility.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs12230138, associated with CHFR/LOC101928530/ZNF605, displayed significant association with low T1D PRS, indicating its potential influence on type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs4767027 was identified as a cis-pQTL associated with circulating OAS1 levels, strongly influencing COVID-19 outcomes, including a reduced risk of COVID-19 death (OR = 0.48), hospitalization (OR = 0.60), and susceptibility (OR = 0.81). It was negatively associated with COVID-19 severity, and its effect on OAS1 levels was confirmed through colocalization analyses suggesting a shared causal signal.
title: Circulating Proteins Influencing COVID-19 Susceptibility and Severity: a Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs17098087-C variant at locus 12q14 was associated with increased blood NfL levels. This finding supports the notion that genetic variations in this region may play a role in neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Genome-wide Association Study Meta-analysis of Neurofilament light (NfL) levels in blood reveals novel loci related to neurodegeneration

finding: The rs73423978-T variant at locus 12q21 was also associated with increased blood NfL levels. This indicates that this region may contribute to the regulation of NfL in the context of neurological traits.
title: Genome-wide Association Study Meta-analysis of Neurofilament light (NfL) levels in blood reveals novel loci related to neurodegeneration

finding: The tolerated missense variant, rs3184504 (allele T), was associated with increased TSH and correlated with an increased risk of both hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism, as well as other autoimmune disorders and pleiotropic associations with multiple traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The intronic variant, rs2393717 (G allele, frequency 47.3% in European ancestry), was associated with increased TSH, reduced hypothyroidism risk, increased tyrosine levels, decreased C-reactive protein, and several metabolic traits, including increased cholesterol.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The SNP rs10507274, part of the MED13L gene cluster, was documented as a male-specific locus linked to lower neuroticism scores and reached genome-wide significance.
title: Sex-specific genetic and transcriptomic liability to neuroticism

finding: The association between the SNP rs407135 within SLC11A2 and Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) was noted as nominally significant in prior research, with a reported p-value of 0.08 from a study involving 216 AD cases and 323 controls. Furthermore, the current study found that reduced expression of SLC11A2 in the brain was strongly associated with increased AD risk, evidenced by a much lower p-value of 4.39×10^-14. This aligned with earlier findings indicating a potential role of SLC11A2 in AD pathophysiology.
title: Brain and Blood Transcriptome-Wide Association Studies Identify Five Novel Genes Associated with Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: Identified as associated with both the rapid progression subtype (Subtype III) and the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), suggesting potential roles in different progression patterns.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: Found to be associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), suggesting it may play a role in attenuating the progression of symptoms.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs2269899 found at the 12q24.13 locus was significantly linked to hospitalized COVID-19 at a genome-wide significant level, indicating its relevance in the genetic architecture of severe COVID-19.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The rs113247976 SNP was identified as a low-frequency coding variant (p.P986L) in KIF5A, posited as the causal variant related to ALS risk.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The rs4075094 SNP was associated with the TBK1 locus where both rare and common variants played a role in ALS risk. The eQTL and mQTL analyses indicated mediation of risk through these variants.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The splice acceptor variant rs10774671 was associated with a significant protective effect against COVID-19 hospitalization among individuals of African ancestry. It conferred a protection magnitude similar to that seen in Europeans, with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.92 (95% CI: 0.86-0.99) in the African population compared to 0.89 (95% CI: 0.86-0.93) in Europeans. The G allele at this locus was significantly associated with reduced severity of COVID-19, demonstrating its role as a protective variant independent of other variants present in non-African populations.
title: Alternative splicing of OAS1 alters the risk for severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs3184504, mapped to the SH2B3 gene, showed strong evidence of colocalization between 19 blood cell traits (BCTs) and two cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), CAD and VTE, with a posterior probability exceeding 0.7, indicating its potential role as a common causal variant.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: The SNP rs4378452, located in the CUX2 gene, was identified as a potential common causal variable between 22 BCTs and CAD, suggesting its involvement in the genetic interplay between blood traits and cardiovascular disease risk.
title: Unveiling Shared Genetic Links between Blood Cell Traits and Cardiovascular Diseases

finding: Located proximal to the ALDH2 gene, the significant vQTL rs191673261 was identified in linkage disequilibrium (LD) with lead vQTL rs572454376 and was associated with platelet crit variance.
title: Genome-wide analyses of variance in blood cell phenotypes provide new insights into complex trait biology and prediction

finding: Similar to rs191673261, rs572454376 was also associated with variance in platelet crit, further emphasizing its linkage with alcohol consumption and blood cell traits.
title: Genome-wide analyses of variance in blood cell phenotypes provide new insights into complex trait biology and prediction

finding: This SNP showed a positive effect on reading ability and has associations with multiple conditions, indicating its relevance.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: This SNP at the ZNF664 locus was associated with adiponectin levels and showed significant heterogeneity in effect sizes.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: This SNP was identified as a putative causal variant associated with adiponectin levels.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide meta-analysis, fine-mapping, and gene prioritization approach to characterize the genetic architecture of adiponectin

finding: The study reported a positive association between the SNP rs11057401 of the CCDC92 gene and the risk of coronary heart disease (CHD), which was supported by literature indicating its potential role as a genetic risk factor for this condition.
title: Direct causal variable discovery leveraging the invariance principle: application in biomedical studies

finding: The SNP rs6487213 was identified as an interacting SNP in the chronicity DILI dataset using the MARS method. It was noted as a suspected allelic variation of the SLCO1B1 gene, which is known to predict elevated serum bilirubin levels. Elevated serum bilirubin has been implicated as a risk factor for chronic Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI), indicating that genetic factors may significantly contribute to inter-individual differences in drug response, particularly in relation to DILI risk.
title: Genetic Connection to Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI) Through Statistical Learning Methods

finding: Identified as the likely causal SNP associated with FEV1 and FVC at locus 12q14.3, rs1351394 was found to influence both lung capacity and anthropometric traits.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The SNP rs11066320 had significant associations with hypothyroidism and sarcoidosis, with verification through different methods indicating strong linkage (PPA4>0.8). This shared locus reinforced the genetic correlation between these diseases.
title: Shared genetic etiology between hypothyroidism and complex diseases: a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs3184504 was confirmed as a common genetic variant between hypothyroidism and sarcoidosis via colocalization analysis (posterior probability >0.9), supporting its role in the genetic link between these diseases.
title: Shared genetic etiology between hypothyroidism and complex diseases: a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs653178 was identified as a risk locus for hypothyroidism and ILD endpoints, providing evidence of its linkage to these conditions within the same genetic framework.
title: Shared genetic etiology between hypothyroidism and complex diseases: a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: Within the framework of the study, rs1602633 was identified as a key SNP on chromosome 3p, contributing to the assessment of allelic imbalances in the context of uveal melanoma and enhancing the understanding of genomic variations.
title: Allele-specific digital PCR enhances precision and sensitivity in the detection and quantification of copy number alterations in heterogeneous DNA samples: an in silico and in vitro validation study

finding: The variant rs34637584, located in the LRRK2 gene, was studied in relation to its effect on the penetrance of Parkinson's disease, specifically in the context of polygenic risk scores (PRS). It was noted that PRS affected the penetrance of the LRRK2 variant, contributing significantly to the risk of developing Parkinson's disease, especially among carriers of rare monogenic variants. This association highlighted the importance of integrating PRS when assessing the overall risk of Parkinson's disease in individuals with specific genetic backgrounds.
title: Assessing the role of polygenic background on the penetrance of monogenic forms in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The study found that ALDH2 DNA methylation was significantly lower in the AUDC+ve group compared to the AUDC-ve group (P < 0.001). Specifically, T-allele carriers in the AUDC+ve group exhibited lower methylation levels (3.5±0.7) relative to T-allele non-carriers (4.0±0.8) with a significance of P=0.01. This indicated a correlation between the T-allele and reduced ALDH2 methylation in individuals with alcohol dependence and cirrhosis.
title: Genetics and Epigenetics of Aldehyde Dehydrogenase (ALDH2) in Alcohol Related Liver Disease

finding: The SNP rs34637584, located in the LRRK2 gene and associated with the p.G2019S mutation, was identified as a significant genetic contributor to familial Parkinson's disease. This mutation accounted for approximately 2% of all Parkinson's disease cases and exhibited a remarkable prevalence in certain populations, such as 20% among Ashkenazi Jewish individuals and 40% among Arab-Berber individuals. Importantly, it was linked to an autosomal dominant form of the disease with incomplete age-dependent penetrance, demonstrating a 28% risk at age 59, escalating to 51% at age 69, and reaching 74% by age 79. Thus, for G2019S-carriers, a highly variable age-at-onset of Parkinson's disease was reported, ranging from 50 to 80 years, even within the same families.
title: Epigenetic clock acceleration is linked to age-at-onset of idiopathic and LRRK2 Parkinson’s disease

finding: This missense variant in the GLS2 gene showed a strong positive effect on offspring birthweight when used as an instrument for maternal glutamine levels.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: This SNP, linked to the SLC38A2 gene, was associated with a positive effect on offspring birthweight by influencing the supply of maternal amino acids to the fetus.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The East Asian-specific intronic variant rs4646776 was reported to have a stronger association with gout in males than in females. In females, the allele frequency was 20.4% and the effect size (se) was -0.10 (p-value = 0.07); in males, the allele frequency was 24.2% with a significantly stronger effect size of -0.29 (p-value = 2.5×10^-36). This disparity was attributed to higher rates of habitual alcohol consumption among males of East Asian ancestry (Mizuno et al., 2015).
title: Global Biobank Meta-analysis Initiative: powering genetic discovery across human diseases

finding: The SNP rs10774625, located at the 12q24.12 locus and identified as an intronic variant of the ATXN2 gene, demonstrated strong pleiotropic associations with various cardiovascular diseases (CVDs), particularly coronary artery disease (CAD). Robust colocalization evidence showed significant correlations between this SNP and leukocyte telomere length (LTL), reinforcing its role as a shared causal variant for multiple CVDs.
title: Contribution of leukocyte telomere length to major cardiovascular diseases onset: phenotypic and genetic insights from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: Identified in an externalizing-specific region (left postcentral), this SNP was associated with Vitamin D Receptor (VDR) and related to ADHD with p-value 7.85×10−9.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: In linkage disequilibrium with rs551123675 and rs529206008, this SNP was related to VDR and linked to ADHD.
title: Common and Disorders-Specific Cortical Thickness Alterations in Internalizing, Externalizing and Thought Disorders in the Preadolescents of the ABCD Study

finding: The G allele of SNP rs10841302, located near AEBP2, was significantly associated with lower values of FEV1/FVC. The study found that the deleterious effect of PM2.5 exposure on FEV1/FVC increased with the number of G alleles, estimating a reduction of 0.073 percentage points of FEV1/FVC per unit increase in PM2.5.
title: Genome-wide gene-air pollution interaction analysis of lung function in 300,000 individuals

finding: This SNP contributed to the identification of several NAFLD loci as a coding missense variant.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs2080403 variant was linked to 3-aminoisobutyrate levels and confirmed as a kidney eQTL for SLC6A13, reinforcing its involvement in kidney metabolic processes.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The SNP rs114572990 in RP11-144F15.1 was suggestively associated (p=4.97×10^-7) based on the combined data.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs4767027 was identified as a strong cis-pQTL associated with circulating OAS1 levels (P=6.20×10−26). This association played a crucial role in determining the relationship between OAS1 levels and COVID-19 outcomes. Specifically, higher OAS1 levels were linked to significantly reduced odds of COVID-19 death or ventilation (OR = 0.48, P = 7×10−8), hospitalization (OR = 0.60, P = 2×10−7), and susceptibility to COVID-19 (OR = 0.81, P = 6×10−5). Hence, the positive association suggested that the MR estimates were likely not due to horizontal pleiotropy.
title: Circulating Proteins Influencing COVID-19 Susceptibility and Severity: a Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: The rs10784050 variant was functionally linked to the ALG10B gene, which encodes a protein implicated in microglial response, relevant to AD pathogenesis and microglial phagocytic function.
title: New genetic loci discovery for Alzheimer’s disease using explainable deep neural networks

finding: The index SNP rs3184504, mapped to the SH2B3 locus, was identified as a loss-of-function variant associated with chronic kidney disease (CKD) phenotypes. This SNP had a combined beta of -0.046 and a p-value of 3.1E-56, indicating strong association with CKD beyond its previously recognized links to blood pressure and other metabolic conditions. Moreover, it was the first time this missense SNP was explicitly linked to human kidney function.
title: A multi-phenotype approach implicates SH2B3 in the genetics of chronic kidney disease

finding: The intronic SNP rs11247009-A in the GALNT9 gene was reported to be associated with BMI, showing a very strong association with a p-value of 6 x 10^-9. This finding indicated a new potential genetic factor influencing BMI, although the prior evidence linking GALNT9 to BMI was limited.
title: Weighted burden analysis in 200 000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects characterises effects of rare genetic variants on BMI

finding: Establishing its relevance, rs10774671 was found to have significant allele frequency differences (p-value=0.0035) between COVID patients and the general population, confirming its association with COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: Significant frequency differences for rs2660 were observed (p-value=0.007), confirming its previous associations with COVID-19 severity.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: This SNP was confirmed with significant allele frequency differences (p-value=0.00501), relating it to COVID-19 susceptibility.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: The allele frequency for rs1859330 showed significant differences (p-value=2.9E-05) in the context of COVID-19, confirming its previously reported association.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: This rare allele at the CCND2 locus had protective associations with T2D risk and was significantly linked with lower fasting glucose and HbA1c levels.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs3782886 in the BRAP gene was associated with lung function, specifically FEV1, with a P-value of 4.20×10^-8 and a beta of 0.0219. Additionally, this SNP had previous associations with traits such as alcohol use disorder, high-density lipoprotein levels, and type 2 diabetes.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: This SNP had significant implications for PSA levels and was associated with prostate cancer risk.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs3184504 at the SH2B3 locus, in tight linkage disequilibrium with the top SNP, showed a significant P-value while being a missense variant in the SH2B3 gene, though it was predicted to be benign.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs7487637 at the HDAC7 locus was highlighted for its association with IgA levels, presenting a Beta of 0.05 and a P-value of 9.97×10^-15.
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: The rs10774671 splice variant located in the OAS1 gene exhibited a protective effect against COVID-19 hospitalization in individuals of African ancestry. Specifically, the G allele was found to confer a protection against severe COVID-19 with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.92, similar to the protective effect observed in individuals of European ancestry (OR = 0.89), although the allele frequency was higher in the African cohort (66%) compared to the European cohort (35%). This splice variant is associated with changes in the splicing of OAS1, leading to a longer and more active enzyme.
title: Alternative splicing of OAS1 alters the risk for severe COVID-19

finding: The variant rs76919663 was significant with an HR of 1.48 (95% CI 1.30 – 1.67), P = 9.8×10^-10. It was noted to be present only among individuals of African and Hispanic ancestry.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: Significant in the study and indicated to have a consistent association direction with CAD in T2D populations.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: The SNP rs3751262, located in the LOH12CR1 gene, was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with lead signals and was associated with pelvic organ prolapse, having a p-value of 2.89 × 10^-7.
title: Advancing our understanding of genetic risk factors and potential personalized strategies in pelvic organ prolapse: largest GWAS to date reveals 19 novel associated loci

finding: This SNP at 12q24.12 is specific to East Asian populations, influencing the ALDH2 gene implicated in various metabolic traits and depression regulation.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and SCZ in East Asians
