title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: The SNP rs3782886, found in the BRAP gene, was also identified as a lead variant associated with AUD and was located near the ALDH2 gene locus. Its discovery was significant (p = 1.68×10⁻²⁹) and it has been associated with various traits, including alcohol use and metabolism, reflecting the genetic architecture related to AUD.
title: Genome-wide Meta-analysis of Alcohol Use Disorder in East Asians

finding: The rs200138614 SNP was linked to carcinoid syndrome through a p.Cys712Phe mutation in LRG5, showing a strong association with a P-value of 4×10^-9.
title: Leveraging large-scale multi-omics to identify therapeutic targets from genome-wide association studies

finding: The genetic variant rs34673751 from the ACADS gene, which encodes the enzyme short-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase essential for mitochondrial fatty acid beta-oxidation, was significantly associated with butyrylcarnitine levels. Individuals carrying the A allele exhibited stable higher blood butyrylcarnitine levels, while heterozygous individuals showed intermediate levels.
title: Longitudinal analysis of genetic and environmental interplay in human metabolic profiles and the implication for metabolic health

finding: The variant rs3138141 located in RDH5 was previously reported to be associated with high myopia, and it attained significance in the cross-population meta-analysis with a P-value of 4.69 × 10^-9.
title: Sequencing of 19,219 exomes identifies a low-frequency variant in FKBP5 promoter predisposing to high myopia in a Han Chinese population

finding: Although not directly analyzed in this study, rs7313473 had been previously linked to breast cancer through regulation of the ATG10 promoter activity, suggesting its role as a tumor suppressor.
title: Mapping of cis-regulatory variants by differential allelic expression analysis identifies candidate causal variants and target genes of 41 breast cancer risk loci

finding: The variant near the vitamin D receptor (VDR) gene, rs112726671, was associated with increased risk of HPV(-) OPC (OR: 1.23, 95% CI: 1.14, 1.32; p=2.19×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: <italic>LRRK2</italic> rs76904798 was found to synergistically protect against verbal memory impairment associated with Parkinson's disease.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: At the 12q24.21 locus, the lead intergenic variant rs10774740 was identified as a common variant with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.37, achieving a statistically significant association with PUV (P=7.81x10^-12; OR 0.40). This variant was replicated in an independent European cohort, though with a smaller effect size (P=1.9x10^-3; OR 0.78). It was shown to be located near the transcription factor TBX5, with functional validation indicating involvement in normal human urinary tract development.
title: Mixed ancestry analysis of whole-genome sequencing identifies TBX5 and PTK7 as susceptibility genes for posterior urethral valves

finding: The SNP rs10735079 was identified in the GWAS by Pairo-Castineira et al. as one of the strong genetic signals associated with COVID-19 severity. This SNP was also present in the Indian Genome Variation Consortium (IGVC), suggesting its relevance to susceptibility to COVID-19 among Indian sub-populations.
title: Genetic risk prediction of COVID-19 susceptibility and severity in the Indian population

finding: The analysis included significant evidence of publication bias for the rs4149056 SNP. Initially, the odds ratio (OR) was reported as 1.63 (95% CI [1.34–1.99]), indicating an association with statin-associated muscle symptoms (SAMS). However, after correcting for publication bias using the Trim and Fill method, the OR was reduced to 1.23 (95% CI [0.96–1.58]), suggesting that the initial OR was overestimated. The sensitivity analysis also supported moderate evidence of publication bias.
title: Publication bias in pharmacogenetics of statin-associated muscle symptoms, an umbrella review with a meta-epidemiological study

finding: This synonymous SNP in RDH5 was linked with retinal thickness through pixel-level analysis. It is known to code for the visual cycle enzyme 11-cis retinol dehydrogenase 5, essential for night vision, and mutations cause fundus albipunctatus.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: This SNP indicated a distinct association pattern focused within the fovea, overlapping with a retinal eQTL for TSPAN11 and a GWAS hit for optic disc morphology.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: This SNP was associated with ankylosing spondylitis and nominated for its role between GWAS traits of mean corpuscular hemoglobin and mean corpuscular volume in relation to the MLF2 gene.
title: Genetic determinants of gene expression noise and its role in complex trait variation

finding: Variant rs4149056, a missense variant in the SLCO1B1 gene, was associated with multiple oxylipins, explaining 6.78% of the variance of HpODE trait. This variant was shared among all 16 SLCO1B1-associated metabolites.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: This variant was identified as the top secondary variant in all conditional analyses involving SLCO1B1-associated metabolites, indicating its potential relevance in the shared genetic architecture of fatty acids and oxylipins.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals shared and distinct genetic architecture underlying fatty acid and bioactive oxylipin metabolites in the Hispanic Community Health Study/Study of Latinos (HCHS/SOL)

finding: The SNP rs10879354 in intron 8 of the TPH2 gene consistently exhibited effects on perinatal depression across multiple time points (greater than or equal to 31 weeks gestation, 48-72 hours postpartum, and 6-8 months postpartum) within a German population, suggesting a strong relevance to perinatal depression symptoms.
title: A sum of its parts: A systematic review evaluating biopsychosocial and behavioral determinants of perinatal depression

finding: The SNP rs11060180 was associated with the gene PTK2B, which is frequently expressed in the nervous system and implicated in Alzheimer's disease for its role in synaptic homeostasis. In the context of Parkinson's disease (PD), this SNP was identified as a PD-risk allele with a significant p-value of 1.12×10−4, linking it directly to the pathology of PD and establishing a connection between genetic risk factors and the severity of motor symptoms as measured by the UPDRS-III scale.
title: Plasma acellular transcriptome contains Parkinson’s disease signatures that can inform clinical diagnosis

finding: At the ALDH2 locus, the common T allele of rs6490056 was associated with increased SBP levels (P=1.9×10⁻¹⁰), with a larger effect observed in the 'current smoking' exposure group (Interaction P=2.6×10⁻⁵). This indicated that higher oxidative stress due to smoking might exacerbate blood pressure elevations linked to this variant.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: At the TMEM116 locus, the common T allele of rs6490056 was linked to increased MAP measures (P=5.7×10⁻¹¹) with a more significant effect in the 'ever smoking' exposure group (Interaction P=3.3×10⁻⁵). This highlighted the role of smoking in modulating the expression of TMEM116 and its potential impact on blood pressure.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: SNP rs1800801 was associated with a downregulation effect of the T allele in cartilage (meta-Φ=0.37), indicating that the risk allele negatively impacted <italic>MGP</italic> expression relevant to OA.
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: SNP rs4236 showed a downregulation effect of the C risk allele in subchondral bone (meta-Φ=0.33) similar to the effect seen in cartilage for <italic>MGP</italic>, suggesting a consistent mechanism across tissues.
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: The rs10735079 SNP was noted to be present in the top eight robust associations identified by a GWAS which linked it to COVID-19 severity, particularly regarding antiviral defense mechanisms and inflammatory responses.
title: Genetic risk prediction of COVID-19 susceptibility and severity in the Indian population

finding: In the context of investigating genetic factors associated with Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI), the SNP rs6487213 was identified as an interacting SNP in a chronicity DILI dataset through the MARS method. It was characterized as a variant of the gene SLCO1B1, which is associated with elevated serum bilirubin levels, a known risk factor for chronic DILI. Thus, this finding highlighted its potential role in genetic susceptibility to DILI.
title: Genetic Connection to Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI) Through Statistical Learning Methods

finding: The SNP, rs6487213, was identified as a suspected allelic variation of the gene SLCO1B1, which acts as a predictor of elevated serum bilirubin. Elevated serum bilirubin is known to be a risk factor related to chronic Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI). MARS, a statistical method used in the study, retrieved rs6487213 as part of its interacting SNPs from the chronicity DILI dataset.
title: Genetic Connection to Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI) Through Statistical Learning Methods

finding: The rs1169288 variant (encoding p.I27L) was significantly associated with the predicted HNF1A liver expression score, with a p-value less than 2 x 10^-16. This variant had previously been associated with various metabolic phenotypes, emphasizing its role in affecting liver expression and associated metabolic processes.
title: Human gain-of-function variants in HNF1A confer protection from diabetes but independently increase hepatic secretion of multiple cardiovascular disease risk factors

finding: This SNP was found significantly associated with both Subtype III (rapid progression) and Subtype I (mild progression), indicating a potential role in different progression patterns of Parkinson's disease.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: This SNP was associated with Subtype I but also had relevance in distinguishing Subtypes I and II, suggesting its role in mild progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: SNP rs2138543 was associated with TLA between 6am and 8am, highlighting its significance in early morning activity patterns and possibly influencing overall daily activity levels.
title: Genome-wide association studies of 27 accelerometry-derived physical activity measurements identifies novel loci and genetic mechanisms

finding: A rare missense variant rs61751321 (in KNTC1) was associated with a reduced risk of mLOY phenotype (OR = 0.58; P = 7.7 x 10^-9), indicating a potential protective role.
title: Exome sequencing of 628,388 individuals identifies common and rare variant associations with clonal hematopoiesis phenotypes

finding: The rs1491942 variant in the LRRK2 gene was identified as a risk factor for Parkinson's Disease (PD) development with an odds ratio (OR) of 2.26 (p=0.01). This finding was particularly significant among patients who had a high proportion of Native American ancestry (≥56.6%).
title: MEX-PD: A National Network for the Epidemiological & Genetic Research of Parkinson’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs7977233 was associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) and reached a genome-wide significance threshold (p = 1.47 x 10^-8) in the analysis. This finding highlighted its relevance in CAD genetics.
title: Machine Learning Reveals the Contribution of Rare Genetic Variants and Enhances Risk Prediction for Coronary Artery Disease in the Japanese Population

finding: The SNP rs3782886 was similarly associated with coronary artery disease (CAD), also reaching a genome-wide significance threshold (p = 1.47 x 10^-8). This connection reinforced its importance in the genetic landscape of CAD.
title: Machine Learning Reveals the Contribution of Rare Genetic Variants and Enhances Risk Prediction for Coronary Artery Disease in the Japanese Population

finding: This SNP was not directly within SYT10 but was associated with mortality, impacting SYT10 expression and showing a nominal association with reduced longevity (beta = -0.008, p=0.003).
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The variant rs3782449 within the RBM19 gene was suggestively significant for UC, showing a protective direction of effect (OR=0.73, P-value=8.90×10^-6). This variant was replicated with P-values of 0.00738 in the IIBDGC dataset.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: This variant was associated with ocular manifestations in IBD but also showed a suggestive protective direction (allele frequency of 2.2%, P-value=0.64, OR=0.92) when analyzed in the context of UC.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The SNP rs17442721 was found to be protective against dementia, with an odds ratio of 0.43 (95% CI = 0.32 - 0.57, P = 1.44e-08). This SNP tags the LRRK2 G2019S variant and demonstrated that dementia rates in carriers were significantly lower, although it lost genome-wide significance when conditioned on the G2019S variant.
title: Investigation of the genetic aetiology of Lewy body diseases with and without dementia

finding: The risk allele of rs324015, associated with the <italic>STAT6</italic> gene, was found to significantly increase post-transcriptional activities in experiments, enhancing luciferase signals compared to reference alleles. This implicates it in the oncogenic roles related to colorectal cancer.
title: Large-scale alternative polyadenylation (APA)-wide association studies to identify putative susceptibility genes in human common cancers

finding: For rs2280503, related to <italic>DIP2B</italic>, the risk allele showed a significant increase in post-transcriptional activity in luciferase assays, indicating its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Large-scale alternative polyadenylation (APA)-wide association studies to identify putative susceptibility genes in human common cancers

finding: The rs76895963 SNP, associated with the CCND2-AS1 locus, was identified as one of the seven shared genetic markers found in both type 2 diabetes and depression.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The association between rs10774625, nearest gene SH2B3/ATXN2, and coeliac disease was reported as genome-wide significant in both the UK Biobank (p = 1.3 × 10⁻⁶) and FinnGen (p = 2.1 × 10⁻¹⁰). This finding was a positive original discovery related to the disease trait coeliac disease.
title: Leveraging molecular-QTL co-association to predict novel disease-associated genetic loci using a graph convolutional neural network

finding: The SNP rs183884396 was identified within the TESPA1 locus, showing a high posterior inclusion probability of 0.99. This variant exhibited significant enrichment in the Finnish population, suggesting a population-specific genetic influence on atopic dermatitis.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The mQTL variant rs28577594 associated with high-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels was significantly more prevalent in UKB-EUR (0.723) than UKB-AFR (0.171), indicating its clinical relevance.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: Rs56350303's association with AC091814.2 was identified, indicating its potential regulatory role in immune response, although specific findings were not detailed.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs7487683 was discovered to be associated with lung cancer in the meta-analysis performed at the 12p13.33 locus.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: The missense variant rs11057401, associated with the gene CCDC92, was identified through MR analysis to have links to metabolic and inflammatory traits. Genetic ablation of CCDC92 suggested its role in reducing levels of inflammatory markers related to heart failure.
title: Large-scale Mendelian randomization identifies novel pathways as therapeutic targets for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction and with preserved ejection fraction

finding: The SNP rs3825393, located in the exonic region of the MYO1H gene, was notable as it was shared between anxiety and major depression, indicating cross-disorder relevance.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The nonsynonymous SNP rs3184504 within the SH2B3 gene was associated with several health conditions, including ischemic stroke and autoimmune diseases, alongside its significant correlation with hypertension. In rodent models, mutations in SH2B3 were linked to reduced hypertension and renal disease via signaling from SH2B3-mutated bone marrow cells, demonstrating its role in inflammatory signaling associated with hypertension.
title: Recessive and sex-dependent genetic effects in primary hypertension

finding: The rs4760682 variant located in the PFKM gene was robustly associated with plasma pyruvate levels, providing evidence for its implication in glycolysis pathway and red blood cell survival.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: The rs3819817 variant near the HAL gene demonstrated associations with vitamin D levels and skin cancer risk, indicating its role as an eQTL affecting HAL expression and related biological pathways.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: The rs61937878 variant in the HAL gene was associated with vitamin D levels as well as plasma histidine, confirming its influence on important metabolic pathways including histidine catabolism.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: The rs117991621 variant in the HAL gene was linked to plasma histidine levels and exhibited a robust association with vitamin D levels, indicating its significance in metabolic regulation.
title: Mendelian randomisation with proxy exposures: challenges and opportunities

finding: The SNP rs4149056, located in the SLCO1B1 gene, was associated with the odds of missingness in five metabolites, including two bile acids and two estrone metabolites. This finding was biologically plausible due to its established links to statin-induced myopathy and interactions with bile acids and cholesterol.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs7302200 was identified as the lead variant in the complex 12q13.2 region associated with type 1 diabetes risk, showing significant association (OR = 1.31, P = 7.74 x 10^-13) across diverse ancestries.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: At the SH2B3 locus, SNP rs597808 was the most significant variant associated with type 1 diabetes risk, displaying a significant odds ratio (OR = 1.27, P = 4.82 x 10^-11) and being in high linkage disequilibrium with previously identified variants.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs11171747 near the ERBB3 gene was identified as the most significant variant associated with age at onset of type 1 diabetes (OR = 1.17, P = 1.20 x 10^-8), suggesting independent effects in the broader genetic landscape of type 1 diabetes.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: At the SH2B3 locus, rs1265564 was found to be associated with age at onset (OR = 1.16, P = 1.38 x 10^-7), indicating its relevance in the genetic predisposition to earlier onset of type 1 diabetes.
title: A multi-ancestry genome-wide association study in type 1 diabetes

finding: The intronic SNP rs74651308 found in SLCO1A2 exhibited significant association with PSP (p = 2.86 × 10^-7, beta = 0.51), reflecting its involvement in the disease.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The missense SNP rs11568563 in high LD with rs74651308 presented evidence of association with PSP (p = 1.45 × 10^-6, beta = 0.47), confirming associations within the SLCO1A2 locus.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: SNP rs147124286 showed association with PSP (p = 4.39 × 10^-7, beta = -0.35) linked to SP1, relating to transcriptional regulatory networks in the disease context.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The lead SNP rs12817984 was significantly associated with PSP (p = 8.91 × 10^-8, beta = -0.37), affirming the contribution of SP1 locus to PSP pathology.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was linked with SH2B3, which is known to influence immune function and has been associated with preeclampsia pathogenesis. It was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with the lead variant for coronary artery disease risk at this locus and associated with notable hematological and immune-related protein levels.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis identifies novel maternal risk variants and enables polygenic prediction of preeclampsia and gestational hypertension

finding: The variant rs144998814 was associated with testosterone levels in men (β = 0.133, P = 2.34E-16), suggesting its potential impact on obesity-related reproductive issues.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was associated with alternative splicing of the OAS1 gene, where the protective 'G' allele led to a more active OAS1 enzyme, influencing COVID-19 severity.
title: Whole Genome DNA and RNA Sequencing of Whole Blood Elucidates the Genetic Architecture of Gene Expression Underlying a Wide Range of Diseases

finding: The low-frequency missense variant rs61937878 in the HAL gene was significantly associated with histidine and glycine, showcasing a more limited pleiotropic effect compared to other variants.
title: Genome-wide association study for circulating metabolites in 619,372 individuals

finding: The LRRK2 N551K mutation (rs7308720) was identified as a homozygous variant in the early-onset leprosy twins and was deemed a candidate variant underscoring the early onset phenotype. This SNP had been previously implicated as a protective factor for Crohn's disease.
title: Early onset leprosy reveals a joint effect of LRRK2 and NOD2 variants

finding: The LRRK2 R1398H mutation (rs7133914) was found to be a homozygous variant in the same twins, contributing to the early onset leprosy phenotype, and also considered a protective factor for Crohn's disease.
title: Early onset leprosy reveals a joint effect of LRRK2 and NOD2 variants

finding: This SNP is associated with the SOX5 gene, which was highlighted for its critical role in joint morphogenesis. It was the only genome-wide significant signal that was not found in the previous Rotterdam Study.
title: Investigation of the genetic architecture of cam morphology, and its relationship with hip osteoarthritis, using alpha angle as a proxy measure

finding: The variant in HNF1A (rs2135845768) was associated with altered expression of four proteins (ACE2, CTRC, OSM, TGF-alpha), indicating its involvement in glycemic control and diabetes.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: This rare variant was related to DCN, also showing significant association with protein levels not commonly detected in European populations.
title: Genetic regulation of the plasma proteome and its link to cardiometabolic disease in Greenlandic Inuit

finding: The T allele of rs17836273 was associated with an increased odds ratio (OR) of 1.43 (p = 0.012) for COVID-19 fatality compared to non-fatal cases. This SNP caused an alanine to threonine substitution (A98T) located in the second EF-hand motif of the Rab46 protein, which is critical for calcium binding and protein function.
title: EFCAB4B (CRACR2A) genetic variants associated with COVID-19 fatality

finding: The T allele of rs36030417 was linked to an OR of 1.39 (p = 0.013) for COVID-19 fatality versus non-fatal cases. This SNP caused a histidine to glutamine substitution (H212Q) in the coiled-coil domain of Rab46, which is vital for protein-protein interactions.
title: EFCAB4B (CRACR2A) genetic variants associated with COVID-19 fatality

finding: The C allele of rs9788233 was significantly associated with an OR of 1.51 (p = 0.004) for mortality in COVID-19 patients. This SNP resulted in an arginine to glycine change (R7G) at the N-terminus of the protein Rab46, occurring in a structurally undefined region.
title: EFCAB4B (CRACR2A) genetic variants associated with COVID-19 fatality

finding: The SNP rs1017301, located on Chromosome 12 at position 9210335, showed a significant association with the protein network when analyzed using the NetSHy approach. Specifically, it achieved a p-value of 2.38×10^-13 with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.33. This SNP's significance was notably contrasted with the NoNet approach, where it did not reach statistical significance, demonstrating NetSHy's enhanced analytical capability.
title: NetSHy: Network Summarization via a Hybrid Approach Leveraging Topological Properties

finding: The SNP rs76904798 was found to be associated with the expression levels of 14 unique proteins in the context of Parkinson's disease (PD). This association was established through a phenome-wide association study (PheWAS) which used the largest CSF protein quantitative trait loci (pQTL) dataset. Additionally, the minor allele (T) of this SNP was correlated with increased expression levels of LRRK2.
title: Proteome Wide Association Studies of LRRK2 variants identify novel causal and druggable for Parkinson’s disease

finding: Similar to rs76904798, the SNP chr12:40220632:C:T was linked to 14 proteins related to PD risk through PheWAS analysis. In this analysis, it was highlighted as a key risk variant for PD, with the study confirming SNP involvement in the modulation of protein levels.
title: Proteome Wide Association Studies of LRRK2 variants identify novel causal and druggable for Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP chr12:40035894:C:T was noted for having negative effect sizes associated with 16 proteins identified in PD analyses. This relationship was established in conjunction with the protein analysis performed in the context of the broader LRRK2 locus.
title: Proteome Wide Association Studies of LRRK2 variants identify novel causal and druggable for Parkinson’s disease

finding: The rare missense variant in VWF was linked to an increased risk of von Willebrand disease, demonstrating a significant association at a population level.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: Identified as a top SNP by both IBI and GWAS, this variant showcased its importance in the context of hypertension studies.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the odds of missingness of multiple metabolites including bile acids and steroid metabolites. It was associated with five metabolite levels including estrone metabolites and has implications for statin-induced myopathy.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs10843036 was specifically associated with pregnancy zone protein (PZP) in females. This association suggested a sex-specific genetic regulation of PZP that is relevant to female reproductive health.
title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: This SNP correlated with transcript levels of the RPS18 gene in the coronary artery, exhibiting a protective effect against CAD, as indicated by an odds ratio (OR) of 0.74 (95% CI: 0.68 – 0.81).
title: Integrative multi-ethnic Mendelian randomisation identifies tissue-specific causal genes for Coronary Artery Disease and interactions with post-acute Covid

finding: The lead variant rs10774671 was noted to show an increase in odds ratios for severe COVID-19, suggesting an association with critical illness, despite not passing the specific P-value threshold for significant severity association.
title: Mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19 by worldwide meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs12146727 was associated with the C1s protein and was found to share genetic variants with MI risk based on the colocalization analysis.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian Randomization Analysis Identified Potential Drug Targets for Myocardial Infarction

finding: The rs111337717 variant was found to be a significant genetic risk factor for severe COVID-19, with a notable presence in symptomatic COVID-19 cases as compared to asymptomatic individuals, reflecting its association with disease severity.
title: Targeting ATP2B1 impairs PI3K/Akt/Fox-O3 signaling and reduces SARS-COV-2 replication in vivo

finding: In the context of Parkinson's disease (PD), the study found that individuals with heterozygous and homozygous 'T' alleles at LRRK2 rs76904798 were coded as having a specific risk configuration. This finding highlighted the genetic component associated with PD risk depending on the LRRK2 genotype.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: The analysis of LRRK2 G2019S at rs34637584 indicated that individuals with heterozygous or homozygous 'A' alleles were associated with an increased genetic risk for Parkinson's disease (PD). This provided evidence that specific mutations in LRRK2 could influence PD risk.
title: Gut-Brain Nexus: Mapping Multi-Modal Links to Neurodegeneration at Biobank Scale

finding: The study by Wang et al. (2015) reported that the MDM2-rs2279744 polymorphism was associated with an increased risk of lung cancer in a Northeastern Chinese population. This finding indicated a potential genetic susceptibility related to the MDM2 gene, which may have implications in cancer risk assessment.
title: A Cost-effectiveness analysis of Nivolumab plus chemotherapy for the first-line treatment of locally advanced or metastatic gastric/GEJ/oesophageal adenocarcinoma in the United States of America

finding: The missense variant rs200735214 in DDX51 was significantly associated with fat-free muscle volume in the right posterior thigh, showing an effect of -0.87 L and an effect size of -1.09 s.d. units (P = 1.5 × 10^-10), indicating a potential involvement in muscle traits.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The association of rs2239194 with spleen volume was reaffirmed by the gene-level burden test, showing its status as an eQTL in spleen tissue and reinforcing the connection to TNFRSF13B's role in immune function.
title: Mapping rare protein-coding variants on multi-organ imaging traits

finding: The SNP rs11172113 was located in the LRP1-STAT6-SDR9C7 region on chromosome 12 and was identified as the most significantly associated locus with a P value of 1.24 × 10-62. This SNP was previously reported and was associated with self-reported headache, indicating a strong genetic link.
title: A meta-analysis of the genome-wide association studies on two genetically correlated phenotypes (self-reported headache and self-reported migraine) identifies four new risk loci for headaches (N=397,385)

finding: The SNP rs1800693, which is mapped to an intron of TNFRSF1A, was associated with pneumonia with P = 5.5 × 10−8. This suggested an involvement in the inflammatory response pertinent to pneumonia pathology.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of pneumonia suggests a role for mucin biology and provides novel drug repurposing opportunities

finding: The rare variant rs115924439 was also associated with venous thromboembolism, further reinforcing the significance of rare genetic variations in VTE risk.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The variant rs1265565 was implicated in CUX2 associated with developmental disorders but was also prioritized due to its proximity to other relevant genes.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The rs10774671 SNP was linked to genes OAS1 and OAS3 on chromosome 12, with its influence on COVID-19 severity underscored by the presence of coding variants associated with impaired function of these genes. Specifically, variants like Arginine to Lysine substitution (rs1859330) in OAS3, which is in high linkage disequilibrium (LD=0.8) with rs10774671, correlated with decreased production of interferon gamma and thus were tied to increased susceptibility to viral infections.
title: Common, low-frequency, rare, and ultra-rare coding variants contribute to COVID-19 severity

finding: The polymorphism rs1859330, resulting in an Arginine to Lysine substitution, indicated a reduction in interferon gamma production and was associated with severity of viral illnesses. This SNP was critical in understanding the genetic predisposition to COVID-19 severity, contributing to the discussion on the OAS/RNASEL pathway's role against viral infections.
title: Common, low-frequency, rare, and ultra-rare coding variants contribute to COVID-19 severity

finding: The variant in <italic>ADAMTS20</italic> (chr12:43573874:T:G) also co-segregated with common variants in EFIGA families, indicating its potential involvement in the genetic landscape of Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs2072579 was analyzed to validate the performance of the ICE algorithm. The analysis confirmed that the PGP1 iPSC line was homozygous G/G and the HEK293 line was homozygous C/C. Different editing outcomes were simulated, showing that the ICE predictions correlated highly with expected percentages of single base editing outcomes as the HEK293 cell line was edited to produce homozygous G/G at this SNP.
title: Inference of CRISPR Edits from Sanger Trace Data

finding: Strong evidence for selection was found on rs12821256 located in the KITLG gene, with a selection coefficient estimated at approximately 0.016. This SNP is associated with blonde hair color.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs7955964, located in the FIGNL2/ANKRD33 gene, showed significant 1 degree of freedom (1df) interactions with long sleep duration (LTST) in a multi-ancestry analysis composed of 62,969 individuals. This finding was replicated in an additional 59,296 individuals. Given ANKRD33's role in circadian rhythm regulation and the neurohormonal systems, it suggested a link between long sleep and elevated blood pressure through neuroendocrine pathways.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide gene-sleep interactions identify novel loci for blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs79755767 was located in a significant CRE for NFE2 and revealed trans-effects on 134 genes, consistent with its role as a transcription factor relevant to platelet and megakaryocyte development.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: The genetic variant Arg40Cys in hP2X2 (rs75585377) was identified through analysis of aggregated PHEWAS data from the UK Biobank. This variant was statistically associated with several blood phenotypes including corpuscular volume (with a -log10(p-value) of 15.23), reticulocyte volume (-log10(p-value): 13.08), corpuscular haemoglobin (-log10(p-value): 12.75), and sphered cell volume (-log10(p-value): 9.17). Although the mutation's rP2X2 equivalent (R28C) showed no significant effect on apparent ATP affinity, further functional studies were suggested to assess any potentially significant clinical impacts of the Arg40Cys variant in the human P2X2 receptor due to its observed lower conservation in the N-terminus across P2X2R orthologs.
title: P2X2 receptor subunit interfaces are missense variant hotspots where mutations tend to increase apparent ATP affinity

finding: The SNP rs11060850 was implicated in the epigenetic regulation of TRAIL signaling, which might have implications for cancer therapy, particularly in the context of acute myeloid leukaemia (AML). This finding highlighted the significance of TRIL signaling in therapeutic strategies targeting differentiation pathways.
title: HDAC inhibitor derivatives induce differentiation of leukemic cells through two distinct and separable mechanisms

finding: This SNP was identified as a cis-rQTL associated with CD69 protein, contributing to the intricate network around NFATC1 and its related proteins.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: The rs3184504 polymorphism was identified as significantly associated with increased risk for Type 1 Diabetes (T1D). This variant encodes a hypomorphic form of the SH2B3 protein, which was critical in regulating peripheral T cell tolerance. The SH2B3 risk haplotype related to this SNP was found to contribute to enhanced T cell response against self-antigens, leading to autoimmune pathogenesis in both human subjects and murine models.
title: Reduced function of the adaptor SH2B3 promotes T1D via altered gc cytokine-regulated, T cell intrinsic immune tolerance

finding: The sentinel SNP rs7305885 was associated with the disruption of the ETV5 motif in the promoter of DDX11, correlating with reduced acetylation and reduced gene expression.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The study presented evidence that SNP rs1006737 in the CACNA1C gene was associated with the interaction of stress exposure, specifically early-life stress, to determine the cortisol-awakening response, which serves as a clinical indicator of HPA axis activity. This finding highlighted the potential role of this SNP in moderating the risk for depressive symptoms and bipolar disorder in relation to stress, contributing to a better understanding of its impact on neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Reduced gene dosage of the psychiatric risk gene Cacna1c is associated with impairments in hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis activity in rats

finding: The rs11614913 SNP in hsa-miR-196a-3p showed a derived T allele associated with reduced risks of breast and gastrointestinal cancers, particularly in Asian populations.
title: Signatures of genetic variation in human microRNAs point to processes of positive selection related to population-specific disease risks

finding: The SNP rs17801742 was associated with Stickler Syndrome (OMIM #108300), which affects craniofacial development, and it was found to downregulate PFKM expression in the cerebellum—a gene involved in aerobic glycolysis. It was also highlighted that this SNP falls within a region of modern human positive selection.
title: Derived Homo sapiens cis-eQTL regulation: implications for brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs41317939 was identified as another downregulating eQTL related to Stickler Syndrome (OMIM #108300), showing a similar association with the downregulation of PFKM in the cerebellum and its link to craniofacial structural changes.
title: Derived Homo sapiens cis-eQTL regulation: implications for brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs16917496 was found to be associated with colorectal cancer (CRC) in a study involving Iranian populations. This polymorphism occurred at the miR-502 binding site of the lysine methyltransferase 5A (SET8), which indicates its potential role in the pathology of CRC as highlighted in the context of SETD8's function in oncogenic signaling and transcriptional regulation.
title: APC coordinates GSK3 phosphorylation of SETD8 to suppress colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs76895963 was found to be causally linked to type-2 diabetes (T2D) and was associated with reduced susceptibility in GWAS studies. Additionally, it was noted as a provisional therapeutic target for beta cell proliferation and demonstrated pleiotropic effects on HbA1c levels in blood.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The rs2228570 variant of the vitamin D receptor gene was associated with sporadic essential tremor. This finding suggested a genetic link between vitamin D receptor polymorphism and the occurrence of dyskinesia, particularly in the context of L-DOPA induced dyskinesia (LID) and its modulation by Vitamin D3 (VD3).
title: Amelioration of L-DOPA-induced dyskinesia with vitamin D3 in Parkinsonian mice model

finding: The SNP rs1156242 was a positive original finding associated with intron levels of FAR2, co-localizing with a GWAS variant for interleukin-27 levels, indicating potential co-transcriptional regulation with a neighboring gene.
title: Disentangling genetic effects on transcriptional and post-transcriptional gene regulation through integrating exon and intron expression QTLs

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was found to be strongly associated with hundreds of different traits according to the GWAS Catalog. Its effect on LDL-C in relation to stroke demonstrated multi-modality, with one identifiable mode linked to this SNP. This mode was negated when rs3184504 was removed from consideration, highlighting its role as a significant outlier influencing the relationship between the risk factor and disease outcomes.
title: Causal inference for heritable phenotypic risk factors using heterogeneous genetic instruments

finding: The SNP rs11066188, associated with celiac disease, showed rising frequency for around 9,000 years, indicating prolonged selection that challenges earlier assumptions of recent adaptation.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: Similar to rs11066188, the SNP rs653178, linked to rheumatoid arthritis, demonstrated increased frequency for approximately 9,000 years, suggesting long-term selection that was previously underestimated.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs35907548 was found to be a likely regulatory variant within an active enhancer affecting the expression of the SLC15A4 gene and other nearby genes. The risk allele T was associated with enhanced regulatory activity demonstrated through luciferase assays, elevated target gene expression, and established long-range chromatin interactions with gene promoters. This finding was specifically linked to systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) susceptibility, highlighting its significant role in cellular physiology, particularly in functions such as endolysosomal acidification.
title: A Non-Coding Variant in SLC15A4 Modulates Enhancer Activity and Lysosomal Deacidification Linked to Lupus Susceptibility

finding: The study indicated that low expression of <italic>GZMB</italic> was significantly associated with poor patient survival in the basal subtype of breast cancer. As patients with <italic>GZMB</italic>-low/<italic>ING4</italic>-low tumors had the worst survival outcomes (HR=2.80, 95% CI 1.36-5.75, p=0.0004), this finding emphasized the role of <italic>GZMB</italic> in the immune landscape within ING4-deficient tumors.
title: Tumor immune microenvironment permissive to metastatic progression of ING4-deficient breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs4766664 was identified as a protective variant against severe COVID-19, with a p-value of 5.7e-9 and associated with approximately a 14% reduction in risk (OR = 0.86, 95% CI: 0.82-0.91). This haplotype, inherited from Neandertals, provided a less significant but protective effect compared to other risk factors.
title: A genetic variant protective for COVID-19 is inherited from Neanderthals

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was highlighted for its impact on splicing and was associated with protection against West Nile Virus. This Neandertal haplotype variant, representing a splice acceptor site, linked to the OAS1 gene, was derived from the ancestral form found in Neandertals, which has higher enzymatic activity.
title: A genetic variant protective for COVID-19 is inherited from Neanderthals

finding: The SNP rs2660, a missense variant in the OAS1 gene, was associated with moderate to strong protection against SARS-CoV infection, with odds ratio OR = 0.42 (95% CI: 0.20-0.89). This Neandertal variant also contributed to the protective effects against RNA virus infections.
title: A genetic variant protective for COVID-19 is inherited from Neanderthals

finding: This SNP in AMIGO2 was associated with schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, and it showed evidence of positive selection, marking it as significant.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The SNP rs190280601 related to DNM1L, also associated with psychiatric conditions like schizophrenia, exhibited signs of adaptive introgression.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: Associated with TSPAN11 and linked to schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, rs2241322 was noted as part of a positively selected region.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: Like rs2241322, this SNP was within the TSPAN11 gene and showed evidence of positive selection, further implicating links to complex traits.
title: Exploring adaptive introgression in modern human circadian rhythm genes

finding: The reference allele of this eQTL for DDX11 was found to partially diminish a repressive effect linked to the DREAM complex, indicating its role in regulating transcriptional repression.
title: Functional dissection of complex and molecular trait variants at single nucleotide resolution

finding: The intronic variant rs111939932 was significantly associated with nucleus accumbens volume, and it was shown to exert localized effects on the shape of this brain structure. This indicated that this variant was important for specific regional brain growth, enhancing the understanding of the genetic influence on brain morphology.
title: Genetic variants for head size share genes and pathways with cancer

finding: The SNP rs12146713 was found to significantly influence white matter microstructure, affecting multiple FA measures in various white matter tracts.
title: Common genetic variation influencing human white matter microstructure

finding: The SNP rs1391721 was characterized as promoting allele-specific open chromatin and was associated with increased binding of GATA3 in MCF7 cells. It was part of a signal detected at the 12q24 locus, where its risk allele was linked to higher levels of TBX3 expression, a gene associated with breast cancer risk.
title: Chromatin interactome mapping at 139 independent breast cancer risk signals

finding: This SNP was linked to lower expression of FGD6 in proliferative SMCs and had a negative correlation with SMC proliferation, indicating a potential regulatory mechanism contributing to CAD risk.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The rs577400960 (p.Arg151Trp) variant was identified as possibly deleterious, located at the beginning of the DHX37 protein sequence, outside the Helicase ATP-binding region. While it was found in heterozygous state with a frequency of 0.02% in the 1000 Genomes and Brazilian controls, it was not identified in the ABraOM-Brazilian Genomic Variants and Brazilian in-house controls. This finding contributed to the understanding of DHX37's role in 46,XY gonadal dysgenesis.
title: DEAH-box helicase 37 (DHX37) defects are a novel molecular etiology of 46,XY gonadal dysgenesis spectrum

finding: This SNP was associated with a moderate to major structural change in the lncRNA secondary structure, affecting base pairing patterns and potentially altering interactions with RNA binding proteins.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The transition mutation from A to G in this SNP was reported to significantly alter the binding motifs for several RBPs, leading to differential binding affinities.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The SNP rs324017 was linked to NAB2, a gene involved in neuroprotective maintenance. This SNP contributed to a 200-fold decline in binding affinity for the transcription factor PURA, which is critical for neural function and development, and is implicated in various neurological impairments.
title: Unveiling causal regulatory mechanisms through cell-state parallax

finding: The Denisovan variant rs368816473 was identified as part of a set of eight SNPs located approximately 41 kb upstream of the OAS2 and OAS3 genes. This SNP was predicted to disrupt transcription factor binding sites, potentially altering immune responses.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: The variant rs372433785 was part of the eight SNPs affecting OAS2 and OAS3 regulation. It was associated with a significant reduction of transcriptional activity in plasmid reporter assays when compared to the modern human allele.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: The SNP rs139804868 was confirmed to disrupt a binding site for transcription factors involved in immune responses and was linked to a consistent reduction in transcriptional activity relative to the modern human allele.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: Denisovan variant rs146859513 was associated with lower transcription rates in immune cells compared to the modern variant, due to disruption of a binding site for NFKB2, which is crucial for immune response regulation.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: This SNP was one of the eight linked to OAS2 and OAS3, found at frequencies of 0.2 to 0.4 in Papuans, suggesting it contributes to adaptive immune functions due to its regulatory effects.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: The SNP rs838880, associated with the gene SCARB1, showed uniformly positive associations with medium high-density lipoprotein particles (M-HDL-P), large high-density lipoprotein particles (L-HDL-P), extra-large high-density lipoprotein particles (XL-HDL-P), high-density lipoprotein diameter (HDL-D), apolipoprotein A1 (ApoA1), and high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), while it had a negative association with coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: A Mendelian randomization study of the role of lipoprotein subfractions in coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs887304 in the EFCAB4B gene was identified as significantly associated with lobular inflammation in a pilot GWAS involving patients with NAFLD. Furthermore, twin studies indicated that individuals who developed NASH cirrhosis were heterozygous for this SNP, highlighting its potential role in the genetic predisposition to NAFLD progression. Additionally, this SNP was one of the 19 identified in a pilot study in an Indian population to be associated with NAFLD.
title: RNAseq analysis reveals transcriptome changes associated with the progression of non-alcoholic liver disease in livers from Efcab4b knockout mice

finding: As a conserved intronic SNP in the promoter of the gene CCND2, it was associated with bone mineral density, height, red blood cell count, systolic blood pressure, and triglycerides, highlighting its contribution to various health conditions.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: An interactive association between the intronic SNP rs10506151 of the LRRK2 gene and Type 2 diabetes was noted, along with implications for neurodegenerative disorders, illustrating its multifaceted role in health.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs73264680 was identified as the lead SNP associated with RBC levels of lysophospholipids. It was in perfect linkage disequilibrium with the missense mutation rs1984564/I217T within LPCAT3, suggesting a genetic basis for metabolite variability in lysophosphatidylserine.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: In 2019, it was reported that rs55958994, a prostate cancer risk variant, was implicated in regulating multiple gene expression through extreme long-range chromatin interactions, thus influencing tumor progression. This SNP was linked to the mechanisms of gene regulation that could affect cancer outcomes.
title: CTCF-binding element regulates ESC differentiation via orchestrating long-range chromatin interaction between enhancers and HoxA

finding: The intergenic SNP rs2860482[A] was reported to be associated with atrial fibrillation. In the current analysis, it was in strong linkage disequilibrium with the reference allele of a variable number tandem repeat (VNTR) within the <italic>NACA</italic> gene. This VNTR was suggested to elucidate the observed associations with atrial fibrillation.
title: Long read sequencing of 3,622 Icelanders provides insight into the role of structural variants in human diseases and other traits

finding: The intergenic SNP rs7978685[T] was also reported to be linked to atrial fibrillation and was found to be in strong linkage disequilibrium with the reference allele of the VNTR in the <italic>NACA</italic> gene. The involvement of this exon in the muscle-specific, alternately spliced transcript skNAC underscores its importance in the developing heart.
title: Long read sequencing of 3,622 Icelanders provides insight into the role of structural variants in human diseases and other traits

finding: The SNP rs11060758 was associated with the semaphorin-7A gene, which was identified as playing a crucial role in promoting tumor cell migration within the glioma microenvironment. This finding had significant implications for understanding how signaling pathways involving semaphorin might contribute to malignant behaviors in glioblastoma and other tumors.
title: Remote neuronal activity drives glioma infiltration via Sema4f

finding: The SNP rs10772420 (p.Arg299Cys) in TAS2R19 was associated with diminished coffee intake, marking its role in dietary preferences.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The associated variant rs10845295 (p.Arg35Trp) in TAS2R31 was linked to coffee intake, reinforcing flavor perception traits.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11060819 was associated with the inhibition of WEE1 rather than PLK1 by AZD1775 at therapeutically relevant concentrations. This finding was significant as it highlighted the selective pharmacological target of AZD1775, suggesting that the influence on WEE1 could be more critical for therapeutic effects than on PLK1.
title: Development of Cell Permeable NanoBRET Probes for the Measurement of PLK1 Target Engagement in Live Cells

finding: A novel intergenic locus overlapping a GWAS haplotype block associated with smoking behaviour was identified on chromosome 12. This locus was found to contain 7 multi-exonic transcripts with all splice junctions confirmed by Illumina short-read sequencing. Many exons were highly conserved, and the two transcription start sites were supported by CAGE peaks.
title: Targeted, High-resolution RNA Sequencing of Non-coding Genomic Regions Associated with Neuropsychiatric Functions

finding: The SNP rs15895 associated with OAS2 showed a frequency increase in Latin American populations when compared to sub-Saharan Africans, potentially influencing susceptibility to congenital Zika syndrome.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The SNP rs11050678 was associated with findings in the context of cysteine metabolism, particularly highlighting how cysteine became essential for tumor proliferation and survival. In the study, it was noted that tumors exhibited a reliance on cystine uptake and differing catabolic pathways across various tumor types. This indicated that rs11050678 may play a role in influencing cysteine availability in these cancerous tissues, which aligns with the overall examination of metabolic pathways explained in the cited work.
title: The Origin of Cysteine and its Catabolism in Mammalian Tissues and Tumors

finding: The SNP rs2072449 was found to be associated with the expression of the C3AR1 gene. The research utilized single cell ATAC-seq and scRNA-seq datasets from peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) to illustrate this association. The analysis identified significant enhancer-promoter pairs, highlighting the role of this SNP in regulating the accessibility of chromatin at the putative enhancers associated with C3AR1 expression.
title: SnapATAC: A Comprehensive Analysis Package for Single Cell ATAC-seq

finding: The rs3741605 (T>C) allele was associated with delayed age at natural menopause (ANM), with a beta value greater than zero, suggesting a protective effect. It occurred in the promoter region of the HELB gene, which plays a crucial role in DNA repair, and was linked to increased expression of HELB in human ovary tissue as demonstrated by eQTL analysis. This finding indicated that the C allele may enhance genome maintenance, contributing to delayed ANM.
title: The regulatory landscapes of human ovarian ageing

finding: The SNP rs6538618 was related to endometriosis and was found to be in high LD with risk SNPs associated with epithelial ovarian cancer. It was located in a promoter region related to genes like MLLT10 and associated with DNAm alterations that might influence endometriosis outcomes.
title: Global Endometrial DNA Multi-omics Analysis Reveals Insights into mQTL Regulation and Associated Endometriosis Disease Risk

finding: The SNP rs11111728 was found to be associated with the TYK2 gene, which plays a role as an upstream kinase of STATs in cancer. The study highlighted how this genetic variant may influence cancer progression through its effects on signaling pathways that govern cell proliferation and immune response within tumors.
title: Identifying common transcriptome signatures of cancer by interpreting deep learning models

finding: In ADHD, rs1585897 was linked to lower SA across various brain areas, exemplifying its genetic role in psychiatric disorders.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with increased CT in ANX, rs11112594 demonstrated the genetic factors influencing brain structure.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: In ASD, rs11147235 was linked to lower SA as well, demonstrating opposing effects on cortical parameters.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP showed connections with reduced SA in PTSD, emphasizing its relevance for cortical alterations.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs1006737 was associated with a significant risk for bipolar disorder (BD), schizophrenia (SCZ), and autism spectrum disorder (ASD). It was located within intron 3 of the CACNA1C gene, which is a non-coding region, and was thought to be linked to altered gene expression.
title: Functional characterisation of single nucleotide variants of the psychiatric risk gene cacna1c in the zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs4765905 was reported to affect interactions with the CACNA1C promoter region, leading to alterations in its expression, highlighting its relevance in the context of CACNA1C-related psychiatric disorders.
title: Functional characterisation of single nucleotide variants of the psychiatric risk gene cacna1c in the zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs1131017 was associated with multiple autoimmune diseases and was shown to alter the co-expression of RPS26 with other ribosomal genes, specifically linking it to T cell activation and autoimmune disease mechanisms. Further enrichment analysis identified transcription factors that may regulate this effect.
title: Identification of genetic variants that impact gene co-expression relationships using large-scale single-cell data

finding: In the non-inflamed condition, the risk allele at rs11168249 was associated with higher NFKB1 target gene expression in Clusters 2 and 3, while being inversely related in Clusters 1 and 4. However, in inflamed settings, it did not significantly affect NFKB1 target gene expression.
title: A systems genomics approach to uncover patient-specific pathogenic pathways and proteins in a complex disease

finding: This SNP was identified as a missense variant in the SH2B3 gene and was reported to be associated with the trait 'platelet'. It was recognized as both a positive and original finding in the context of the analysis.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome

finding: This SNP was also a missense variant in the SH2B3 gene, noted in connection with 'platelet'. It qualified as a positive and original finding based on the findings reported.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome

finding: This SNP was classified as an intron variant in the ATXN2 gene and was found to be associated with 'platelet'. It was considered a positive and original finding according to the study's results.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome

finding: The rs2287218 SNP in the MVK gene was associated with an increased risk of coronary heart disease and ischemic stroke. This finding was derived from a case-control study that highlighted the relevance of genetic variations in the mevalonate pathway in relation to cardiac conditions.
title: Quantitative Proteomic Profiling of Murine Embryonic Heart Development Reveals a Role for the Mevalonate Pathway in Cardiomyocyte Proliferation

finding: The SNP rs11050678 was positively identified in a study linking cysteine levels to tumor proliferation and survival. This finding indicated that cysteine became essential for tumor growth, suggesting a relationship between this SNP and the regulation of cysteine within the context of cancer biology.
title: Glutathione supports lipid abundance in vivo

finding: The SNP rs2057778 negatively influenced the expression of the gene OAS1, which encodes for proteins involved in antiviral responses, specifically in non-classical monocytes. This association underscored the role of this eQTL in the immune response to viral infections, particularly regarding COVID-19 severity.
title: COVID-19 genetic risk variants are associated with expression of multiple genes in diverse immune cell types

finding: The SNP rs2010604 was associated with the expression of DTX1, a regulatory gene in B cells, indicating that the genetic variant influenced transcriptional activity through interaction between a cis-regulatory region and the DTX1 promoter. This finding contributed to understanding how genetic variants may affect B cell function during COVID-19.
title: COVID-19 genetic risk variants are associated with expression of multiple genes in diverse immune cell types

finding: This SNP was identified as contributing to a significant downregulation of L1 family TE gene expression, highlighting its potential regulatory impact despite not being associated with any known protein-coding gene.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate Regulators of LINE-1 RNA Levels in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The rs34637584 SNP, which represents the G2019S missense variant of the LRRK2 gene, was identified as a known risk variant associated with Parkinson's disease (PD). This SNP was among the top variants detected in the study, contributing to the genetic risk factors for PD.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The rs10774671 A/G SNP was associated with the production of distinct OAS1 splice variants linked to COVID-19 severity. Specifically, the G allele led to the predominant production of the p46 isoform, which exhibited optimal enzymatic activity, while the A allele resulted in the alternative splicing to form the p42 variant that displayed poor activity. These isoforms played critical roles in the antiviral response against SARS-CoV-2, with the study indicating that allele variation was significant in influencing the immune response.
title: Switching of OAS1 splicing isoforms mitigates SARS-CoV-2 infection

finding: The SNP rs11111805 was linked to alterations in collagen during imaging studies of high-grade ovarian cancers in the fallopian tubes. These alterations were identified through second harmonic generation microscopy, thereby establishing a relationship between this SNP and the ECM changes associated with ovarian carcinoma outgrowths.
title: Extracellular Matrix Levels Modulate Outgrowths Dynamics in Ovarian Cancer

finding: Variant rs61943586 was a caQTL active across all immune cell types but was only significant in CD8+ T cells, illustrating cell-type specificity (π=0.76, q=1.4x10^-4).
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: Identified at the 12p13.33 locus with high probability for lymphocyte count, rs34038797 served as a caQTL across multiple cell types with significant effect and co-accessibility with various genes.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The SNP rs11060846 was identified in the context of uveal melanoma where high expression of CysLT1, associated with poor disease-free survival and overall survival rates in UM patients, was analyzed. This SNP contributed to the characterization of patients with poor prognostic indicators.
title: High Cysteinyl Leukotriene Receptor 1 Expression Correlates with Poor Survival of Uveal Melanoma Patients and Cognate Antagonist Drugs Modulate the Growth, Cancer Secretome, and Metabolism of Uveal Melanoma Cells

finding: The SNP rs11060834 was also associated with high expression levels of CysLT2 in uveal melanoma. It was linked to the poor prognostic indicator of ciliary body involvement, which correlates with decreased patient survival outcomes.
title: High Cysteinyl Leukotriene Receptor 1 Expression Correlates with Poor Survival of Uveal Melanoma Patients and Cognate Antagonist Drugs Modulate the Growth, Cancer Secretome, and Metabolism of Uveal Melanoma Cells

finding: The analysis indicated that the SNP rs3033405 was positively associated with microvessel density as well as VEGF and alpha-smooth muscle actin expression in various regions of human gastrointestinal carcinomas. This finding was detailed in the study published by Tonino and Abreu in the journal Cancers (2011), linking the genetic marker with angiogenesis and possibly cancer progression.
title: Engineering Antioxidant and Oxygen-Releasing Lignin Composites to Accelerate Wound Healing

finding: The SNP rs1169301 was shown to be linked to heterozygosity and associated with cleavage during CRISPR/Cas9 editing in the HNF1A gene, indicating its relevance in the context of MODY3 and the generation of distinct cellular phenotypes relating to insulin secretion.
title: Human stem cell model of HNF1A deficiency shows uncoupled insulin to C-peptide secretion with accumulation of abnormal insulin granules

finding: The SNP rs2071190 was identified as being linked to a deletion that affected the generation of homozygous lines during the CRISPR/Cas9 experiments on HNF1A, thus highlighting its possible role in influencing HNF1A function and, subsequently, MODY3 pathology.
title: Human stem cell model of HNF1A deficiency shows uncoupled insulin to C-peptide secretion with accumulation of abnormal insulin granules

finding: The study identified rs4765621 as a tumor-specific QTL (tsQTL) with a significant association with the SCARB1 gene and renal cell carcinoma (RCC) risk. The FDR was recorded at 6.02e-8, and it colocalized with a genome-wide significant risk variant having a p-value of 3.33e-12, demonstrating strong support for its role in cancer risk.
title: A novel method to identify cell-type specific regulatory variants and their role in cancer risk

finding: The study validated rs4765623 as being in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs4765621 and identified it as also acting as a tumor-specific enhancer for SCARB1. It demonstrated significant chromatin activity with the C risk allele, reinforcing its expression-increasing effect pertinent to ccRCC.
title: A novel method to identify cell-type specific regulatory variants and their role in cancer risk

finding: In a study of 2,244 critically ill COVID-19 patients, SNP rs10735079 was found on 12q24.13, within a gene cluster encoding antiviral restriction enzyme activators (OAS1, OAS2, OAS3), correlating with COVID-19 severity.
title: Human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 severity are enriched in immune and epithelium regulatory networks

finding: At the PDE3A gene locus, the first signal (rs11045172) colocalized with prior GWAS signals, confirming it as a positive original finding.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: At the PDE3A gene locus, the second signal (rs2044315) was colocalized with GWAS signals, confirming it as a positive original finding.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: At the PDE3A locus, the third signal (rs11045237) was confirmed as a positive original finding due to its colocalization with GWAS signals.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: At the PDE3A locus, the fourth signal (rs7134150) was also confirmed as a positive original finding through its colocalization with GWAS signals.
title: Adipose tissue eQTL meta-analysis reveals the contribution of allelic heterogeneity to gene expression regulation and cardiometabolic traits

finding: The SNP rs11053646, a missense variant in the OLR1 gene, was found to have a significant sex-specific association with carotid atherosclerotic plaque presence in women of Dominican descent, while no association was found in men. This highlights the importance of sex as a factor in genetic associations with cardiovascular traits.
title: GEGenetic regulatory effects in response to a high cholesterol, high fat diet in baboons

finding: This SNP was reported to alter lymphoid enhancer-binding factor (LEF) transcription factor binding at the KIT ligand (KITLG) gene, contributing to a blonde hair phenotype in humans, and when experimentally altered in mice, it resulted in a lighter fur coloration.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: This SNP was identified as associated with atypical drug response. Specifically, it was reported that 22.9% of all subjects carried the C allele, which suggested a possible decreased function in the SLCO1B1 gene leading to recommendations for lower doses of simvastatin due to an increased risk of muscle toxicity.
title: Pharmacogenetics at scale: An analysis of the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs697221 caused a missense change in the DDIT3 gene and was associated with signaling features predictive of sensitivity to three PI3K targeted inhibitors: pictilisib, uprosertib, and taselisib.
title: Deciphering the Signaling Network Landscape of Breast Cancer Improves Drug Sensitivity Prediction

finding: The SNP rs7962469, located within the <italic>ACVR1B</italic> gene, was noted for its significant association with serum CC-16 levels and had previously been linked to lung disease risk. It was specifically associated with COPD risk (p=1.2×10-3) and had a strong eQTL connection in lung tissue.
title: The protective effect of club cell secretory protein (CC-16) on COPD risk and progression: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: It was active in heart tissues and associated with diastolic blood pressure traits, implying its potential role in cardiovascular-related genetic mechanisms.
title: Genome-Wide Large-Scale Multi-Trait Analysis Characterizes Global Patterns of Pleiotropy and Unique Trait-Specific Variants

finding: Variant rs3916 showed a more than additive positive effect on butyrylcarnitine, associated with SCAD deficiency, suggesting a significant impact on metabolic pathways related to fatty acid metabolism.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: Linked to the ACADS gene, variant rs1799958 encodes short-chain acyl-CoA dehydrogenase, and its relationship to elevated butyrylcarnitine highlights its importance in metabolism.
title: Cross-platform genetic discovery of small molecule products of metabolism and application to clinical outcomes

finding: This SNP was associated with both triple-negative (OR=0.93; P=2.5×10^-8) and luminal B-like subtypes (OR=0.96; P=0.02), indicating its relevance in multiple breast cancer subtypes. It was defined as having significant associations within the CIMBA/BCAC-TN meta-analysis.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: The SNP rs4765623, located in an enhancer region, demonstrated significant higher activity of the risk allele (C). It was confirmed to be a functional enhancer for the SCARB1 gene, influencing its expression in kidney cancer cells. CRISPR interference experiments revealed that targeting this allele reduced SCARB1 expression, illustrating its involvement in the regulatory landscape of RCC.
title: Allelic imbalance reveals widespread germline-somatic regulatory differences and prioritizes risk loci in Renal Cell Carcinoma

finding: SNP rs5888, located in exon 8 of SCARB1, was linked to significant allelic imbalance contributing to SCARB1 expression levels. The heterozygous state showed skewing towards higher contribution from the allele A, indicating its potential role in modulating SCARB1 levels in RCC.
title: Allelic imbalance reveals widespread germline-somatic regulatory differences and prioritizes risk loci in Renal Cell Carcinoma

finding: The TPH2 rs4570625 polymorphism was found to significantly affect punishment sensitivity among individuals exposed to early life stress (ELS). Specifically, higher ELS was associated with increased punishment sensitivity in TT homozygotes, with structural brain changes in thalamic-limbic-prefrontal areas mediating this effect. The study highlighted that TT carriers exhibited significant structural brain volume increases associated with higher ELS exposure, which correlated with their heightened sensitivity to punishment, thereby linking genotype to emotional and neurobiological outcomes.
title: Gene - Environment Interaction: A TPH2 polymorphism and early life stress shape brain architecture and anxious avoidant behavior

finding: This SNP was a lead signal at the CCND2 locus, classified as shared with high TOA scores for both islet (TOA=0.53) and adipose (TOA=0.47).
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: This SNP was identified among a cluster of five SNPs that were located roughly 43 kb upstream of the genes OAS2 and OAS3, which are involved in immune responses. It was reported that the archaic allele for this SNP segregated at frequencies between 0.33 and 0.39 in Papuan populations, while the reference allele was fixed in western Indonesian populations.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: As part of the same cluster of five SNPs associated with immune-related genes OAS2 and OAS3, this SNP showed similar segregation patterns, with the archaic allele present at frequencies between 0.33 and 0.39 in Papuans and fixed reference alleles in western Indonesians.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans
