finding: This SNP, included in the identified cluster associated with immune responses, also had an archaic allele that segregated in Papuans at 0.33 to 0.39 frequency, contrasting with the fixed reference allele in western Indonesians.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: Part of the five SNP cluster affecting the transcription factors regulating OAS2 and OAS3, this SNP demonstrated that archaic alleles segregated in Papuans at similar frequencies while the reference allele was fixed in western Indonesian populations.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: This SNP was also found in the significant cluster affecting the regulation of immune-related genes and showed the same genetic frequency pattern as others in Papuans compared to western Indonesians.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: Found within Neanderthal haplotypes, this SNP was associated with different splicing isoforms of the OAS1 gene and was shown to affect immune response mechanisms, though details on its population segregation were not specifically reported in this context.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: This SNP was identified within Neanderthal haplotypes affecting OAS3 expression levels but specifically showed associations related to viral infection which have implications for immune responses; however, specific population segregation details were not provided.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: This SNP overlapped with GWAS variants linked to macrophage migration and was tied to NAPRT expression, indicating critical relevance in metabolic regulation.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The study by Dannlowski et al. in 2015 reported that the polymorphism rs7294919, which regulates tescalcin (TESC), had specific effects on the structure of hippocampal gray matter. This finding related to variations in brain structure, potentially implicating TESC in neurodevelopmental processes and psychiatric conditions.
title: Conformational dynamics and target-dependent myristoyl switch of calcineurin B homologous protein 3

finding: The SNP rs60015123 in LPCAT3 was linked to lower hemolytic propensity in clinical transfusion recipients, particularly associated with lower hemoglobin increments upon transfusion of stored RBC units.
title: Ferroptosis regulates hemolysis in stored murine and human red blood cells

finding: Selection at the HECTD4 locus (rs11066188) was recorded, indicating adaptation associated with celiac disease and rising in frequency for approximately 9,000 years.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs653178 showed a similar increase in frequency linked to rheumatoid arthritis, suggesting earlier selection than previously believed, occurring for around 9,000 years.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: The SNP rs72650673 was identified as nearly statistically significant (OR = 1.847, 95% CI = 1.65 – 2.18, P = 0.0647) in association with abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) based on data collected from 8,236 cases and 229,553 controls. It was linked to increased incidence of AAA and correlated with aortic dissection when assessing its underlying mechanisms through mouse models, specifically emphasizing the role of the SH2B3 gene as integral in the pathology of aneurysms.
title: Platelets are Protective in Early Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Formation

finding: This SNP was associated with higher RMST expression and reduced type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk, with an odds ratio of 0.93 (p=2.2×10-8). It also correlated with decreased fasting glucose levels (beta=-0.024, p=4×10-11), reduced HbA1c (beta=-0.087, p=4.6×10-4), and lower 2-hour glucose in an oral glucose tolerance test (beta=-0.064, p=2.4×10-4).
title: TIGER: The gene expression regulatory variation landscape of human pancreatic islets

finding: This low-frequency variant reduced T2D risk by half and was associated with increased CCND2 expression in islets. Additionally, it correlated with decreased fasting glucose (beta=-0.033, p=0.0017), reduced HbA1c (beta=-0.042, p=3.6×10-8), and lowered 2-hour glucose levels during an oral glucose tolerance test (beta=-0.095, p=0.01).
title: TIGER: The gene expression regulatory variation landscape of human pancreatic islets

finding: The rs2268508 locus was identified in an open region of chromatin within the first intron of ELK3. It was suggested that this SNP may be functionally relevant for the dysregulation observed in B-cell differentiation and associated with B-ALL, aligning with its role derived from proxy analysis of rs4762284.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: Similar to rs2268508, rs17736737 was located in an open chromatin region in the downstream context of ELK3 and related to alterations in B-cell differentiation that may contribute to B-ALL susceptibility.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The rs10774671 SNP, associated with the production of the OAS1 p46 isoform, demonstrated a strong association with COVID-19 severity. Specifically, the G allele was linked to decreased risk of severe COVID-19 complications due to enhanced antiviral activity against SARS-CoV-2 as compared to the A allele.
title: Endomembrane targeting of human OAS1 p46 augments antiviral activity

finding: This SNP was identified in a genome-wide association study linking it to severe COVID-19 outcomes. It was found that this SNP is in high linkage disequilibrium with rs10774671, reinforcing the association of genetic factors contributing to severe COVID-19 in critically ill patients.
title: Endomembrane targeting of human OAS1 p46 augments antiviral activity

finding: The rs3809260 SNP was associated with breast cancer and breast tissue eQTL. Located on chromosome 12, it was characterized by G/T alleles and was situated in the promoter region of the CHPT1 gene, less than 1 kb from its transcription start site (TSS). The presence of the alternative allele was predicted to result in a 14 percentile increase in enhancer activity, and was associated with higher expression levels of the CHPT1 gene in breast cancer patients, as shown by Pancan data.
title: Mechanistic analysis of enhancer sequences in the Estrogen Receptor transcriptional program

finding: SNP rs1186214 affected PGAP6 expression in the context of TB-T2D patients when conditioned for Khoe-San ancestry.
title: cis-eQTL mapping of TB-T2D comorbidity elucidates the involvement of African ancestry in TB susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs1006737, located in the CACNA1C gene, was reported to be associated with schizophrenia. This finding indicated a potential genetic link between variations in this SNP and the risk of developing schizophrenia, suggesting that the regulated calcium influx through L-type calcium channels (LTCCs) might play a critical role in the pathology of the disorder.
title: Neuronal L-Type Calcium Channel Signaling to the Nucleus Requires a Novel CaMKIIα-Shank3 Interaction

finding: This SNP was identified as a trans pQTL associated with ADAMTS13 levels, which play a crucial role in thrombosis, linked to the von Willebrand factor (VWF) gene.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs7297582 was identified as the top proxy SNP linked to expression levels of CACNA1C in DG-GCL, with a p-value of 4.27e-6. While it demonstrated significant association in the DG-GCL, it only showed association in GTEx, exclusively in the cerebellum (p=6.6e-7), further emphasizing the tissue-specific genetic regulation of CACNA1C.
title: Cell type-specific genetic regulation of expression in the granule cell layer of the human dentate gyrus

finding: Previous human GWAS studies had demonstrated a strong association between the SNP rs2292239 in ERBB3 and Type 1 Diabetes (T1D). The context of this finding suggested that genetic variants at the ERBB3 locus might play a critical role in the susceptibility to T1D, indicating a potential mechanism involving ARID1A's interaction with ERBB3 in the modulation of beta-cell regeneration and diabetes resistance.
title: Arid1a loss potentiates pancreatic β-cell regeneration through activation of EGF signaling

finding: The rs7132327 variant was previously associated with electrical phenotypes, reinforcing its significance in relation to conduction traits within the context of trabecular characteristics.
title: Genomic analysis reveals a functional role for myocardial trabeculae in adults

finding: The SNP rs11050666 was associated with alternative splicing regulation of TERT in cancer. This research revealed insights into how telomerase activity, which is critical for cancer stemness and proliferation, can be affected by genetic variations, including rs11050666.
title: Inferring Telomerase Enzymatic Activity from Expression Data

finding: The study highlighted the molecular dissection of the MS risk allele rs1800693, which is located in the gene encoding the TNFR1. The associated variant was noted to code for a soluble form of TNFR1 that mimics TNF blocking molecules. This finding was significant as it supported the observation that TNFα blockade leads to increased disease activity, affirming the pleiotropic role of TNFα in the pathogenesis of multiple sclerosis.
title: Systems Analysis of Immune Changes after B-cell Depletion in Autoimmune Multiple Sclerosis

finding: The study identified that the rs1466535 polymorphism in the LRP1 gene was linked to carotid artery disease, illustrating its role as a genetic risk factor. This finding correlated with the overarching theme that LRP1 variants significantly contributed to susceptibility to vascular diseases including abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) and coronary artery disease.
title: Thymosin β4 mediates vascular protection via regulation of Low Density Lipoprotein Related Protein 1 (LRP1)

finding: The variant rs886125 was linked to a cardiomyocyte-specific CRE and was found to disrupt ZNF382 binding, influencing MYL2 expression in HCM. The risk-increasing allele was associated with decreased MYL2 expression, demonstrating its functional impact in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.
title: Deconvolution of polygenic risk score in single cells unravels cellular and molecular heterogeneity of complex human diseases

finding: This SNP was associated with RPS26 eQTL in RPE1, RPE5, and RPE6, indicating its significance in gene expression modulations across these RPE subpopulations and its potential connection to geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: Associated with RPS26 eQTL in Progenitor RPE, RPE2, RPE3, and RPE4, highlighting its role in gene expression variation pertinent to geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The genetic variant rs34873612 was identified as an eQTL for <italic>DDX11</italic> (FDR = 2e-60), but it did not affect mRNA stability (FDR > 0.1). This indicates that rs34873612 likely regulates the expression level of <italic>DDX11</italic> through transcriptional mechanisms rather than post-transcriptional stability.
title: Genetic variants associated mRNA stability in lung

finding: The SNP rs1382264 showed a significant association with immune domain differentiation, particularly for the trait NKearly (%335+314-), as indicated by PheWAS plots across GWAS in the GWASALAS database.
title: A refined characterization of large-scale genomic differences in the first complete human genome

finding: SNP rs2617151 was significantly associated with immune domain differentiation, specifically for the NKeff (%314-R7-) trait, highlighting its relevance in immune response based on GWAS analysis.
title: A refined characterization of large-scale genomic differences in the first complete human genome

finding: The SNP rs2733845 also demonstrated significant associations with immune domain differentiation across various traits, reinforcing its importance in the context of genetic studies on the immune system.
title: A refined characterization of large-scale genomic differences in the first complete human genome

finding: This SNP was associated with both triple-negative breast cancer (TN) with an odds ratio of 0.93 and luminal B-like subtypes with an odds ratio of 0.96, demonstrating its role in different tumor types.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: The variant rs615382 in the RACGAP1 gene was associated with delayed disease onset in ATTRV30M patients. Specifically, individuals carrying the heterozygous variant experienced a mean increase of 20 years in age of onset, while homozygous individuals saw a 34-year increase. This variant, which increased RACGAP1 expression by disrupting the binding site for repressors, was found to contribute to a slower progression and less aggressive form of ATTR-PN, confirming a role for RACGAP1 in modulating the disease's onset.
title: Rac1 inhibition prevents axonal cytoskeleton dysfunction in Transthyretin Amyloid Polyneuropathy

finding: Amplicon #7 (overlapping rs4765905) exhibited significant enhancer activity in the brain, correlating with findings related to schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Amplicon #3 (overlapping rs1108075) drove significant RNA transcript expression, indicating enhancer activity associated with psychiatric disorders.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Amplicon #3 (overlapping rs11062166) demonstrated enhancer activity, correlating with psychiatric disorder studies.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Amplicon #6 (overlapping rs12315711) exhibited significant enhancer activity, reinforcing its association with neuropsychiatric conditions.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Amplicon #6 (overlapping rs2159100) drove detectable enhancer activity in postnatal brain.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Amplicon #7 (overlapping rs11062170) showed enhancer activity consistent with previous studies in vitro.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: The SNP rs11170342 was identified as a risk-associated SNP near <italic>KRT18</italic>, with luciferase assays providing evidence of its role in enhancer activity relevant to OFC.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs2070875 had the highest deltaSVM score among the assessed SNPs and was implicated in enhancer activity regulating <italic>KRT18</italic> and <italic>KRT8</italic> expression, directly affecting orofacial cleft risk.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs3741442 reached genome-wide significance as an OFC-risk associated SNP at the 12q13.13 locus, highlighted in recent GWAS findings in a Chinese population.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: SNP rs11170344 was the lead SNP in a meta-analysis of OFC GWAS, confirming its association with orofacial clefting risk.
title: Analysis of zebrafish periderm enhancers facilitates identification of a regulatory variant near human KRT8/18

finding: The SNP rs55958994 was associated with prostate cancer risk and was shown to regulate multiple gene expressions through extreme long-range chromatin interactions. This regulation was linked to the control of tumor progression, highlighting its significance in cancer biology.
title: Regulation Network of Colorectal Cancer Specific Enhancers in Progression of Colorectal Cancer

finding: This SNP was connected to the KRT80 gene, which demonstrated a P-imputed value of 6.58×10^-6 and was found to be down-regulated in CL lesions compared to normal skin.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: Located in the IFNG-AS1 gene, this SNP had a P-imputed value of 1.32×10^-5 and was associated with variations in IFN-γ producing T cells in response to Leishmania antigens.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: The SNP rs11171964 was highlighted in a study conducted by Vazquez-Cuervo et al. (2019), which validated satellite-derived sea surface salinity and sea surface temperature. This finding related to the understanding of environmental conditions affecting plankton ecosystems, aligning with the broader initiative of assessing genetic and morphological diversity in marine life through DNA barcoding and ecological studies.
title: Plankton Planet: ‘seatizen’ oceanography to assess open ocean life at the planetary scale

finding: This missense variant was notably associated with 19 metabolites including primary and secondary bile acids, indicating a significant role in metabolite regulation associated with hepatic functions.
title: Genome-microbiome interplay provides insight into the determinants of the human blood metabolome

finding: The variant rs11065979 was found in the CCSp analysis and was associated with small vessel stroke (SVS). It replicated in both the trans-ancestry analysis and the European analysis. This variant acts as an eQTL for the ALDH2 gene, implicated in ethanol metabolism, with higher expression associated with lower incidence of small vessel stroke.
title: Alternate approach to stroke phenotyping identifies a genetic risk locus for small vessel stroke

finding: The SNP rs2302685 was associated with late onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD), indicating a genetic link between deficient Wnt signalling and AD. The variant represented a nonsynonymous substitution resulting in the replacement of isoleucine with valine at amino acid position 1062 of the LRP6 protein (LRP6-Val), which was shown to reduce Wnt signalling in response to Wnt ligands. This reduction in signalling may contribute to synapse dysfunction and loss associated with AD.
title: A genetic variant of the Wnt receptor LRP6 accelerates synapse degeneration during ageing and in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Identified as a vQTL for the ARL6IP4 gene, the T allele decreased gene expression variability in T cells treated with PHA plus dexamethasone. ARL6IP4 is associated with multiple sclerosis and allergic rhinitis.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The splice donor missense variant identified in the CERS5 gene was significantly associated with lower SM(d32:2) levels and classified as disease-causing.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: The COVID-19-associated variant rs10774671 was shown to exert its strongest effect in IAV-stimulated gamma delta T cells.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The rs1131454 genetic variant in the OAS1 gene was identified as being associated with Alzheimer’s Disease (AD). This association was highlighted in an epidemiological analysis by Padhi et al. in 2022, indicating its relevance to the risk of developing AD. The finding provides insight into the molecular mechanisms underlying Alzheimer's disease and suggests that OAS1 may play a role in the disease's pathophysiology.
title: A multi-network approach to Alzheimer’s Disease gene prioritization complements cis-regulatory prioritization with molecular quantitative trait loci

finding: The F198L mutation (rs202123922) in TAS2R14 showed a modest effect on receptor activity, resulting in an increase in EC50 values. This finding illustrated that the receptor's sensitivity to flufenamic acid (FFA) was altered due to this natural variant.
title: Intracellular binding pocket revealed in the human bitter taste receptor TAS2R14

finding: The L201F mutation (rs35804287) was also identified as a natural variant in TAS2R14, and it was reported to reduce the receptor's sensitivity to agonists. Similar to rs202123922, this mutation also led to an increase in EC50 values, indicating a modest effect on receptor activity.
title: Intracellular binding pocket revealed in the human bitter taste receptor TAS2R14

finding: The SNP rs1006737, located in the CACNA1C gene, was associated with schizophrenia. This finding was published by Nyegaard et al. in 2010 and highlighted the relevance of this genetic variant in psychiatric conditions, particularly its implications in the understanding of schizophrenia.
title: Epigenomic tomography for probing spatially-defined molecular state in the brain

finding: An association was identified between rs10772420 in TAS2R19 and coffee intake (details on p-value were noted). This variant has been observed to impact taste perception.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: There was an association between rs10845295 in TAS2R31 and coffee intake, similar to that of rs10772420 indicating a potential non-additive genetic effect in taste perception.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank study

finding: Located in the 3'-UTR of the FAIM2 gene, rs7132908 had significant GxE interactions with sedentary behavior and alcohol intake frequency, highlighting its regulation by dietary and lifestyle factors affecting BMI.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: The rs1006737 risk variant in the CACNA1C gene was previously linked to defective reward responsiveness in humans and abnormalities in prefrontal cortex (PFC) structure and function. In this context, the findings described a parallel between Ca<sub>v</sub>1.2 PFC deficient mice showing deficits in social approach behavior and the established link of this SNP to social and reward processing deficits in neuropsychiatric disorders such as autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and schizophrenia.
title: Repeat investigation during social preference behavior is suppressed in male mice with prefrontal cortex cacna1c (Cav1.2)-deficiency through the dysregulation of neural dynamics

finding: The SNP rs4765623, which was intronic in the SCARB1 gene, was associated with clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC), a cancer that is characterized by significant lipid accumulation. This SNP was also correlated with increased expression levels of SCARB1 in human left ventricle, with the T allele linked to higher expression. Additionally, this SNP demonstrated increased association with SR-B1 expression in testes, and SR-B1 expression was found to be elevated in ccRCC tissue compared to normal kidney tissue.
title: SR-B1 uptake of HDL promotes prostate cancer proliferation and tumor progression

finding: Variant rs11610384, mapped at 12p11, was identified in a glucocorticoid-responsive site bound by the glucocorticoid receptor (GR). It exhibited significant allelic imbalance solely in glucocorticoid-treated islets, and disrupted nuclear receptor motifs, highlighting its relevance to glucocorticoid signaling.
title: Glucocorticoid signaling in pancreatic islets modulates gene regulatory programs and genetic risk of type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs2162679 of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) was associated with myopia in Chinese children, indicating its potential role in myopia susceptibility. This finding was related to genetic mechanisms influencing emmetropization and ocular growth.
title: Establishment and comprehensive characterization of a novel dark-reared zebrafish model for myopia studies

finding: At SNP rs2306894 in the Melanin Lectin gene (CLEC1A), the glycine allele (G) was observed to have a geographic distribution varying among human populations, with the ancestral alanine allele (A) being associated with increased risk of invasive fungal infections in stem-cell transplant patients. This finding underscored the evolutionary significance of amino acid variations at position 26 in the context of host-pathogen interactions.
title: Rapid Evolution of Glycan Recognition Receptors Reveals an Axis of Host-Microbe Conflicts at Carbohydrate-Protein Interfaces

finding: The rs11061368 variant located within the DIABLO gene was associated with poor exercise responses. The gene encodes a protein that induces apoptosis, suggesting that dysregulation could impede muscle remodeling, impacting training outcomes.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The nonsynonymous SNP rs2302685, which had an allele frequency of 0.17 in the European population, was associated with late onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD) as it resulted in a conservative substitution of isoleucine to valine at amino acid 1062 (Lrp6<Ile-1062-Val>; Lrp6-val). This variant was demonstrated to confer reduced Wnt signalling, which is critical for synapse function and stability, thus linking it to synaptic integrity and cognitive decline in AD.
title: A genetic variant of the Wnt receptor LRP6 accelerates synapse degeneration during ageing and in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The T allele at rs7296418 decreased gene expression variability of the ARL6IP4 gene in T cells treated with PHA+DEX, suggesting a potential role in multiple sclerosis and allergic rhinitis.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The variant rs7132327 was found to have a strong association with ECG morphology at a significance level of P=4×10^-140, located near the TBX3 gene.
title: The genetic makeup of the electrocardiogram

finding: rs12146713 on 12q23.3 showed a very strong association with connectivity in the left putamen, yielding a z-score of -10.48, highlighting its role in structural connectivity related to language networks.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: This SNP also contributed to adenoma count associations which have been linked to higher colorectal cancer risk.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: The study found that genotype TT at the rs17525495 locus in the LTA4H gene was associated with increased levels of the inflammatory mediator LTB4, resulting in better survival outcomes in patients with tuberculous meningitis who were treated with dexamethasone. This association indicated that homozygous TT patients not only had higher survival rates with the treatment but also lower survival rates when dexamethasone was not administered. Additionally, it was noted that the findings could be extended to non-TT patients, implying that other genetic variants could also modulate dexamethasone responsiveness and survival influenced by the inflammatory cytokine environment.
title: Elevated cerebrospinal fluid cytokine levels in tuberculous meningitis predict survival in response to dexamethasone

finding: The SNP rs12580015 was found to have genome-wide significant association with outcome-based resilience in a small group of soldiers experiencing high deployment stress. This SNP was located downstream from the SLC15A5 gene on chromosome 12 and indicated a significant association in this particular context, with a study sample size of 581.
title: Genomewide Analyses of Psychological Resilience in US Army Soldiers

finding: This variant was linked to the expression of SCARB1 and showed significant overlap with GWAS variants associated with levels of C-reactive protein, highlighting its role in inflammation.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The genetic variant rs1800693, located in the gene encoding TNFR1, was associated with a soluble form of TNFR1 that mimics TNF-blocking molecules. This finding was consistent with observations that TNFα blockade resulted in increased disease activity in multiple sclerosis (MS) patients, highlighting the variant's role in modulating inflammatory responses in MS.
title: Systems Analysis of Immune Changes after B-cell Depletion in Autoimmune Multiple Sclerosis

finding: The study identified rs7953706, a variant in the DDX11 gene located at chromosome 12, position 31073901. The analysis revealed that replacing the base at this position with the variant allele resulted in an increase in gene expression, indicating a potential positive effect on the function of the DDX11 gene. The context of this finding relates to gene expression levels predicted through deep learning methods, which could potentially improve personal genomic interpretations.
title: Benchmarking of deep neural networks for predicting personal gene expression from DNA sequence highlights shortcomings

finding: This SNP was involved in trans-eQTLs with multiple genes affected, including links to autoimmune diseases and other phenotypes, such as psoriasis and pulmonary function measures, suggesting its role in modulating those traits via Neandertal introgression.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: Associated with rs2066807, this SNP also showcased connections to multiple phenotypes including increased autoimmune disorders, highlighting a significant regulatory impact related to Neandertal ancestry.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: The GWAS analysis designated rs11105352 as the lead variant for cerebral aneurysm, which was indicated in the regional association plots. Variants in linkage disequilibrium with this SNP were highlighted in the study, marking it important in understanding the genetic basis for this disease.
title: Large scale genome-wide association study in a Japanese population identified 45 novel susceptibility loci for 22 diseases

finding: The SNP rs2061439 was associated with evidence of hydroperiod shortening in temporary ponds, as detailed in the study conducted by Gómez-Rodríguez et al. (2010). This finding highlighted the ecological impacts of climate change on the hydrology of temporary ponds, emphasizing how environmental alterations can affect microbial diversity and community composition in these sensitive habitats.
title: Environmental changes associated with drying climate are expected to affect functional groups of pro- and microeukaryotes differently in temporary saline waters

finding: The variant rs4913333 was associated with modulation of IFNG expression, which is a key regulator of immune stimulatory activities. This variant may influence immune checkpoint inhibitor responses due to its role in interferon-γ production.
title: Systemic CD8+ T cell effector signature predicts prognosis of lung cancer immunotherapy

finding: The eQTL variant rs4767014 near PTPN11 caused expression changes specific to CD8+ T cells under baseline conditions. PTPN11 regulates responses to cytokines via the RAS-MAPK pathway and is involved with PD-1 interactions to suppress T cell immune responses.
title: Systemic CD8+ T cell effector signature predicts prognosis of lung cancer immunotherapy

finding: An association was identified between rs116827016 and macrophage infiltration in tibial artery tissue, with a p-value of 3.86 × 10^-10. This SNP had previously been linked as an eQTL for KCTD10 expression in whole blood. In tibial artery samples, KCTD10 expression significantly correlated with the macrophage phenotype (p = 3.2 × 10^-16), indicating that alterations in KCTD10 expression due to the rs116827016 haplotype may impact immune responses in the vascular system.
title: Age, Sex, and Genetics Influence the Abundance of Infiltrating Immune Cells in Human Tissues

finding: The SNP rs4590952 (G>A) was identified as a common genetic variant found within a p53 response element (p53RE). This variant was found to reduce the binding efficiency of p53 to DNA, subsequently altering the transcription of the KITLG gene. Importantly, this variation was associated with an increased risk of developing cancer, highlighting its significant functional impact in the context of p53-related gene regulation and cancer susceptibility.
title: p53motifDB: integration of genomic information and tumor suppressor p53 binding motifs

finding: The study identified rs7132908 as a likely causal variant at a T2D risk locus. It was noted that the T2D risk allele 'A' decreases HNF4A binding and increases enhancer strength, contributing to T2D risk.
title: Functional interrogation of twenty type 2 diabetes-associated genes using isogenic hESC-derived β-like cells

finding: The SNP rs7294919 was associated with specific effects on hippocampal gray matter structure, as documented in a study by Dannlowski et al. (2015). This finding pointed to the role of the polymorphism in regulating hippocampal anatomy, which is relevant to neurodevelopment and potentially to processes involved in cancer and cardiac development, as indirectly supported by the context of CHP3 and its regulatory functions.
title: Conformational dynamics and target-dependent myristoyl switch of calcineurin B homologous protein 3

finding: The rs2722176 SNP was associated with increased GLT8D2 expression and decreased bone mineral density (BMD) in human studies, providing evidence that it is a likely contributor to BMD GWAS associations.
title: Systems genetics analyses in Diversity Outbred mice inform human bone mineral density GWAS and identify Qsox1 as a novel determinant of bone strength

finding: The SNP rs770150 was linked to bacterial enteritis as per PheWAS analysis (p = 4.7 × 10−5) and functioned as a glucocorticoid-mediated pharmacogenomic 3' aQTL for DDX3X. Cortisol treatment reduced the percentage of distal APA usage index in subjects with AA genotypes specifically.
title: Glucocorticoids Mediate Transcriptome-wide Alternative Polyadenylation: Mechanisms and Functional Implications

finding: This SNP was found to have significant effects in the GenIE assay for deletions and participated in the regulation of gene expression within the C2CD5 gene, demonstrating robust experimental support for its role in transcriptional regulation.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The study found that the rs76904798 variant influenced LRRK2 expression specifically in microglia. Analysis revealed that individuals homozygous for the risk variant (TT) exhibited significantly higher LRRK2 expression compared to those homozygous for the protective variant (CC). This relationship was established using single nuclei RNA sequencing of human frontal cortex, indicating that the T allele was associated with increased LRRK2 expression in microglia, thereby linking the SNP to Parkinson's disease risk through gene expression modulation.
title: Association of a Common Genetic Variant with Parkinson’s Disease is Propagated through Microglia

finding: The SNP rs900907976 was identified as a translationally silent mutation in exon 44 of the von Willebrand factor (VWF) gene. It was associated with inefficient removal of intron 44 in a von Willebrand disease (VWD) patient, leading to substantial intron retention (IR). The study suggested that this mutation introduced a cryptic splice donor site that interfered with the normal annotated splice site, favoring intron retention. The findings indicated that such deep exon mutations could have significant effects on pre-mRNA splicing and may inform therapeutic approaches for related diseases.
title: A deep exon cryptic splice site promotes aberrant intron retention in a von Willebrand disease patient

finding: The SNP rs11045818, located in the SLCO1B1 gene, was identified as an introgressed synonymous ESM associated with total bilirubin levels. Although its functional effect on splicing was not highly predictive, it was part of a credible set of variants influencing trait variation.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The SNP rs17730088 was identified in the KRT71 gene, relating to balding type 4. It was classified as an intronic introgressed variant, indicative of a potential role in trait variation through adaptive introgression.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: This SNP was linked to hair color changes and was assigned the highest score in its risk locus, based on experimental validation.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: A breast cancer risk SNP, found to possess regulatory activities on ATF7IP expression, it scored the highest among its risk locus variants.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: The SNP rs1131017 was identified as a significant sc-veQTL located in the 5'UTR of RPS26, showing an increasing effect on intra-individual dispersion in CD4 naive cells. Higher dispersion levels were associated with lower risks of auto-immune diseases like rheumatoid arthritis and type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The SNP rs1384 was found to be a monocyte-specific deQTL in the 3' UTR of LYZ, significantly associated with antibacterial activity. It replicated in an independent cohort, confirming its effect on gene expression dispersion in monocytes.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The SNP rs10784774 was documented as being in complete linkage disequilibrium with rs1384, with its G allele correlating with lower LYZ expression but higher dispersion in monocytes.
title: Genetic variants associated with cell-type-specific intra-individual gene expression variability reveal new mechanisms of genome regulation

finding: The SNP rs1705261 was identified as a strong tagging SNP for the common CNV CNVR5583.1, associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D). It showed a high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with an r² value of 0.998, indicating its potential significance in metabolic disease pathways.
title: Signatures Of Tspan8 Variants Associated With Human Metabolic Regulation And Diseases

finding: SNP rs1796330 was reported to be the most significant SNP associated with the outcome of type 2 diabetes (T2D), located near TSPAN8 exon 11, with a P-value of 3.20 x 10^-14 in a large GWAS analysis involving approximately 1 million participants.
title: Signatures Of Tspan8 Variants Associated With Human Metabolic Regulation And Diseases

finding: The SNP rs540249707 near METTL7B was associated with childhood obesity with an odds ratio of 3.6 (95% CI 2.13-6.08, P=1.77 x 10^-6), highlighting its relationship with obesity traits when compared to the FTO variant rs9928094.
title: Signatures Of Tspan8 Variants Associated With Human Metabolic Regulation And Diseases

finding: The FokI polymorphism (rs2228570) indicated that the ff genotype was associated with a higher sensitivity of glioblastoma stem-like cells to calcitriol treatment, suggesting this SNP played a crucial role in modulating the response to vitamin D3 therapy.
title: Molecular Determinants of Calcitriol Signaling and Sensitivity in Glioma Stem-like Cells

finding: The BsmI-ApaI-TaqI polymorphism (rs1544410) demonstrated that the 'baT' genotype increased sensitivity towards calcitriol in glioblastoma cells, highlighting its importance in the therapeutic response.
title: Molecular Determinants of Calcitriol Signaling and Sensitivity in Glioma Stem-like Cells

finding: In the context of the BsmI-ApaI-TaqI polymorphism (rs7975232), the presence of certain genotypes was associated with enhanced sensitivity to calcitriol treatment in glioblastoma, emphasizing its role in treatment efficacy.
title: Molecular Determinants of Calcitriol Signaling and Sensitivity in Glioma Stem-like Cells

finding: The TaqI variant (rs731236), as part of the BsmI-ApaI-TaqI polymorphism, linked to the 'baT' genotype, was shown to correlate with increased responsiveness to calcitriol in glioblastoma stem-like cells, reinforcing the significance of this SNP in therapeutic contexts.
title: Molecular Determinants of Calcitriol Signaling and Sensitivity in Glioma Stem-like Cells

finding: The SNP rs75219269 (G: 0.2595) was associated with allele 14 of vWA and showed a notable presence in the Asian population, indicating its relevance in genetic diversity in that demographic.
title: The concordance of length- and sequence-based STRs used in forensic markers with guidance for practice

finding: SNP rs773114 showed a lower association with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) but was identified as a positive finding in the study. It was located in an enhancer region of the RPS26 gene, which is believed to play a role in autoimmune diseases, indicating its potential as a causal variant.
title: Convolutional neural network model to predict causal risk factors that share complex regulatory features

finding: Similar to rs773114, SNP rs1873914 was a positive finding as it exhibited a lower association with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and was located in an active regulatory region of CD14+ monocytes, connecting it to the RPS26 gene, which has been implicated in autoimmune diseases.
title: Convolutional neural network model to predict causal risk factors that share complex regulatory features

finding: This SNP in <italic>ZNF664</italic> did not increase its expression but significantly affected the expression of the upstream gene <italic>CCDC92</italic> (log2FC=0.74).
title: CRISPR perturbations at many coronary artery disease loci impair vascular endothelial cell functions

finding: The SNP rs2041385, found within the TAPBPL gene, showed a relation to antidepressant (AD) response and was noted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for TAPBPL in various tissues. The gene TAPBPL is MHC-related and has been previously influenced by glucocorticoid signaling. The association with MDD populations was significant specifically in females.
title: Multi-omic modeling of antidepressant response implicates dynamic immune and inflammatory changes in individuals who respond to treatment

finding: The variant rs7132908 was validated as a causal SNP influencing childhood obesity at the chr12q13 locus. It affected gene expression of FAIM2 and other nearby genes, decreasing the proportion of hypothalamic neurons produced during differentiation, up-regulating cell death pathways, and down-regulating neuronal differentiation pathways. The risk allele (A) displayed allele-specific regulation of the FAIM2 promoter in primary astrocytes, linking rs7132908 to mechanisms of neurodevelopment and survival that contribute to obesity risk.
title: Variant-to-function analysis of the childhood obesity chr12q13 locus implicates rs7132908 as a causal variant within the 3’ UTR of FAIM2

finding: The study reported that the G allele of SNP rs10774671 was associated with the upregulation of the p46 splice variant of OAS1, providing protection against severe COVID-19. However, the Calu-3 cells used in the experiments were homozygous for the A allele and could not express the p46 variant. Thus, the finding highlighted that any reduction in SARS-CoV-2 replication observed in Calu-3 cells with low EXOSC2 levels could only involve OAS3 and not OAS1, indicating a potential underestimation of the protective role of OAS proteins against viral replication in individuals with the G allele.
title: Low expression of EXOSC2 protects against clinical COVID-19 and impedes SARS-CoV-2 replication

finding: The rs138066904 SNP associated with the HMGA2 locus was found to be genome-wide significant in this study with a p-value of 2.516 × 10^-9. This deletion variant is noted as significant in sub-Saharan populations, differing from the SNP variants previously reported in other populations.
title: A Novel Type 2 Diabetes Locus in sub-Saharan Africans, ZRANB3, is Implicated in Beta Cell Proliferation

finding: The SNP rs7306304 was associated with CLECL1, where increased CLECL1 expression with higher macrophage proportions was linked to a decrease in MS risk.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: This variant in TPCN1 was mapped to the putamen and substantia nigra, indicating its role in calcium signaling in the brain which may relate to neuromodulation processes.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The variant rs10842717, linked to ITPR2, revealed significant associations with putamen areas, highlighting its potential role in intracellular calcium release mechanisms.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The MHS allele VTR1A-rs10877969(T) was noted as a major allele in modern human populations, suggesting its relevance to social traits.
title: Oxytocin and vasotocin receptor variation sheds light into the evolution of human prosociality

finding: The missense mutation Gln76Lys (rs4760682) in the PFKM gene was associated with lactate levels, albeit with lower significance than other PFKP SNPs due to its lower minor allele frequency in the donor population.
title: Biological and Genetic Determinants of Glycolysis: Phosphofructokinase Isoforms Boost Energy Status of Stored Red Blood Cells and Transfusion Outcomes

finding: This SNP was recognized as a reliable biomarker and putative therapeutic target for hepatocellular carcinogenesis and metastasis.
title: Propagated circulating tumor cells uncovers the role of NFκB and COP1 in metastasis

finding: The SNP rs3919533 was associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) through a nearly genome-wide significant variant located 5Kb upstream of the C1S gene. Carriers of the T allele displayed significantly increased C1S protein levels, which were linked to elevated AD risk. This finding was substantiated by human brain proteomics showing consistent elevation of all classical pathway proteins, indicating a direct relationship between this variant and the complement pathway's contribution to AD.
title: Therapeutically targeting the classical complement pathway with antisense oligonucleotides in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs782726275 was identified as a rare intronic variant within the C1S gene and was found to be enriched in the Finnish population. It was significantly associated with AD risk, particularly pronounced in mixed phenotypes of AD. This association provided additional evidence for the role of the complement pathway in AD susceptibility.
title: Therapeutically targeting the classical complement pathway with antisense oligonucleotides in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: At the KITLG locus, SIA found a moderate signal of selection with a selection probability of 0.87 and a selection coefficient around 0.0019, suggesting its role in pigmentation-related traits.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: The rs60542959 SNP resulted in the loss of the start codon in COQ10A and was identified as a credible NIM for both mean platelet volume and standing height. This mutation was significant because COQ10 genes are essential in respiratory chain reactions, and the loss of the start codon could significantly affect COQ10A expression in immune cells.
title: The lingering effects of Neanderthal introgression on human complex traits

finding: The rs2066807 SNP was identified as the first adaptive introgression locus, causing an amino acid change (I594M) in the STAT2 gene. This gene is involved in immune response, and its related introgressed variant was found to segregate in the UK Biobank population, indicating its significance in trait variation.
title: The lingering effects of Neanderthal introgression on human complex traits

finding: The SNP rs1034936, associated with the Cacna1c gene, was identified as a significant correlation with alcohol dependence in patients with bipolar disorder. This finding highlighted Cacna1c as critical for social behavior in rodents and its implication in human psychiatric traits, affirming the relevance of this genetic variant in mental health research.
title: Genome-wide association study of open field behavior in outbred heterogeneous stock rats identifies multiple loci implicated in psychiatric disorders

finding: This SNP was identified in an open chromatin region that showed increased accessibility in pro-B cells. This suggests it may play a significant role in the BCP ALL context, particularly in relation to the ELK3 transcription factor.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: Like rs2268508, this SNP was located in an open chromatin region highly accessible in pro-B cells. It was linked to the ELK3 transcription factor, which is critical in the differentiation of B cells.
title: Uncovering the cis-regulatory program of early human B-cell commitment and its implications in the pathogenesis of B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs11180470 exhibited GxC effects associated with two MOFA factors. The genetic effect was linked with the gene GLIPR1L1, suggesting complex interactions across different cellular contexts.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: SNP rs112581165 exhibited a significant downregulation of the L1 family gene set (NES = -4.32, FDR = 5.18E-89), highlighting its regulatory function despite not being linked to a protein-coding gene.
title: A Computational Approach for the Identification of Novel L1 Transcriptional Regulators

finding: The SNP rs11050678 was found to relate to the non-essential amino acid cysteine, which was identified as essential for tumor proliferation and survival according to research by Combs and DeNicola (2019). This indicated that variations in this SNP could affect tumor growth dynamics.
title: PANAMA enabled high sensitivity dual nanoflow LC/MS metabolomics and proteomics analysis

finding: The SNP rs3184504 in the SH2B3 gene showed strong evidence for positive selection (logLR=16.8512) and was linked to a stronger cytokine response to bacterial stimuli, supporting its role in pathogen resistance.
title: Prioritising Autoimmunity Risk Variants for Functional Analyses by Fine-Mapping Mutations Under Natural Selection

finding: This SNP demonstrated comparable evidence for positive selection (logLR=16.8512) and was found in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs3184504, suggesting its potential role as a more relevant adaptive candidate.
title: Prioritising Autoimmunity Risk Variants for Functional Analyses by Fine-Mapping Mutations Under Natural Selection

finding: The variant rs653178 exhibited even stronger evidence for positive selection (logLR=21.9757) than rs3184504, suggesting that it could represent a better candidate for adaptive significance in the same risk locus.
title: Prioritising Autoimmunity Risk Variants for Functional Analyses by Fine-Mapping Mutations Under Natural Selection

finding: The SNP rs1466535 located at 12q13.3 in the LRP1 gene was nominally associated with the diameter of the aneurysm sac, with a significance p-value of 0.013. This finding suggests a potential role of this variant in influencing aneurysm size.
title: Polygenic Susceptibility of Aortic Aneurysms Associates to the Diameter of the Aneurysm Sac: the Aneurysm-Express Biobank Cohort

finding: The SNP rs11064685 was located within the SRRM4 gene and exhibited a significantly different distribution between cases of autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and controls in the replication cohort, with a p-value of 0.03. This finding was part of a cluster-based genome-wide association study which identified loci related to ASD.
title: Clustering by phenotype and genome-wide association study in autism

finding: The genetic variant Arg40Cys in hP2X2 (rs75585377) was identified as being significantly associated with several blood phenotypes in aggregated PHEWAS data from the UK Biobank. Findings included strong associations with corpuscular volume (p-value: 15.23), reticulocyte volume (p-value: 13.08), corpuscular haemoglobin (p-value: 12.75), and sphered cell volume (p-value: 9.17). Despite this, the equivalent mutation in rP2X2 (R28C) showed no significant effect on apparent ATP affinity, indicating potential variability in functional impact depending on species or specific P2X2 receptor variants.
title: P2X2 receptor subunit interfaces are missense variant hotspots where mutations tend to increase apparent ATP affinity

finding: The SNP rs6538694 was identified as having a significant impact on splicing outcomes, suppressing the formation of the spliced gene product across three different cell lines. The p-values for these findings were highly significant, with values less than or equal to 4.6×10^-5, indicating a strong association with altered splicing. This finding illustrated the potential of rs6538694 to contribute to disease pathogenesis through its role in RNA splicing.
title: RegSNPs-Intron: A computational framework for prioritizing Intronic Single Nucleotide Variants in Human Genetic Disease

finding: The SNP rs1131454 was identified as a common human OAS1 locus variant that was enriched in European and African COVID-19 patients requiring hospitalization. This variant was shown to elevate the expression of an OAS1 transcript containing a premature stop-codon, leading to transcript NMD degradation, reduced OAS1 protein expression, and impaired viral clearance.
title: SARS-CoV-2 selectively induces the expression of unproductive splicing isoforms of interferon, class I MHC and splicing machinery genes

finding: Similar to rs1131454, the SNP rs10774671 was also described as a common variant in the OAS1 locus that was enriched in COVID-19 patients requiring hospitalization. Its presence was associated with increased expression of an OAS1 transcript with a premature stop-codon, resulting in transcript NMD degradation, which negatively impacted OAS1 protein levels and the capacity for viral clearance.
title: SARS-CoV-2 selectively induces the expression of unproductive splicing isoforms of interferon, class I MHC and splicing machinery genes

finding: The SNP rs2242367 was found to be a significant genetic determinant of survival in primary tauopathies, with a p-value of 7.5x10^-10 and a hazard ratio of 2.24, indicating that variations at this locus were linked to survival rates from motor symptom onset to death in PSP patients. This association was replicated across different cohorts, suggesting its robustness.
title: Common variation at the LRRK2 locus is associated with survival in the primary tauopathy progressive supranuclear palsy

finding: The SNP rs5742714 was identified as a risk SNP located in the promoter region of IGF1, which is a well-known growth factor associated with height. Analysis of a risk region around this SNP revealed that the top-ranked variants within this region exhibited significantly higher absolute log fold changes of average height compared to lower-ranked variants, suggesting a strong association between this SNP and height phenotype.
title: DeepCAGE: Incorporating Transcription Factors in Genome-wide Prediction of Chromatin Accessibility

finding: The rs3087335 variant, which leads to the Cdk2^Y15S allele, was identified as a gain-of-function semidominant allele that resulted in a Sertoli Cell Only Syndrome (SCOS)-like phenotype. Mice with this SNP demonstrated age-dependent testis histopathology and decreased sperm production, suggesting that the mutation allowed for excessive spermatogonial proliferation at the expense of SSC regeneration and maintenance. This emphasized the critical role of CDK2 activity regulation in male germ cell development.
title: CDK2 kinase activity is a regulator of male germ cell fate

finding: The analysis of SNP rs7956809 (C/G), located in the KRT4 gene, revealed that it was particularly informative regarding sample contamination. It showed low allelic variation in the GTEx cohort, with only five individuals being homozygous for the alternative allele (G). In the specific case of sample GTEX1, it was homozygous C in both DNA and matched esophagus RNA-Seq data. However, in the GTEX1 fibroblast sample, it displayed a significant contamination with 87% G reads, implicating that GTEX2, an esophagus sample sequenced on the same day, was the likely dominant contaminant.
title: Basal Contamination of Bulk Sequencing: Lessons from the GTEx dataset

finding: The rs4149013 polymorphism of the SLCO1B1 gene significantly increased hepatotoxicity risk with an odds ratio of 1.67 when comparing the heterozygous genotype to homozygous wild-type.
title: Association of variants within the GST and other genes with anti-tubercular agents related toxicity: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was associated with the PR interval (P = 7.62 x 10^-13) and was noted to loop to the cardiac specific transcription factor TBX3.
title: Detailed Regulatory Interaction Map of the Human Heart Facilitates Gene Discovery for Cardiovascular Disease

finding: The lead SNP rs10876864, associated with creativity, was near the RPS26 gene, previously linked to anorexia nervosa (AN), showcasing genetic ties between creativity and eating disorders.
title: Genetic architecture of creativity and extensive genetic overlap with psychiatric disorders revealed from genome-wide association analyses of 241,736 individuals

finding: The SNP rs1716183 was associated with the gene OGFOD2 in neurons and demonstrated colocalization with schizophrenia (SCZ) and intelligence quotient (IQ). It was shown to overlap neuronal enhancers and connect with the OGFOD2 promoter, highlighting its regulatory role in relevant neuropsychiatric phenotypes.
title: Single-cell Mendelian randomisation identifies cell-type specific genetic effects on human brain disease and behaviour

finding: The SNP rs11111663 was identified as a significant factor associated with the actin-binding protein Plastin-3, which was involved in the pathogenesis of Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML). The research indicated that this SNP might contribute to alterations in actin organization, potentially affecting cellular processes critical in the development of AML.
title: Allosteric Regulation of Human Plastins

finding: The SNP rs75770066 was identified as a low-frequency, nonsynonymous variant in the HELB gene, causing a D506G substitution in the helicase protein. This alteration was associated with conflicting reports on age at natural menopause (ANM). Heterozygous individuals with one copy of rs75770066 experienced an increase in ANM by approximately 1 year, while homozygous individuals for the rare allele had an ANM approximately 1 year earlier. This suggested that the interaction impairment of D506G-HELB with RPA reduced its recruitment to sites of DNA damage, potentially leading to altered meiotic recombination levels, which could affect oocyte viability and, subsequently, the age of menopause.
title: Rare SNP in the HELB gene interferes with RPA interaction and cellular function of HELB

finding: The SNP IFNG rs1861494 was associated with increased IFN-γ secretion and more severe symptoms of Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD). Transcriptomic studies demonstrated elevated IFN-γ gene expression in patients with ulcerative colitis (UC), supporting its role in the pathogenesis of IBD.
title: Modulatory Effects of IFN-γ and IL-22 on Inflammatory Signaling and Cellular Responses in Intestinal Epithelial Cells

finding: The missense variant rs11053646 in OLR1 exhibited a significant sex-specific association with carotid atherosclerotic plaque among Dominican Hispanic individuals. In females, the SNP was significantly associated with plaque presence and various plaque sub-phenotypes; however, no significant associations were observed in males. This finding underscored the importance of considering sex differences in genetic association studies.
title: Genetic regulatory effects in response to a high cholesterol, high fat diet in baboons

finding: This reQTL for the gene OAS1 showed an increase in eQTL effect, particularly magnified in CD4+ T and B cells during the IAV perturbation. The state-specific interaction effects highlighted its relevance in the context of immune response.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: In the IAV perturbation model, the reQTL rs12819511 for the gene KRR1 had significant statistical relationships, consistent across different perturbation experiments.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: This SNP was identified as a reQTL in multiple perturbation contexts, showing its importance in gene regulation across different pathogens.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: This reQTL for COX14 was linked to lymphocyte counts and evidenced its significance under the CA perturbation in the 2df model.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: The reQTL for RPS26 showed significant interaction effects in RA context, indicating its relevance in autoimmune disease pathways.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: The reQTL engaged in cell-type-specific effects for RPS26 across multiple perturbation experiments, highlighting its regulatory complexity.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: SIA identified a moderate selection signal at the KITLG locus (rs12821256) with a sweep probability of 0.87 and a selection coefficient around 0.0019, contributing to the understanding of pigmentation-related traits.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: The study reported that rs11172113 was the most likely causal variant associated with several vascular disease traits including fibromuscular dysplasia (FMD), migraine, pulse pressure, and pulmonary function. The T allele of rs11172113 was found to correlate with higher expression of LRP1, suggesting its role in regulating vascular health. The location of rs11172113 was confirmed to be within an enhancer region that modulated LRP1 expression, with transcription factors SNAIL and MECP2 identified as repressors of LRP1 through an allele-specific mechanism.
title: Regulatory mechanisms in multiple vascular diseases locus LRP1 involve repression by SNAIL and extracellular matrix remodeling

finding: The SNP rs1861494 was found to be associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) disease severity. Specifically, it was linked to functional changes in the methylation of the interferon gamma gene (IFNG) and alterations in its protein secretion levels. This research highlighted the significance of this SNP in understanding the epigenetic mechanisms underlying IBD.
title: Epigenetic modulation of NLRP6 inflammasome sensor as a therapeutic modality to reduce necroptosis-driven gastrointestinal mucosal dysfunction in HIV/SIV infection

finding: The study found that the LRRK2 G2019S variant (rs34637584) was associated with alterations in urine BMP levels, implicating LRRK2's role in lysosomal dysfunction in Parkinson's disease. This variant was tested in a linear model accounting for age, sex, disease status, and other factors.
title: LRRK2 Kinase Activity Regulates Parkinson’s Disease-Relevant Lipids at the Lysosome

finding: The LRRK2 N551K variant (rs7308720) was also identified as being associated with changes in urine BMP levels, confirming its correlation with lysosomal dysfunction in Parkinson's disease within the context of the study.
title: LRRK2 Kinase Activity Regulates Parkinson’s Disease-Relevant Lipids at the Lysosome

finding: The SNP rs10876864, which is associated with vitiligo, showed a significant regulatory interaction with the GDF11 gene in several skin and immune cell lines. This was characterized by high interaction counts and the presence of H3k4me1, an active enhancer mark, highlighting its role in skin biology.
title: Leveraging epigenomes and three-dimensional genome organization for interpreting regulatory variation

finding: The SNP rs11050666 was positively associated with telomerase activity when analyzed in the context of a 13-gene signature. This finding related to the regulation of telomerase/hTERT alternative splicing in cancer samples, suggesting that variations in this SNP might influence cancer stemness and proliferation through modulation of telomerase activity. The study also linked this SNP to increased understanding of cancer biology, particularly in the framework of the EXTEND computational model.
title: Inferring Telomerase Enzymatic Activity from Expression Data

finding: The SNP rs10842692, located at the SSPN locus, was linked to 14 different cancers in an omni-directional analysis, indicating a robust pleiotropic effect across various cancer types.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The top lead SNP rs116367042 was associated with plasma PCSK9 levels with a genome-wide significance, showing a P-value of 5.97e-09. This locus was on chromosome 12p13.32, close to the gene KCNA5, and supported by significant eQTLs for multiple genes in the region.
title: Genome-wide association of PCSK9 (Proprotein Convertase Subtilisin/Kexin Type 9) plasma levels in the ELSA-Brasil study

finding: For the rs4766428 (ATP2A2) deletion experiment, a deletion rate of approximately 50% was reported in the screening of bulk transfected cells. After single-cell cloning, 29 out of 41 clones (71%) were shown to be heterozygous.
title: CRISPR Del/Rei: A simple, flexible and efficient pipeline for scarless genome editing

finding: The SNP rs78194510 was associated with the gene SCARB1, which is implicated in cholesterol exchange regulation. It was found to be highly expressed in capillary endothelial cells and pericytes in AD, suggesting its role in mediating HDL signaling. The relationship was substantiated by multiple lines of evidence including endothelial Hi-C and specific eQTLs.
title: Single-cell multi-region dissection of brain vasculature in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The G allele and AG+GG genotypes at rs6606743 within the TRPV4 locus were significantly associated with fungal sensitization and asthma in a study involving 211 participants from the Childhood Origins of Asthma (COAST) cohort. This SNP was located 496 kb upstream of the TRPV4 gene's transcription start site, influencing TRPV4 expression in epithelial tissues, with significant associations found in both the esophagus (P = 4.5e-5) and skin (P = 2.4e-7). This indicated a link between increased TRPV4 expression and the risk of sensitization to fungal allergens and asthma.
title: Club cell TRPV4 as a damage sensor driving lung allergic inflammation

finding: In the context of human colorectal carcinoma, the SNP rs11060776 was associated with the presence of B lymphocytes that actively secreted immunoglobulin isotypes A, G, and M. This finding suggested a possible link between the genetic variation at this locus and the functionality of B cells in the tumor microenvironment, aligning with other data indicating the role of tumor-infiltrating B cells in immune responses.
title: Antibody repertoire analysis of tumor-infiltrating B cells reveals distinct signatures and distributions across tissues

finding: The SNP rs61759623, located in the KRAS gene, was identified as significantly associated with distinguishing PCAND from T2DM, reporting a p-value of 0.005. This identification was part of a broader investigation into genetic markers for PCAND.
title: Sorcin-STAT3-Serpin E1/CCL5 axis can be the trigger of pancreatic cancer-associated new-onset diabetes

finding: The SNP rs7953280 was associated with the promoter of Suppressor Of Cytokine Signaling 2 (SOCS2), located in an intron of the CRADD gene. This variant was shown to influence enhancer activity that affects SOCS2 expression, and its role in promoting pro-inflammatory responses in osteoarthritis was highlighted.
title: 3D Chromatin Structure in Chondrocytes Identifies Putative Osteoarthritis Risk Genes

finding: The rs34637584 SNP, which corresponds to the LRRK2 p.G2019S mutation, was found to be a strong risk factor for Parkinson's Disease (PD), with a prevalence of about 1% in the PD population of European ancestry. The mutation was associated with higher penetrance of PD, particularly in younger individuals, indicating a significant role of genetic risk in the penetrance of PD among carriers.
title: Penetrance of Parkinson’s disease in LRRK2 p.G2019S carriers is modified by a polygenic risk score

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was identified as strongly associated with hundreds of traits, particularly its effect on low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) in relation to stroke. It contributed to a distinct statistical mode in the analysis that suggested a potential pathway linking LDL-C to stroke occurrence. However, when this SNP was removed from consideration, the statistical mode disappeared, indicating its significant influence as an outlier rather than part of a broader pleiotropic pathway associated with multiple genes.
title: Causal Inference for Heritable Phenotypic Risk Factors Using Heterogeneous Genetic Instruments

finding: The rs34637584 SNP, corresponding to the LRRK2 p.G2019S mutation, was identified as a major contributor to Parkinson's Disease (PD) with an estimated prevalence of approximately 1% among PD patients of European ancestry and significantly higher in certain populations. This mutation was linked to increased risk and penetrance of PD among carriers, especially influenced by polygenic risk scores (PRS), suggesting cumulative genetic risk factors impact the likelihood of developing PD.
title: Penetrance of Parkinson’s disease in LRRK2 p.G2019S carriers is modified by a polygenic risk score

finding: An interactive association was established between intronic polymorphism rs10506151 of the LRRK2 gene and Type 2 Diabetes, affecting susceptibility to neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Study on potential differentially expressed genes in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis by bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The variant rs11055880 was shown to have a significant effect on the expression of ATF7IP, where the introduction of the protective allele resulted in a 9-fold increase in luciferase activity (p<0.0001). Conversely, the risk-associated allele reduced this luciferase activity by 50% (p<0.001), thus connecting this SNP to breast cancer (BC) risk through its regulatory role on this potential tumor-suppressor gene.
title: CRISPR screens identify gene targets and drug repositioning opportunities at breast cancer risk loci

finding: The variant rs16909788, when analyzed in conjunction with other SNPs, was part of a protective haplotype that increased promoter activity of ATF7IP. However, when this SNP was altered to the risk-associated allele, it did not decrease the luciferase activity significantly, indicating a complex interaction with BC risk that further supports its role in regulating ATF7IP.
title: CRISPR screens identify gene targets and drug repositioning opportunities at breast cancer risk loci

finding: Similar to rs16909788, the SNP rs17221259 was part of the protective haplotype which enhanced ATF7IP promoter activity. Modification of this SNP to reflect the risk-associated allele showed no significant impact on luciferase activity, reinforcing its regulatory relationship with breast cancer risk through its influence on ATF7IP.
title: CRISPR screens identify gene targets and drug repositioning opportunities at breast cancer risk loci

finding: This SNP was identified in individual S6, linked to hereditary spastic paraplegia, a condition that induces muscle stiffness in the lower limbs. Individual S11, father of S6, presented with signs of a limb condition that could be associated with this disease, raising the likelihood that the allele was present in the analyzed population.
title: Interdisciplinary analyses of Bronze Age communities from Western Hungary reveal complex population histories

finding: The SNP rs3759384 was associated with decreased expression of VPS29 in the brain and significantly increased risk for schizophrenia in the unadjusted analysis. It had a larger conditional effect size after adjustment, suggesting a disorder-specific effect linked to schizophrenia.
title: Conditional GWAS analysis identifies putative disorder-specific SNPs for psychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs11060818 was found to be associated with the regulation of RhoB gene expression during tumorigenesis and the aging process. Its effect was significant enough to suggest potential applications in understanding cancer mechanisms and aging, specifically regarding how this SNP might influence cancer patient prognosis.
title: Reboot: a straightforward approach to identify genes and splicing isoforms associated with cancer patient prognosis

finding: The SNP rs11111675 was linked to voltage-gated sodium channels and referenced in the context of evidence for their expression in carcinomas, which was related to the metastasis potential of glioblastoma cells. Within the study's findings, U-251MG's cathodal electrotaxis was mediated through specific ion channel activities, making this SNP relevant to the complex mechanisms driving tumor behavior in glioblastoma.
title: Voltage-gated ion channels mediate the electrotaxis of glioblastoma cells in a hybrid PMMA/PDMS microdevice

finding: The SNP rs4931726 was noted as an intronic variant of the LOC107984462 non-coding RNA on chromosome 12, with a significant association to FVC in the asthmatic subgroup (p = 4.9 × 10−11). It was also located 150 kb from rs191000678, a SNP previously associated with FEV1.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: The SNP rs2169752 was identified as an intronic variant of the CCDC91 protein coding gene on chromosome 12, with a strong association to lung function (p = 1.8 × 10−41). This locus was also 43 kb away from rs7977418, which was previously associated with lung function.
title: Omnibus Inverse Normal Transformation Based Association Test Improves Power in Genome-Wide Association Studies of Quantitative Traits

finding: The SNP rs2133896 in the ANKS1B gene showed strong association with heroin and methamphetamine dependence (P=4.09×10⁻⁸). Its effects included influencing gene expression, addiction behaviors, and brain imaging characteristics related to heroin use.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies common genetic risk factors for alcohol, heroin and methamphetamine dependence

finding: The SNP rs11060818 was associated with the regulation of RhoB gene expression during tumorigenesis and the aging process as reported by Gutierrez et al. (2019). This finding was contextualized within the influence of RhoB on important cellular mechanisms, including those related to oncogenesis and age-related cellular dynamics.
title: RhoB promotes Salmonella survival by regulating autophagy

finding: The SNP rs76895963, a conserved intronic SNP in a promoter of the gene CCND2, was fine-mapped for traits including bone mineral density, height, red blood cell count, systolic blood pressure, and triglycerides. CCND2 is involved in cell cycle regulation and is linked to delayed psychomotor development.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: rs11171739 was recognized as a novel eQTL for RPS26 in both fetal and adult cortex with significant associations related to educational attainment, supporting genetic influences on cognitive capabilities.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The missense coding variant rs145878042 in RAPGEF3 significantly impacted hemoglobin levels after BMI and WHR adjustment, demonstrating a p-value of 2.4×10⁻¹⁴, which was a significant improvement from its unadjusted p-value of 0.003. This SNP was previously linked to obesity and adiposity.
title: Obesity and adiposity have opposing genetic impacts on human blood traits

finding: The rs12315677 variant was significantly associated with fasting glucose (FG) in Hispanic individuals (β=0.0387 mmol/l, P=4.0×10^-8) but not in European individuals (β=-0.0029 mmol/l, P=0.39). This SNP lies within the PIK3C2G gene, which acts as a Rab5 effector and is involved in various metabolic processes.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The rs12819124 variant was identified as likely causal for HbA1c through trans-ancestry fine-mapping and was also linked to associations with fasting insulin (FI), suggesting its relevance across multiple glycaemic traits.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The rs111264094 SNP was identified as the likely causal variant for fasting insulin (FI) in European ancestry populations based on fine-mapping. It represents a distinct signal separate from the HbA1c related variant in the same locus.
title: The Trans-Ancestral Genomic Architecture of Glycaemic Traits

finding: The rs10774671 SNP was characterized as a splicing QTL influencing OAS1 gene expression. The alternative allele (A) downregulated OAS1 expression, correlating with increased susceptibility to COVID-19 as indicated by its association with GWAS findings.
