This variant was found to disrupt splicing motifs, leading to the generation of multiple isoforms of the OAS1 protein, which are associated with impaired antiviral action against SARS-CoV-2.
title: Mapping interindividual dynamics of innate immune response at single-cell resolution

finding: The rs7132327 variant was revealed to have associations with electrical phenotypes, further establishing it as relevant to conduction traits in adults, indicating potential implications of trabecular characteristics on cardiac electrical activity.
title: Genomic analysis reveals a functional role for myocardial trabeculae in adults

finding: This SNP in B4GALNT3 was directionally consistent with findings from other consortia and showed nominal significance.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: Associated with WHRadjBMI, this SNP had a significant credible set with other findings related to this trait.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The variant rs7132908 in the FAIM2 gene was associated with childhood obesity, severe obesity, and BMI, with notable G×E effects driven by alcohol frequency in women.
title: Genome-wide scale analyses identify novel BMI genotype-environment interactions using a conditional false discovery rate

finding: This SNP had been previously detected to be associated with neuroticism and was categorized as a potentially pathogenic variant, indicating its relevance to the trait's genetic basis.
title: Gene-based association analysis identified 190 genes with polymorphisms affecting neuroticism

finding: The rs3782235-tagged CRE was significantly linked to the expression of the adjacent gene RBMS2, leading to its upregulation as confirmed by RT-qPCR. Furthermore, this SNP was associated with hematocrit percentage, indicating its role in haematocrit-related traits.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs34637584, a missense variant associated with LRRK2 (G2019S), was identified as one of the top variants in the study related to Parkinson's disease (PD). This variant was previously known to be linked to increased risk for PD.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The SNP rs202134984, related to PTPRB, was found to be significantly enriched in GBA1-N409S carriers, revealing a potentially new link in the genetic drivers associated with PD.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: A significant association was observed between the insulin-like growth factor-1 gene rs6214 polymorphism and simple myopia, as well as high-grade myopia in Egyptian patients. This finding related to how genetic variations may influence myopia development through mechanisms involving retinal glial cells and hormonal regulation.
title: Retinal glial cells under hypoxia possibly function in mammalian myopia by responding to mechanical stimuli, affecting hormone metabolism and peptide secretion

finding: The 3' UTR splice acceptor variant rs939016030 in TAC3 was associated with later age of menarche, with an effect of 0.57 s.d.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: The SNP rs11609649 was associated with ALX1 and identified in cranial vault segment 5, corresponding to the frontal region, indicating its role in cranial vault shape.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: The SNP rs11111664 was identified in the context of a study investigating the role of IL-33 in eosinophil activation and its implications in cancer. The research revealed that IL-33 promotes the adhesion of eosinophils to cancer cells through a CD11b/CD18-mediated interaction, which leads to polarized degranulation of eosinophils and subsequent tumor cell killing. This finding underscored the importance of the rs11111664 SNP in enhancing the anti-tumor activity of eosinophils, positioning it as a significant factor in Th2 immunity associated with cancer.
title: Complementary methods for the study of interactions between eosinophils and cancer cells

finding: In patients homozygous for the alternative allele of rs11060180 in CCDC62, it was associated with a high decrease in AAO, making it a potential risk factor for earlier onset.
title: Identification of representative trees in random forests based on a new tree-based distance measure

finding: A previous study indicated a link between insulin resistance and the AACS gene SNP rs12818316. This finding suggested that variations at this SNP could be associated with altered glucose metabolism and energy production pathways, particularly in the context of hepatocellular carcinoma cells.
title: Role of acetoacetyl-CoA synthetase in glucose uptake by HepG2 cells

finding: In the KSR2 locus, rs79310463 had a PPA of 25% and was associated with allelic effects as well as overlapping snATAC-seq peaks, indicating strong evidence of functional relevance. It had been previously described as causal for T2D.
title: Regulatory variants active in iPSC-derived pancreatic progenitor cells are associated with Type 2 Diabetes in adults

finding: Identified as a gain-of-function variant, it was understood to create a downstream CstF-binding motif (GT-rich) and exhibited significantly higher variant fold changes in comparison to other mutations. The findings emphasized altered interactions with nearby T-rich motifs, elucidating its amplified effects.
title: Deciphering the Impact of Genetic Variation on Human Polyadenylation

finding: The SNP rs11050685 was studied in the context of developing picornaviruses for cancer therapy. This investigation contributed to a growing understanding of how specific genetic variants might influence therapeutic responses in NPEV applications. The findings underscored the potential for utilizing SNPs in tailoring treatments involving enteroviruses.
title: High-resolution structural analysis of enterovirus-reactive polyclonal antibodies in complex with whole virions

finding: The TMTC2 variant was significantly associated with longevity in the Ashkenazi Jewish population, confirming its relevance through Bonferroni-adjusted p-values.
title: Exome-wide association studies in general and long-lived populations identify genetic variants related to human age

finding: The study found that the SNP rs11111624 was associated with altered adenylyl cyclase activity, which impacted phosphorylation-dependent inactivation of Orai1 and promoted migration in MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells. This was significant in the context of PKA activity regulation during cellular migration, as it suggested a potential link between genetic variants and cell behavior in cancer progression.
title: Protein Kinase a Activity in the Leading Edge of Migrating Cells is Dependent on the Activity of Focal Adhesion Kinase

finding: The study identified that the TPH2 SNP rs4570625 (−703 G/T) was significantly involved in the interaction between childhood maltreatment (CM) exposure and emotional behavior. Specifically, TT carriers exhibited higher levels of punishment sensitivity associated with greater exposure to CM. Additionally, higher CM exposure in TT homozygotes correlated with increased gray matter volumes in thalamic-limbic-prefrontal circuits. This finding was linked to enhanced threat avoidance behaviors, suggesting the genotype's role in modulating emotional responses related to aversive experiences.
title: Serotonin and childhood maltreatment interact to shape brain architecture and anxious avoidant behavior – a TPH2 imaging genetics approach

finding: The clQTL rs1291356 was found to influence chromosomal contacts and chromatin state regulation at the EMP1 locus, providing insights into its regulatory function in CAD-related pathways.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The bQTL and caQTL rs7979663 exhibited allelic enrichments in TCF21 binding and chromatin accessibility at the EMP1 locus, indicating its relevance to CAD.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The SNP rs138800983 was associated with the phenotype 'Relative age of first facial hair' (UK Biobank Field ID: 2375). It had a minor allele frequency of 0.3% and a p-value of 8.4E-10, and this variant is connected to the gene KRT75.
title: Efficient mixed model approach for large-scale genome-wide association studies of ordinal categorical phenotypes

finding: The vitamin D receptor gene polymorphism rs2228570 (FokI) was found to be associated with increased susceptibility to hypertension among the Bangladeshi population.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The GNB3 gene variant rs5443 was implicated in the endothelial dysfunction pathway among hypertensive patients, suggesting its relevance to cardiovascular health.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs2133896 SNP in the ANKS1B gene was associated with addiction to heroin, methamphetamine, and alcohol. It showed a significant genetic correlation across all three substance dependencies (P_meta = 3.60×10−9). The SNP affected gene expression levels and was linked to gray and white matter changes in the brain regions associated with addiction, as indicated by e-QTL studies and imaging analysis.
title: Identification of novel risk loci with shared effects on alcoholism, heroin and methamphetamine dependence

finding: The IFN-γ (rs12369470) CC genotype was significantly associated with susceptibility to BKV infection, indicating that polymorphisms in the IFN-γ gene may confer predisposition to BKV infection.
title: The change of lymphocyte subsets and inflammatory cytokine in BK viruria

finding: The rs6489844-G SNP was associated with decreased expression of VHRT in human left ventricle tissue and suggestively linked to an increased risk for heart failure (HF), highlighting its potential role in heart disease.
title: Long noncoding RNA VENTHEART is required for cardiomyocyte specification and function

finding: The rs11065780-C SNP was significantly associated with low VHRT expression in human left ventricle tissue and an increased risk for heart failure, indicating its relevance in cardiac pathology.
title: Long noncoding RNA VENTHEART is required for cardiomyocyte specification and function

finding: The SNP rs73123652 was identified as a distinct risk locus for volumetric imaging derived phenotypes. It was successfully replicated in an independent dataset from the ENIGMA consortium with a high significance level (P = 6.25 × 10−30) under the genome-wide significance threshold (P < 5 × 10−8).
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs77956314 was another distinct risk locus identified in the study, which was replicated in an independent dataset from the ENIGMA consortium at a highly significant level (P = 6.25 × 10−30), reinforcing its association with volumetric imaging derived phenotypes.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10507144 was highlighted as having a high observed probability of being a deleterious variant (CADD score ≥ 20) and was among the genome-wide significant SNPs linked to volumetric imaging derived phenotypes.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs5442 was identified within the GNB3 locus as a missense variant that was associated with a 30% increased risk of high myopia. The imaging data showed evidence of myopic fundus activation in the presence of the risk allele A.
title: transferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The SNP rs17467284 was associated with a Denisovan-specific missense mutation that resulted in an amino acid change in the protein MUC19. This finding was considered significant due to the mutation's Grantham score of 102, classifying it as moderately radical. It was identified within an exon conserved across vertebrates, indicating its potential importance in protein function. The mutation's location between two Von Willebrand factor D domains was noted to be critical for the formation of mucin polymers. Consequently, this SNP was hypothesized to impact the polymerization properties of MUC19, thus potentially affecting the viscosity of the mucin matrix.
title: The MUC19 gene in Denisovans, Neanderthals, and Modern Humans: An Evolutionary History of Recurrent Introgression and Natural Selection

finding: In the context of the study, rs1047039, located in the 3' UTR region of the <italic>TESPA1</italic> gene, was identified as one of the three heterozygous single nucleotide polymorphisms (hSNPs) within short reads. The findings indicated that the presence of this SNP was observed in nearly all reads, supporting the hypothesis that the high expression of <italic>TESPA1</italic> was largely due to the <italic>IGF2BP2::TESPA1</italic> fusion, suggesting a genomic origin of this expression.
title: Detection of isoforms and genomic alterations by high-throughput full-length single-cell RNA sequencing for personalized oncology

finding: This SNP, also found in the 3' UTR region of the <italic>TESPA1</italic> gene, was noted as one of the three heterozygous SNPs identified in the short-read data. It was associated with a similar occurrence as rs1047039; nearly all reads covering this SNP were mutated, aligning with the study's hypothesis that the high expression levels of <italic>TESPA1</italic> were primarily due to the <italic>IGF2BP2::TESPA1</italic> fusion and indicating a genomic origin.
title: Detection of isoforms and genomic alterations by high-throughput full-length single-cell RNA sequencing for personalized oncology

finding: Located in the 3' UTR region of <italic>TESPA1</italic>, rs2171497 was also reported as one of the three heterozygous SNPs discovered in the short-read analysis. Its presence in nearly all reads was noted, which supported the inference that the differential expression of <italic>TESPA1</italic> stemmed mostly from the <italic>IGF2BP2::TESPA1</italic> fusion, thus implying a genomic origin for the overexpressed levels.
title: Detection of isoforms and genomic alterations by high-throughput full-length single-cell RNA sequencing for personalized oncology

finding: The SNP rs11050664 was associated with variations in breast cancer cell states, particularly influencing the tumor microenvironment as characterized by the expression of cancer-associated fibroblasts, impacting the overall tumor biology and its response to therapy.
title: XDec Simplex Map of Breast Cancer Cell States Enables Precise Modeling and Targeting of Breast Cancer

finding: The research observed that more than 98% of individuals with the pLoF variant rs183902574 were confirmed through Sanger sequencing in the 23andMe dataset. This variant was included in further analyses, and the study concluded that heterozygous pLoF variants in LRRK2, including this SNP, do not significantly associate with reduced life expectancy or any specific disease phenotype.
title: Human loss-of-function variants suggest that partial LRRK2 inhibition is a safe therapeutic strategy for Parkinson’s disease

finding: For SNP rs11066309, associations were found with hypertension, ischemic heart disease, myocardial infarction, coronary atherosclerosis, and hypothyroidism, demonstrating its involvement across several cardiovascular and metabolic traits.
title: NETMAGE: a humaN-disEase phenoType MAp GEnerator for the Visualization of PheWAS

finding: The variant rs12229918 was associated with decreased tooth number and delayed tooth eruption, linking it to the gene MSRB3 and nearby WIF1, which is expressed in the enamel knot, a critical signaling center for tooth development.
title: “Integration of multimodal data in the developing tooth reveals candidate dental disease genes”

finding: At the HECTD4 locus (rs11066188), a selection signal associated with celiac disease and rising frequency over the past 9,000 years was identified, contrasting initial assertions of a more recent adaptation.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The ATXN2 locus (rs653178) also showed sustained selection over approximately 9,000 years, linked to rheumatoid arthritis, providing contrary evidence to prior claims of it being a recent adaptation.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The study highlighted rs35907548 as a significant regulatory variant within the SLC15A4 locus, associated with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). The risk allele 'T' of rs35907548 was found to enhance regulatory activity and increase SLC15A4 expression through its function as an active enhancer. Chromatin interaction analysis demonstrated its linkage to the promoters of SLC15A4 and GLTLD1, suggesting a critical role in endolysosomal acidification essential for immune cell function.
title: A Non-Coding Variant in SLC15A4 Drives Lysosomal Deacidification and Lupus Susceptibility

finding: The rs3184504 SNP, a trypsin to arginine variant on the SH2B3 adapter protein, was associated with over 12 phenotypes, such as hypothyroidism, blood pressure, type 1 diabetes, coronary heart disease, arthritis, myocardial infarction, and peripheral arterial disease.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The rs1002552 SNP received a Pleiotropic Variability Score (PVS) of 0.308 and was classified as L1, indicating low pleiotropy. It was associated with acute lymphocytic leukemia and acute leukemia.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The SNP rs11064437 was classified as a Tier 2 IAM_high-specific eQTL of the SPSB2 gene, previously linked as a risk variant for colorectal cancer in East Asian populations, which was corroborated by its higher frequency in that population, differentiating it from eQTLs in the IAM_low group.
title: Gene expression in African Americans and Latinos reveals ancestry-specific patterns of genetic architecture

finding: The variant rs2229774 was identified within the coding region of the RARG gene, which regulates the expression of the anthracycline drug targets TOP2B and ABCB8. This variant was found to reduce the suppressive activity of the transcription factor RARG, thus leading to increased anthracycline-induced cardiotoxicity (AIC). The study suggested that this variant's impact could be linked to the missing upregulation of WNT receptor signaling, which was proposed as a mechanism driving AIC.
title: Multiscale mapping of transcriptomic signatures for cardiotoxic drugs

finding: The SNP rs10842707, located near the ITPR2-SSPN gene, was identified as being associated with waist circumference adjusted for BMI (WHRadjBMI). This finding demonstrated sex differences, reinforcing the idea that genetic susceptibility to obesity traits varies between genders.
title: Evaluating the Sex Dependent Influence of Sarcospan on Cardiometabolic Disease Traits in Mice

finding: The SNP rs718314 exhibited strong sexual dimorphism particularly in women. It was shown to affect DNA methylation of the SSPN promoter, which was linked to waist-to-hip ratio (WHR), indicating that variations at this locus may contribute to obesity-related phenotypes through differential methylation processes in females.
title: Evaluating the Sex Dependent Influence of Sarcospan on Cardiometabolic Disease Traits in Mice

finding: The SNP rs1599750 was selected for its capability to balance the separation of Middle Eastern versus South Asian population differentiation. It showed strong geographical genetic variation among various populations, including Spanish, Yoruba, European, and Asian populations.
title: Exploring ancestry inference of the Middle East

finding: Variant rs11055486 in GRIN2B showed a robust association with reading related traits, particularly associated with non-word reading tasks.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This variant demonstrated significant association with reading tasks, particularly non-word reading and adjusted analyses.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: A variant found downstream in GRIN2B, rs4764003, exhibited significant association with non-word reading performance.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The intronic variant rs61914322 was significantly associated with poorer performance in both word identification and spelling tasks.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The variant rs12184498 was shown to have significant evidence relating to transcription factor binding and its role in dyslexia risk.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The study established that 22.9% of subjects carry either the rs4149056 C allele or SLCO1B1 star alleles associated with possible decreased function. This finding suggested that these individuals might be recommended a lower dose of simvastatin due to an increased risk of muscle toxicity.
title: Pharmacogenetics at scale: An analysis of the UK Biobank

finding: The rs4547172 SNP was associated with muscle phosphofructokinase gene (PFKM) expression in an eQTL investigation using skeletal muscle biopsies. Increased expression of PFKM was related to higher resting plasma insulin levels, which is considered an endophenotype, and it was also linked to the type II diabetes (T2D) end-point phenotype.
title: Identification of expression quantitative trait loci in the skeletal muscle of Thoroughbreds reveals heritable variation in expression of genes relevant to cofactor metabolism

finding: The SNP rs1800574, located in the HNF1A gene, was associated with a kidney phenotype linked to the rare Mendelian disorder diabetes MODY type 3. It mapped to a small credible set with fewer variants, indicating a potentially causal variant.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: The study indicated that the presence of the H. pylori virulence factor, particularly the cytotoxin-associated gene A (cagA), was significantly associated with a reduction in p27 protein expression among gastric adenocarcinoma patients. Since p27 dysregulation was prevalent in almost all H. pylori vacA genotypes found, it suggested that variations within the genetic region containing rs11050725 may play a role in gastric cancer risk linked to p27 as a diagnostic marker for the disease.
title: A Genetic and Immunohistochemical Analysis of H. Pylori Phenotypes and p27 expression in Adenocarcinoma Patients in Jordan

finding: The SNP rs12296477 was part of a focused analysis on its association with drinking behaviors, reinforcing its significance in the context of PAU.
title: Meta-analysis of problematic alcohol use in 435,563 individuals identifies 29 risk variants and yields insights into biology, pleiotropy and causality

finding: The study by Salcini et al. (2021) identified the rs14259 polymorphism in the proteasome modulator 9 gene as a significant genetic variant associated with diabetic polyneuropathy (DPN) in patients. This finding suggested a potential link between the genetic variation and the pathway involved in the impairment of noxious heat avoidance observed in model organisms, supporting the idea that therapeutic interventions targeting the glial proteasome might be relevant for treating DPN.
title: A Drosophila model of diabetic neuropathy reveals a crucial role of proteasome activity in the glia

finding: The SNP rs1800574 mapped to the gene HNF1A, which is known for its association with rare Mendelian disorders, specifically diabetes MODY type 3. This variant was located in a small credible set containing only 4 variants, indicating strong evidence for its role in kidney function.
title: Discovery and prioritization of variants and genes for kidney function in >1.2 million individuals

finding: The study indicated that the C allele in the rs1878022 polymorphism of the ERV1/ChemR23 receptor provided protection against adipose tissue inflammation in obese subjects. This finding highlights the significance of genetic variation and its potential influence on host responses to RvE1, suggesting that individuals may respond differently to treatments involving RvE1 based on their genetic profiles.
title: Resolvin E1 derived from eicosapentaenoic acid prevents hyperinsulinemia and hyperglycemia in a host genetic manner

finding: The archaic allele for rs2066807 was found to be linked to lower expression levels for the gene IFI16 and was related to autoimmune disease risk, showing significant statistical results in eQTLGen.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: Having similar effects as rs2066807, this SNP was also associated with lower expression of target genes related to autoimmune diseases, including psoriasis.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: This SNP was associated with the BRAP gene and identified as a significant signature of natural selection with a p-value of 4.29×10^-12, suggesting its involvement in alcohol dependence predisposition.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: In the ALDH2 gene, this SNP's DAF of 0.241 linked it with alcohol metabolism and the distinctive alcohol consumption behaviors of Han Chinese.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: This SNP in the HECTD4 gene had a significant p-value of 1.22×10^-13, suggesting its association with blood pressure and its presence in selection signals within East Asian populations.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: Linked with alcohol metabolism due to its strong linkage disequilibrium with rs671, this SNP bore a p-value of 2.30×10^-12, indicating its relevance in Han Chinese alcohol consumption genetics.
title: Genomic analyses of 10,376 individuals provides comprehensive map of genetic variations, structure and reference haplotypes for Chinese population

finding: This missense variant showed a doubling in frequency from the Bronze Age to the Historical period and is a major risk locus for Celiac disease while also linked to vitamin D binding.
title: 1,000 ancient genomes uncover 10,000 years of natural selection in Europe

finding: The SNP rs10877969 was identified in the context of visceral hypersensitivity (VH), a mechanism linked to chronic abdominal pain observed in disorders of gut-brain interaction including irritable bowel syndrome (IBS). It was specifically noted that VH-susceptible mice had elevated colonic AVPR1A mRNA and protein expression, suggesting that this SNP might influence susceptibility to VH in patients, which was supported by an observed correlation with pain ratings in patients.
title: Identification of arginine-vasopressin receptor 1a (Avpr1a/AVPR1A) as a novel candidate gene for chronic visceral pain

finding: SNP rs76895963 was associated with CCND2, showing that its rare alleles were linked to reduced susceptibility in type 2 diabetes, indicating a potential therapeutic target.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The SNP rs3217792 was also associated with CCND2, revealing its role in reduced susceptibility for type 2 diabetes through genetic association studies.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The SNP rs1280682918 was identified to disrupt the start-stop element of PTPN11, which encodes the SHP-2 protein involved in RAS/MAPK and PI3K signaling pathways. This disruption was hypothesized to lead to aberrant expression levels due to loss-of-function of the start-stop, effectively de-repressing translation.
title: Regulatory start-stop elements in 5’ untranslated regions pervasively modulate translation

finding: The rs55958994 SNP was found to regulate multiple gene expressions linked to prostate cancer through extreme long-range chromatin interactions, significantly impacting tumor progression.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The rs2277339 SNP in the essential gene PRIM1 was identified as a promising therapeutic target due to its role in loss of heterozygosity in cancer, with LOH observed in 9% of various cancers and significant correlations with specific types such as 21% in lung adenocarcinomas. The G allele was shown to be CRISPR-sensitive, allowing for allele-specific inactivation that reduced the growth of cells harboring this allele, while sparing those with the non-targeted allele.
title: Loss of heterozygosity of essential genes represents a widespread class of potential cancer vulnerabilities

finding: The SNP rs2277339 was characterized as a missense coding variant in DNA primase subunit 1 (PRIM1) located on chromosome 12. It established a link between plateletcrit, a marker of thrombotic and inflammatory processes, and the Apnea Hypopnea Index (AHI). This variant was also associated with traits such as height, waist to hip ratio, age at menopause, and multiple red blood cell-related traits in the UK Biobank.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy to discover and interpret GWAS results for sleep-associated traits

finding: The SNP rs2277339 in the PRIM1 gene was identified as a promising candidate for therapeutic targeting due to its role in generating a CRISPR-sensitive allele. The study established that allele-specific inactivation of the G allele (S allele) significantly reduced the growth of cells with this allele while sparing cells with the non-targeted T allele (R allele), confirming its status as a GEMINI vulnerability. It was found to be prevalent in cancers, occurring in 9% of various cancer types, further underscoring its potential as a therapeutic target.
title: Loss of heterozygosity of essential genes represents a widespread class of potential cancer vulnerabilities

finding: The rs11050631 SNP was found to play a significant role in cancer cell migration and invasion, according to the findings of Limia et al. in 2019. The study noted that this SNP's presence was correlated with the enhanced response of cancer cells to environmental stimuli, thereby facilitating their movement and invasiveness.
title: Systemic migrations in enucleated cells

finding: The RA rs11564258 was strongly associated with Crohn's disease and inflammatory bowel disease. It was located near MUC19, a gene involved in microbial interactions, and represented a locus where derived alleles became fixed after the divergence from Neanderthals, indicating its significant role in traits affecting gut health.
title: Neanderthal introgression reintroduced functional ancestral alleles lost in Eurasian populations

finding: The SNP rs2229774 was associated with the gene RARG, which exhibited a negative correlation between its expression levels and cardiotoxicity in response to anthracycline treatments. Higher expression of RARG correlated with lower toxicity indicators following DOX and DNR treatments.
title: Anthracycline-induced cardiotoxicity associates with a shared gene expression response signature to TOP2-inhibiting breast cancer drugs in cardiomyocytes

finding: The SNP rs10507084 was significantly associated with OSA near the Rhabdomyosarcoma 2 associated transcript (RMST) and NEDD1 gamma-tubulin ring complex targeting factor, with a p-value of 2.8 x 10^-11. It demonstrated an association with OSA independent of BMI, suggesting unique genetic factors in OSA predisposition.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The CACNA1C rs1006737 SNP was identified as increasing the risk of essential hypertension, which is relevant to the cardiovascular aspects of DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs7308356 was identified as the index SNP at locus 12q13.12, associated with varicose veins (VVs). It was part of a group of missense variants predicted to affect protein structure or function in a biologically relevant manner.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs12303082 was found within a highly conserved region in FAM186A, resulting in a p.Lys187Gln substitution, predicted to be detrimental to protein function. It was also associated with varicose veins.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs11060807 was identified as a significant finding related to the use of paclitaxel (PTX) in cancer treatment, particularly in the context of its incorporation into nanostructured lipid carriers (NLCs). Research indicated that variants at this locus could influence the therapeutic efficacy of PTX, enhancing its cytotoxic effects against murine melanoma cells.
title: Co-delivery of Paclitaxel and Cannabidiol in Lipid Nanoparticles Enhances Cytotoxicity Against Melanoma Cells

finding: Weinstein et al. in 2019 successfully applied semi-supervised deep learning neural networks for individual tree-crown detection in RGB imagery, marking progress in automated forest assessment.
title: Influence of Temperate Forest Autumn Leaf Phenology on Segmentation of Tree Species from UAV Imagery Using Deep Learning

finding: The SNP rs2072579 was analyzed in a study involving the HEK293 cell line and George Church's PGP1 induced pluripotent stem cell line. The study utilized ICE to simulate editing outcomes, demonstrating that the HEK293 line (homozygous C/C) could be edited to a homozygous G/G configuration at this SNP. Analysis with ICE indicated that the predictions closely matched the experimental percentages, validating the method for distinguishing genetic variants.
title: Inference of CRISPR Edits from Sanger Trace Data

finding: Inconsistent genotypes were found in four individuals, confirmed to be homozygous for rs3817551-G, yet only expressing the hsa-miR-7107-3p version with the T allele.
title: OPTIMIR, a novel algorithm for integrating available genome-wide genotype data into miRNA sequence alignment analysis

finding: SNP rs7956809 (C/G) in the KRT4 gene was associated with contamination of RNA-Seq data in GTEX1's fibroblast sample, which showed an unexpected 87% G reads. This contradicted the homozygous C status at this SNP in both DNA and RNA from the matching esophagus tissue, suggesting contamination from a nearby esophagus sample (GTEX2) that was homozygous G. The circumstances surrounding sequencing contamination were particularly significant, as this incident underscored the potential for misleading allele representation due to non-native tissue influence.
title: Basal Contamination of Sequencing: Lessons from the GTEx dataset

finding: The primary risk allele rs72650673:A in SH2B3 was linked to increased platelet counts due to impaired hematopoietic signaling, with somatic CNN-LOH mutations making this variant homozygous, contributing to clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Monogenic and polygenic inheritance become instruments for clonal selection

finding: This intronic variant was associated with an earlier onset of MS by 2.9 years and demonstrated statistical significance (p=0.037).
title: A higher burden of multiple sclerosis genetic risk confers an earlier onset

finding: The SNP rs1006737 in the CACNA1C gene was associated with neurostructural phenotypes in adolescents with bipolar disorder compared to healthy controls.
title: Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Bipolar Disorder by Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The study found that individuals carrying the T-allele (TT carriers) of the TPH2 gene polymorphism (rs4570625) exhibited heightened sensitivity to punishment when exposed to higher levels of early life stress (ELS). Specifically, this relationship was significantly moderated by increased volumes in thalamic-limbic-prefrontal regions and was critical for the T-allele carriers, reflecting the neural impact of ELS on emotional behavior linked to anxious-avoidant phenotypes. Furthermore, higher ELS exposure before the age of 16 was correlated with increased gray matter volumes in these brain regions among TT carriers, a pattern not observed in G-carrier groups.
title: Serotonin and early life stress interact to shape brain architecture and anxious avoidant behavior – a TPH2 imaging genetics approach

finding: This SNP displayed suggestive evidence for cross-disorder interaction (p=1.6×10−7) and acted as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the nearest gene, CSRP2, in various brain regions.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The strongest association was reported for rs1196764 within the APPL2 locus, significantly associated with several microbial taxa. Positive correlations were found with species including Prevotella jejuni (p = 6.89 × 10^-14), unclassified SGB 3339 from Oribacterium (p = 9.99 × 10^-12), and unclassified SGB 315 from Solobacterium (p = 2.12 × 10^-11). APPL2 encodes a multifunctional adapter protein involved in regulating various processes, including immune response and cell metabolism.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: The SNP rs1196764 at APPL2 was significantly associated with the oral taxa Prevotella jejuni, Oribacterium uSGB 3339, and Solobacterium uSGB 315. This association was replicated with study-wide significance, indicating a correlation between APPL2 variants and high dietary intake of sugar/fat, as well as a lower risk of dental calculus and gingival bleeding.
title: Metagenome-genome-wide association studies reveal human genetic impact on the oral microbiome

finding: rs4765905 showed significant enhancer activity in postnatal brain based on the MPRA results, as demonstrated by EGFP expression in multiple cortical regions.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: The SNP rs1108075 was part of the amplicon (#3), which demonstrated significant enhancer activity in postnatal brain development.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Similar to rs1108075, rs11062166 was included in amplicon (#3) that showed significant activity as an enhancer in the brain.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: This SNP was part of amplicon (#6) that drove significant RNA transcript expression in the assay, indicating its role as an enhancer.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: As part of amplicon (#6), rs2159100 contributed to observed significant enhancer activity related to gene expression.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Included in amplicon (#7), rs11062170 was associated with significant enhancer activity as demonstrated in the context of P7 brain expression.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: SNP rs7302529 demonstrated a significant cross-disorder GxS interaction (p=1.6×10^-7) which implicated various neuronal functions, highlighting its relevance across mood and psychotic disorders.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The rs772557 variant was confirmed as a causal variant affecting PPM1H expression. The G allele (rs772557-G) created a MYB binding site, leading to increased PPM1H expression, whereas the A allele (rs772557-A) abrogated this site contributing to PPM1H downregulation. This downregulation was associated with an increase in HSPC subpopulations such as CMP, HSC, and MEP with implications for blood CD34+ cell levels.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: The LTA4H rs17525495 SNP was found to significantly influence survival in HIV-negative patients with tuberculous meningitis (TBM). In a study conducted in Vietnam, the TT genotype was associated with a substantial survival benefit from adjunctive treatment with dexamethasone, improving survival probabilities as early as day 3. In contrast, CC homozygotes seemed to experience potential harm from this treatment. The survival benefit was less pronounced in Indonesia, but analyses still showed a trend favoring TT carriers, indicating a broader importance of the LTA4H locus in modulating the inflammatory response and survival outcomes across diverse populaions.
title: A Bayesian analysis of the association between Leukotriene A4 Hydrolase genotype and survival probability of tuberculous meningitis patients treated with adjunctive dexamethasone

finding: The rs1393693495 (W514Ter) mutation was associated with TBX5 gene dysfunction, which plays a crucial role in cardiac development, and was predicted to be deleterious by PredictSNP2.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: The rs1555226308 (Q156Ter) mutation disrupted the highly conserved T-box domain in TBX5 and was predicted as deleterious by PredictSNP2.
title: Identification of Deleterious Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP)s in the Human TBX5 Gene & Prediction of Their Structural & Functional Consequences: An In Silico approach

finding: CARMEN identified rs705698 as having high regulatory potential (score of 0.4070) and placed it within the first intron of gene RAB5B, a candidate gene for type 1 diabetes. Independent luciferase assays confirmed its significant effect on expression, contrasting with rs1701704.
title: Computational Assessment of the Regulation-Modulating Potential for Noncoding Variants

finding: The SNP rs11111726 was found to be associated with the expression of specific proteins implicated in fibrosis, particularly related to the signaling pathways involving STAT5B, highlighting its relevance in the context of chronic liver injury and the process of fibrosis.
title: Nanchangmycin regulates FYN, FAK and ERK to control the fibrotic activity of hepatic stellate cells

finding: The variant rs28990715 was noted for having the same amino acid change, despite different allele changes, in both species. It was significant in the context of the genetic variation affecting height.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: This SNP was identified as having a genome-wide significant association related to volume-related imaging phenotypes, with a nominally significant association result in the ENIGMA data.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: This SNP demonstrated a genome-wide significant association with volume-related imaging phenotypes, also showing a nominally significant association result in the ENIGMA data.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was linked to volume-related imaging phenotypes, achieving genome-wide significance in the results from subcortical volume analyses.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: This SNP's association with volume-related imaging phenotypes was significant at the genome-wide level, with a predicted deleterious variant effect indicated by high CADD scores.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The rs55958994 SNP was associated with prostate cancer and regulated multiple gene expressions through extreme long-range chromatin interactions, highlighting its contribution to tumor progression.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: This SNP was confirmed to have a cis-acting relationship with the gene DRAM1 in multiple tissues, and it was associated with height (p = 1.47 × 10^-14) based on UK Biobank data.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: This SNP was identified as a lead hotspot variant in the LYZ pleiotropic region, influencing a network of transcripts related to the gene LYZ, and it controlled a network enriched in transcription factor binding sites related to cell-type specificity.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: Similar to rs10784774, this SNP was also identified as a lead hotspot variant near the LYZ locus and was involved in a network affecting monocyte counts and other myeloid cell counts.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: Located within the 3' UTR of the LYZ gene, this SNP was identified in multiple analyses as a hotspot, suggesting a potential trans-acting influence associated with LYZ.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: The study found that the gene KITLG (ENSG00000049130) showed differential eQTL effects based on the SNP rs11104703 in naïve B cells. Specifically, this differential regulation was observed to be dependent on lithium status, with opposite effect sizes between lithium users and nonusers.
title: Cell type deconvolution of bulk blood RNA-Seq to reveal biological insights of neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The majority analysis indicated that the SNP rs11050639 was associated with varying responses of mucosal-associated invariant T (MAIT) cells in terms of their cytokine production, impacting the tumor immunity landscape as indicated by the research of Rossin et al. (2019). This SNP was linked to modulations in immune responses relevant to tumor promotion versus inhibition.
title: Reprogramming and redifferentiation of mucosal-associated invariant T cells reveals tumor inhibitory activity

finding: The SNP rs11111624 was previously associated with a study indicating that adenylyl cyclase type 8 overexpression impaired phosphorylation-dependent Orai1 inactivation and promoted cell migration in MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells. This suggests that it played a significant role in regulating pathways related to cellular migration, particularly in the context of cancer biology.
title: Protein Kinase A Activity In The Leading Edge of Migrating Cells Is Dependent On The Activity of Focal Adhesion Kinase

finding: This SNP was reported as the other variation in the same 2.96 Mb segment on chromosome 12 in TGP38L with an alternate allele frequency of 1, similarly suggesting a reference sequence error.
title: Quality control of large genome datasets using genome fingerprints

finding: The study found that obese individuals with the C allele in the rs1878022 polymorphism of the ERV1/ChemR23 receptor exhibited a protective effect against adipose tissue inflammation. This suggests a significant relationship between this SNP and the inflammatory responses in obesity, highlighting the role of host genetics in the biology of specialized pro-resolving mediators (SPMs) such as resolvin E1.
title: Targeting the resolvin E1 - eicosapentaenoic acid axis improves hyperinsulinemia and hyperglycemia in a host genetic dependent manner

finding: The G2019S variant (rs34637584) in the LRRK2 gene was identified as a pathogenic variant associated with increased risk for familial and sporadic Parkinson's disease (PD). This established the basis for utilizing LRRK2 kinase inhibitors in therapeutic strategies aimed at PD.
title: Understanding LRRK2 kinase activity in preclinical models and human subjects through quantitative analysis of LRRK2 and pRab10

finding: The N551K variant (rs7308720) was also found to be associated with increased LRRK2 activity in various cellular models of PD, contributing to the understanding of LRRK2's role in the disease.
title: Understanding LRRK2 kinase activity in preclinical models and human subjects through quantitative analysis of LRRK2 and pRab10

finding: The Arg40Cys variant in hP2X2 (rs75585377) was associated with several blood phenotypes, including a significant association with corpuscular volume, reticulocyte volume, corpuscular hemoglobin, and sphered cell volume, indicated by high -log10(p-values) ranging from 9.17 to 15.23. This variant was studied in the context of the UK Biobank PHEWAS data.
title: P2X2 receptor subunit interfaces are missense variant hotspots where mutations tend to increase apparent ATP affinity

finding: This SNP, associated with the <italic>ACADS</italic> gene, was classified as a known epilepsy variant, highlighting its potential implication in epileptic conditions.
title: Evolutionary constraint genes implicated in autism spectrum disorder across 2,054 nonhuman primate genomes

finding: The SNP rs3751143 (A>C) was identified as a loss-of-function variant of P2RX7. In a study involving patients with active leprosy, PBMCs from individuals expressing the CC genotype (non-functional P2RX7) were stimulated with a mycobacterial extract. The subsequent activation with extracellular ATP (eATP) did not enhance the proliferative response (measured by Ki-67 expression) or CXCR3 expression in the CC donor when compared to the functional AA genotype. These findings underscored the critical role of P2RX7 activation by eATP in regulating CD4+ T cell responses in the context of mycobacterial infection.
title: T cell-specific P2RX7 favors lung parenchymal CD4+ T cell accumulation in response to severe lung infections

finding: This SNP was associated with the expression of <italic>ENG</italic> (endoglin), which is significant in cancer progression and was previously identified as being expressed in ovarian cancer precursor lesions. The findings indicated that <italic>ENG</italic> plays a crucial role in the metastasis to the ovary, highlighting the importance of this SNP in understanding cancer pathways.
title: A meta-analysis of the inhibin network reveals prognostic value in multiple solid tumors

finding: The rs11066188 locus showed selection linked to celiac disease with a rising frequency over approximately 9,000 years.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: Likewise, the rs653178 locus also indicated a significant selection signal associated with rheumatoid arthritis, increasing in frequency over the last 9,000 years.
title: Population Genomics of Stone Age Eurasia

finding: The JAK1 variant associated with rs11111701 was found to exhibit altered enzymatic activity resulting from mutations, impacting cell proliferation and tumor biology as derived from studies. This finding directly relates to the functional implications of JAK1 in cancer as highlighted in relevant literature.
title: RNA dicing regulates the expression of an oncogenic JAK1 isoform

finding: The SNP rs1169284 at the HNF1A locus was associated with the measure of biological age (ΔAge) with a significant p-value of 3.0×10^-23. This finding indicated that the HNF1A gene, which is associated with diabetes and cancer, also plays a role in influencing human aging.
title: A mathematical model that predicts human biological age from physiological traits identifies environmental and genetic factors that influence aging

finding: The derived allele G of rs74576183-A/G was under positive selection in PNG highlanders. It was associated with a slower heart rate (pval<sub>adjusted</sub> = 0.046, beta = -2.981) and overlapped with the gene NCAPD2, which is involved in various neurodevelopmental disorders. Furthermore, the region showed significant association with increased red blood cell count in the UK Biobank.
title: Positive selection in the genomes of two Papua New Guinean populations at distinct altitude levels

finding: This prostate cancer risk SNP was identified as an eSNP linked to the expression of two long noncoding RNAs, LOH12CR2 and RP11-253I19.3, modulated by an eCpG site. Despite its significant association, it was not detected as a canonical eQTL or meQTL.
title: memo-eQTL: DNA methylation modulated genetic variant effect on gene transcriptional regulation

finding: The COVID-19-associated variant rs10774679 had a selection estimate of 0.013, linked to the OAS1 splice variant, and was associated with slightly higher susceptibility to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), indicating potential implications in immune response.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The variant rs11066188, which was linked to increased expression of SH2B3 and showed a selection estimate of 0.016, was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The missense variant rs12146727 in the C1S gene was detailed as undergoing negative selection, indicating evolutionary pressures against specific immune-related variants.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The SNP rs61938093 was associated with allelic expression imbalance (AEI) in the context of breast cancer. It was identified within a putative regulatory element (PRE) that interacts with the NTN4 promoter. The presence of risk alleles at this SNP reduced the looping between the enhancer and NTN4, leading to decreased NTN4 expression. Additionally, allele-specific 3C assays in T47D cells showed a preference for the protective allele and EMSA indicated rs61938093 altered protein binding.
title: High-throughput allelic expression imbalance analyses identify candidate breast cancer risk genes

finding: The rs2227473 SNP in the IL22 gene was significantly associated with staphylococcal phages, suggesting an influence of immune-related genetic variants on phage populations in the microbiome.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: The SNP rs7954905 was the primary instrument used to reconstruct the CD163 sub-network, highlighting its role in regulatory processes.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs4148866 was identified in the colocalization analysis and was mapped to gene ABCB9. Although ABCB9 has no reported associations with diseases of the musculoskeletal system in the GWAS Catalog, the high Bayesian posterior probability of colocalization analysis suggested a significant relationship due to shared genetic variants affecting gene expression.
title: A novel method for multiple phenotype association studies based on genotype and phenotype network

finding: The SNP rs11050678 was linked to the essential role of cysteine in tumor proliferation and survival, as described by Combs and DeNicola (2019). This indicated that variations at this locus affected cysteine metabolism, which is crucial for glioblastoma cell invasion and response to treatments.
title: Multi-omic screening of invasive GBM cells in engineered biomaterials and patient biopsies reveals targetable transsulfuration pathway alterations

finding: The SNP rs111891989 was identified as having strong association with cerebellar volume through Bayesian fine-mapping, located in the MSI1 gene that regulates midline crossing of pre-cerebellar neurons.
title: Genome-wide association study of cerebellar volume

finding: The SNP rs2102949 was an intronic variant in the MPHOSPH9 gene, found to have significant correlation with cerebellar volume and linked with several eQTL associations in cerebellar tissue.
title: Genome-wide association study of cerebellar volume

finding: rs4149056 was associated with increased SN-38 concentrations, correlating with treatment response in metastatic CRC.
title: Pharmacogenomics, biomarker network and allele frequencies in colorectal cancer

finding: Belonging to a novel pleiotropic region at 12q12.1, this SNP was associated with 14 cancers in a bidirectional analysis.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs2269935 had been previously associated with a relative lowering in body fat, indicating its potential influence on metabolic processes related to cancer.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs11168417 was identified as a prognostic marker for non-small cell lung cancer in patients undergoing surgical resection or chemotherapy, suggesting its critical role in cancer prognosis.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs11609399 was found to cause a deleterious effect due to amino-acid conversion from non-polar Leucine to positively charged Histidine, impacting protein structure and function; it also affected exon splicing.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs2228500 was noted as a conserved variant and an exonic splicing effector, indicating its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs2286020 was predicted to have an important regulatory function based on its annotation score from RegulomeDB, indicating its potential role in gene regulation.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs4760619 was categorized as a highly prioritized SNP with a likelihood of functional importance in cancer etiology.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: SNP rs12306290 was categorized as a highly prioritized SNP, having potential implications for gene function.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs11168416 was categorized as a highly prioritized SNP likely to have functional implications for cancer.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs10492080 was predicted to have functional relevance based on various analytical tools combined in the study.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs11168415 was also deemed functionally relevant in the context of PFKM gene analysis.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs10875745 was classified as highly prioritized SNP with a strong likelihood of functional significance.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs10082861 was identified as a candidate SNP with potential implications for PFKM functionality.
title: In silico analysis of SNPs in human phosphofructokinase, Muscle (PFKM) gene: An apparent therapeutic target of aerobic glycolysis and cancer

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was identified as the top cis-eQTL in the OAS1 gene across all cell types, specifically associated with an influenza A virus (IAV) infection response. This finding highlighted its role in varying OAS1 enzymatic activity, with a significant association in CD4+ T cells during IAV infection (lfsr = 1.5×10^-12). Moreover, rs10774671 was noted to be positioned within a Neanderthal-derived haplotype.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals pervasive but highly cell type-specific genetic ancestry effects on the response to viral infection

finding: The SNP rs1012994 was identified as a liver-specific eQTL for the gene GLT1D1, indicating its specific regulatory role in liver tissue.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: Associated with multiple transcription factors; its involvement in eQTL pathways indicates a mechanistic role for T1D.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant interactions with CHD4, suggesting a regulatory role in T1D despite not being classified as a close eQTL.
title: 3DFAACTS-SNP: Using regulatory T cell-specific epigenomics data to uncover candidate mechanisms of Type-1 Diabetes (T1D) risk

finding: rs7310409 was associated with C-reactive protein levels across African-American, European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American ancestry cohorts.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs1169310 showed association with C-reactive protein levels in European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts, indicating its relevance across different ancestries.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs1183910 was identified as significantly associated with C-reactive protein levels in European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs7953249 was associated with C-reactive protein levels in African-American, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs2259816 was found to have significant associations with C-reactive protein levels in European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs7979473 was associated with C-reactive protein levels in both African-American and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs61745424 was analyzed for its relation to platelet count in the East Asian ancestry cohort and previously identified as having significance.
title: Redefining replication in multi-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: The SNP rs7312625 was associated with increased enhancer activity in atrial cardiomyocyte-like cells, indicating its potential role in enhancing transcriptional activity within the AF-associated intronic regulatory region of the TBX5 locus.
title: An atrial fibrillation-associated regulatory region modulates cardiac Tbx5 levels and arrhythmia susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs215226 within the B4GALNT3 locus was strongly associated with serum sclerostin levels, showing a beta of 0.205 SD change in sclerostin per A allele, with a very low p-value of 4.60 x 10^-49. Additionally, this SNP was associated with lower estimated BMD and increased fracture risk in separate analyses, providing strong evidence for its causal role.
title: Mendelian Randomization analysis reveals a causal influence of circulating sclerostin levels on bone mineral density and fractures

finding: The SNP rs3033405 was associated with microvessel density and was correlated with the expression levels of VEGF (Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor) and alpha-smooth muscle actin (α-SMA) in various regions of human gastrointestinal carcinomas according to a study by Tonino and Abreu, published in 2011. This finding highlighted the genetic influence on vascularization processes, relevant to the context of enhanced vascularization observed in the wound healing applications of functionalized lignin combined with oxygen-releasing nanoparticles.
title: Engineering Antioxidant and Oxygen-Releasing Lignin Composites to Accelerate Wound Healing

finding: The SNP rs1351394 in the HMGA2 gene was replicated in Ladakhi offspring and was previously associated with human height and birth weight, marking it as a biologically plausible functional candidate.
title: Population History and Genome Wide Association Studies of Birth Weight in a Native High Altitude Ladakhi Population

finding: The study found that the Fok1 (rs2228570) single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) within the vitamin D receptor (VDR) gene was significantly associated with the onset of rheumatoid arthritis (RA) in the indigenous North American (INA) population. This finding was based on previous research that identified a relationship between the SNP and RA development.
title: Circulating Levels of Free 25(OH)D Increase at the Onset of Rheumatoid Arthritis

finding: The RA rs11564258, located near MUC19, showed strong associations with Crohn's disease and inflammatory bowel disease. It was identified in scans for potential adaptive introgression, suggesting its importance in the context of ancient alleles reintroduced through Neanderthal admixture.
title: Neanderthal introgression reintroduced functional alleles lost in the human out of Africa bottleneck

finding: The SNP rs76895963 was identified as a single variant at the CCND2 locus and exhibited pleiotropy, being mapped to a total of 13 traits, including bone mineral density (BMD). It was highlighted as the single most pleiotropic signal in the study.
title: GWAS-informed data integration and non-coding CRISPRi screen illuminate genetic etiology of bone mineral density

finding: The SNP rs10859995 was located within an intron of the HAL gene, indicating an association with dermal tissue integrity and 25OHD concentration.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs10745742 was noted as one of the significant variants influencing vitamin D metabolism.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The common LRRK2 risk variant rs10878226 was significantly associated with PD risk, showing an odds ratio of 1.20 (95% CI 1.08–1.33, p = 6.3×10^-4) in the analyzed cohorts, underscoring its role as a risk factor in sporadic PD cases.
title: Analysis of DNM3 and VAMP4 as genetic modifiers of LRRK2 Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs12821256 related to the KITLG gene demonstrated significant evidence of selection with an estimated selection coefficient (s) of approximately 0.016. This variant is associated with pigmentation traits such as blonde hair and was also predominately found in European populations, showing recent strong selection.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs5443 was identified as a pNMD-QTL, which regulated the fraction of NMD-targeted transcripts of the DNA repair gene XRCC3 across 18 tissues, including 6 brain tissues. This association indicated that NMD regulation significantly contributes to DNA repair mechanisms and plays a crucial role in maintaining genome integrity, potentially influencing the manifestation of genetic diseases.
title: Mapping genetic variants for nonsense-mediated mRNA decay regulation across human tissues

finding: At rs1362463, the G allele influenced the expression of IFNG along the DEX response pseudotime, impacting inflammatory responses crucial in infectious disease management, including the severity of COVID-19.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The TPH2 rs4570625 SNP was associated with individual differences in the functional communication of critical emotion processing hubs in the brain. Specifically, GG carriers demonstrated heightened sensitivity to the effects of acute tryptophan depletion (ATD) on neural connectivity involving the vmPFC-hippocampus-amygdala circuitry. The G-allele was proposed to correlate with reduced tryptophan hydroxylase activity, potentially leading to decreased serotonin synthesis rates, which could amplify the impact of serotonin depletion on emotional regulation systems.
title: State and trait serotonin variations interact to shape the intrinsic connectivity and gradient architecture of the brain – a combined TPH2 genetics and tryptophan depletion study

finding: The SNP rs11543305, a C/T variant located 1.6kb proximal to a 44mer VNTR positioned intronic within the NOC4L gene, was identified as the lead SNV associated with NOC4L expression. Even after conditioning on the genotype at rs11543305, the copy number of the VNTR maintained a significant association with NOC4L expression, indicating that the VNTR association acted independently of local SNV QTLs.
title: Pervasive cis effects of variation in copy number of large tandem repeats on local epigenetics and gene expression

finding: The rs1565941579 SNP, leading to a P85S substitution, was considered one of the five most damaging SNPs identified in the TBX5 gene analyses, potentially causing Holt-Oram Syndrome.
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The rs1269970792 SNP, resulting in a W121R substitution, was also among the five most damaging SNPs identified, suggesting a risk of Holt-Oram Syndrome.
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The SNP rs772248871 corresponds with a V153D substitution, recognized as one of the top five damaging SNPs linked to the TBX5 gene and associated with Holt-Oram Syndrome.
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The rs769113870 SNP, causing an E208D substitution, was identified as highly damaging, indicating its strong association with Holt-Oram Syndrome.
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The SNP rs1318021626 led to an I222N substitution, marking it as one of the most damaging variants implicated in the TBX5 gene and likely contributing to Holt-Oram Syndrome.
title: Identification of deleterious single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)s on the human TBX5 gene & prediction of their structural & functional consequences: An in silico approach

finding: The SNP rs1790121 was identified within the ARL6IP4 gene and showed significant association with junctions related to splicing, reinforcing its relevance in the context of schizophrenia risk through expression modulation.
title: Variations and expression features of CYP2D6 contribute to schizophrenia risk

finding: The SNP rs6489844-G was associated with decreased expression of the lncRNA VHRT in human left ventricle tissue, and suggested an increased risk for heart failure.
title: Long noncoding RNA VENTHEART is required for cardiomyocyte specification and function

finding: The SNP rs11065780-C was significantly associated with low expression of VHRT in left ventricular tissue and increased risk for heart failure, indicating a direct link to the lncRNA's role in heart disease.
title: Long noncoding RNA VENTHEART is required for cardiomyocyte specification and function

finding: The variant rs2939302, located near the gene GLS2, was significant in 9 of the 16 metabolites, indicating its strong association with the metabolism of these traits.
title: Integrative analysis of metabolite GWAS illuminates the molecular basis of pleiotropy and genetic correlation

finding: The variant rs7294619 was identified as a Consensus SNP within the LRRK2 locus, which overlaps with a microglia-specific enhancer. This SNP was previously reported as a PD risk factor in smaller subpopulations, confirming its relevance as a likely causal variant contributing to Parkinson's Disease.
title: Fine-mapping of Parkinson’s disease susceptibility loci identifies putative causal variants

finding: The common polymorphism in the Retinoic acid receptor-γ (RARG) gene, designated as rs2229774 (S427L), conferred increased susceptibility to anthracycline cardiotoxicity risk. This finding emerged from a genome-wide association study (GWAS) involving childhood cancer survivors, highlighting the significance of genetic variants in modulating the response to doxorubicin (DOX) treatment in cardiac contexts.
title: CRISPR/Cas9 screens implicate RARA and SPNS1 in doxorubicin cardiotoxicity

finding: The SNP rs1131017 was found to explain the universally switch-like expression of the gene RPS26 at the RNA level. The study established that different genotypes at this SNP led to three distinct transcription states of RPS26: the ancestral homozygote C/C corresponded to a high transcription state, the heterozygote C/G to a medium state, and the derived homozygote G/G to a low state. Interestingly, this relationship was reversed at the translation level, where the derived G allele was associated with significantly more protein production, demonstrating a complex regulation mechanism.
title: Switch-like Gene Expression Modulates Disease Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs7309146 was shown to increase the expression of TCF7L2 in islets. This association was strong, as evidenced by the eQTL beta value of 0.21 and a significant P value.
title: Influence of genetic variants on gene expression in human pancreatic islets – implications for type 2 diabetes

finding: The intergenic variant rs11114010 had <italic>cis</italic> associations for the SELPLG locus in common variant analysis.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The SNP rs835044 was reported as a lead cis-eQTL located 2 kb upstream of NDUFA12, associated with oxidative phosphorylation. It showed a strong genetic effect in cells with high oxidative phosphorylation scores, while showing practically no effect in cells with low scores, highlighting its importance in cellular energy metabolism related to COVID-19 pathology.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: The SNP rs11060750 was identified in the context of lactate dehydrogenases, implicating its role as a metabolic link between tumor and stroma in the tumor microenvironment. This finding related to its significance in cancer metabolism and the Warburg Effect, which is associated with tumor growth and gene expression regulation.
title: Role of Lactate in the Regulation of Transcriptional Activity of Breast Cancer-Related Genes and Epithelial-to-Mesenchymal Transition Proteins: A Compassion of MCF7 and MDA-MB-231 Cancer Cell Lines

finding: The SNP rs121434442 was linked to hereditary spastic paraplegia, a condition recognized by muscle stiffness in the lower limbs. The analysis pointed to individual S6, who possibly inherited this allele from S11, their father, who showed signs of a limb condition that might indicate this genetic disease.
title: Interdisciplinary analyses of Bronze Age communities from Western Hungary reveal complex population histories

finding: Associated with longevity through the allele C, this SNP was linked to an increased risk of colorectal cancer via its alternative allele T.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: The SNP rs370899715 was identified as a Denisovan TFBS-disrupting allele that potentially regulated the genes OAS2 and OAS3, which were differentially expressed between Korowai and Mentawai populations. The archaic allele segregated at a frequency of between 0.33 and 0.39 in Papuans while being fixed for the reference allele in west Indonesians.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: SNP rs372433785 was classified as a Denisovan TFBS-disrupting variant influencing the regulation of OAS2 and OAS3, with identified segregation between Papuans and west Indonesians, where it showed frequencies of 0.33 to 0.39 in Papuans.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: The SNP rs146859513 was included in the cluster of Denisovan TFBS-disrupting variants, which affected the expression of OAS2 and OAS3, with archaic alleles present at 0.33 to 0.39 frequency in Papuans and fixed in western Indonesian populations.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: SNP rs375463218 was part of the six Denisovan TFBS-disrupting SNPs affecting OAS2 and OAS3 regulation, segregating in Papuans at a frequency of 0.33 to 0.39 and fixed for the reference in west Indonesia.
