title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: The SNP rs372139279 was highlighted as a Denisovan allele impacting the transcription regulation of OAS2 and OAS3, with a frequency of 0.33 to 0.39 in Papuans but fixed in western Indonesians.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: SNP rs559399645 was indicated as a Denisovan TFBS-disrupting variant that influences OAS2 and OAS3 regulation, found at a frequency of 0.33 to 0.39 in Papuans while absent in west Indonesians.
title: Denisovan introgression has shaped the immune system of present-day Papuans

finding: The rs11055602 variant showed a significant myeloid lineage-dependent effect on 5mC levels at the CLEC4C locus. This variant was previously demonstrated to strongly affect CLEC4C protein levels, which is relevant as CLEC4C, also known as CD303, is a marker for dendritic cells. The study revealed that the genotype effects on DNA methylation were influenced by the proportions of myeloid cells, with a notable interaction effect (β scale interaction effect, 95% CI: [0.16, 0.22], P_adj = 7.4×10^−20).
title: The Immune Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The SNP rs11111650 was associated with aberrant DNA methylation that led to misregulation of gene expression in gonadotroph nonfunctioning pituitary tumors. This association highlighted the role of this SNP in understanding gene regulation processes in the context of pituitary gland functions, which are essential for sexually dimorphic processes such as growth and pubertal onset.
title: Postnatal developmental trajectory of sex-biased gene expression in the mouse pituitary gland

finding: rs3184504 caused a missense mutation in the SH2B3 gene, linking it to MPN risk and suggesting its role in hematopoietic cell regulation.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The SNP rs74416240 was noted as an eQTL for TCHP in CD14+ monocytes and implicated in Graves' disease, indicating that TCHP may warrant functional investigation in the context of this condition.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs34637584, a missense variant in the LRRK2 gene, was identified as a known Parkinson's disease-related variant. Its involvement was specifically noted in relation to statistical comparisons with patient controls, marking it as a significant risk factor for Parkinson's disease.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The missense variant rs202134984 located in the PTPRB gene was found to be significantly enriched in GBA1-N409S carriers when compared to all other cases, suggesting a specific association with this genetic background in Parkinson's disease.
title: Deep sequencing of proteotoxicity modifier genes uncovers a Presenilin-2/beta-amyloid-actin genetic risk module shared among alpha-synucleinopathies

finding: The instigated ESM rs11045818 in SLCO1B1 was recognized for its association with total bilirubin levels, having a moderately high PIP of 0.626. It had a MaPSy functional score of -2.05 and was nearly fixed in all Neanderthal genomes. It is speculated to affect splicing by introducing new RBP binding sites.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The adaptively introgressed intronic variant rs17730088 in KRT71 was fine-mapped to balding type 4 with a PIP of 0.147, suggesting a potential association with this phenotype.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The rs113247976 variant was associated with the <italic>KIF5A</italic> gene and was considered for its role within the identified pathways influencing ALS.
title: Genetic analysis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis identifies contributing pathways and cell types

finding: The variant rs74654358, mapped to the <italic>TBK1</italic> gene, was included as a covariate to assess its impact on ALS-related pathways.
title: Genetic analysis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis identifies contributing pathways and cell types

finding: This SNP had notable interactions identified in the right inferior parietal and right superior temporal regions. After correction for multiple testing, it presented the lowest p-value (3.59E-08), linking it significantly to various brain imaging phenotypes related to Alzheimer’s disease.
title: Functional biological paths altered in Alzheimer’s disease: from genes to bile acids

finding: The rs567868887 SNP in chromosome 12 was associated with major depressive disorder (MDD), showing a MAF of 0.0009, an Info score of 0.28, and a p-value of 1.57 × 10⁻⁵⁵, highlighting its significance.
title: Increasing the resolution and precision of psychiatric GWAS by re-imputing summary statistics using a large, diverse reference panel

finding: The SNP rs7306304 was identified with decreased expression of CLECL1, linked to increased MS risk through macrophage-mediated effects.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: Rs7977720 was in strong LD with rs7306304, indicating its involvement in the MS risk locus related to CLECL1.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs2393791 related to the HNF1A gene was identified in the context of hsCRP levels and their genetic determinants.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The novel SNP rs149156910 in SPPL3 was significantly associated with hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The novel SNP rs76847996 located in RP11-216P16.6 was identified as associated with hsCRP levels.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The SNP rs2393775 associated with HNF1A was linked to hsCRP levels and illustrated its genetic implications.
title: A genome-wide association study of high-sensitivity C-reactive protein in a large Korean population highlights its role in cholesterol metabolism

finding: The SNP rs76904798 was associated with decreased usage of an LRRK2 splice junction, which correlates with an increased risk of IBD. This finding indicated that decreased usage of this splice junction could increase IBD risk, suggesting a potential protective effect of including this splice junction.
title: Low-usage splice junctions underpin immune-mediated disease risk

finding: The variant rs7137828 was associated with the previously reported SH2B3-ATXN2 CHD locus. HyPrColoc detected colocalization of rs7137828 with traits including LDL, HDL, SBP, DBP, and rheumatoid arthritis, contributing to understanding its role in CHD risk.
title: A fast and efficient colocalization algorithm for identifying shared genetic risk factors across multiple traits

finding: The SNP rs1131454 within the OAS1 gene was confirmed to be significantly associated with increased risk for late-onset Alzheimer's disease (AD) in a cohort of 1,313 individuals diagnosed with sporadic AD compared to 1,234 control individuals. This association indicated a decrease in OAS1 expression linked to the risk for AD and highlighted a genetic pathway that connects AD susceptibility with critical illness responses to COVID-19.
title: Genetic variability associated with OAS1 expression in myeloid cells increases the risk of Alzheimer’s disease and severe COVID-19 outcomes

finding: SNP rs5442 in the GNB3 locus was identified as a missense variant (MAF = 0.070), associated with a 30% increased risk of high myopia. Fundus images that activated in the A-allele direction showed characteristics of myopic fundus.
title: TransferGWAS: GWAS of images using deep transfer learning

finding: The SNP rs76895963 was characterized as a conserved intronic variant located in the promoter of the gene CCND2. It was fine-mapped for traits including bone mineral density, height, red blood cell count, systolic blood pressure, and triglycerides, indicating its involvement in cell cycle regulation and related health traits.
title: Functionally-informed fine-mapping and polygenic localization of complex trait heritability

finding: The SNP rs1484149172, which corresponds to the L45P variant, was deemed deleterious by at least eighteen algorithms and was selected for further study due to its potential role in Islet amyloid polypeptide (IAPP) aggregation, leading to type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) and protein misfolding disorders (PMDs).
title: Elucidating conformational alteration of human islet amyloid polypeptide by nonsynonymous substitution

finding: The SNP rs78822118, which corresponds to the T37P variant, was identified as deleterious by numerous algorithms and was chosen for further investigation due to its significant alteration of the conformational dynamics of IAPP, linked to T2DM.
title: Elucidating conformational alteration of human islet amyloid polypeptide by nonsynonymous substitution

finding: The SNP rs200376097, associated with the G66R variant, was also flagged as deleterious and selected for additional molecular dynamics simulation, relating to its implication in IAPP aggregation and T2DM.
title: Elucidating conformational alteration of human islet amyloid polypeptide by nonsynonymous substitution

finding: The SNP rs763604023, corresponding to the T69I variant, was deemed a high-risk nsSNP and selected for further molecular simulation studies, contributing to the understanding of IAPP dynamics related to T2DM.
title: Elucidating conformational alteration of human islet amyloid polypeptide by nonsynonymous substitution

finding: Identified as a lead SNP for autoimmune thyroid disease (ATD), it showed significant associations consistent with previous reports, suggesting its role in disease susceptibility.
title: Sharing information between related diseases using Bayesian joint fine mapping increases accuracy and identifies novel associations in six immune mediated diseases

finding: This splice donor missense SNP was associated with lower levels of sphingomyelin(d32:2), linking it to blood pressure regulation and metabolic pathways impacting cardiovascular health.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: The rs2271194 locus showed colocalization with four genes: ERBB3, IKZF4, RPS26, and SUOX. ERBB3 was connected to the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonadal (HPG) axis and had variable expression in granulosa cells during the estrous cycle. RPS26 was implicated in female fertility and gonadotropin response, indicating a potential role in mediating PCOS risk.
title: Colocalization highlights genes in hypothalamic–pituitary–gonadal axis as potentially mediating polycystic ovary syndrome risk

finding: The SNP rs11111635 was implicated as a significant factor in influencing brain tumor stem cells (BTSCs). The study showed that alterations in the expression of genes encoding proteins that regulate BTSCs, including galectin1, which is linked to glioblastoma tumorigenesis, were associated with this SNP. Specifically, the investigation highlighted how genetic deletion of LGALS1 affected BTSC gene expression and reduced gene sets related to the mesenchymal subtype of glioblastoma, thus providing a direct connection between the SNP and glioblastoma response to therapies.
title: Transcriptional Control of Brain Tumour Stem Cells by a Carbohydrate Binding Protein

finding: The rs10774671 SNP, a splice acceptor A/G variation, was associated with differential expression of the OAS1 isoforms, specifically with Patient 3 predominantly expressing isoform p42, while Patients 1 and 2 exhibited a more balanced distribution of the isoforms p42 and p46. It was significant as it indicated patient-specific expression levels, which could potentially result in diminished OAS1 activity in Patient 3.
title: Detection of isoforms and genomic alterations by high-throughput full-length single-cell RNA sequencing in ovarian cancer

finding: The eQTL variant rs10876864 was associated with RPS26 and influenced allele-specific expression sensitive to cellular respiration late in differentiation. It was also noted as a risk variant for allergic disease and vitiligo, indicating its relevance in both genetic susceptibility and cellular context.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: The PD risk allele rs76904798-T increased LRRK2 expression in monocytes, consistent with previous reports, indicating its role in PD pathology.
title: Discordant transcriptional signatures of mitochondrial genes in Parkinson’s disease human myeloid cells

finding: For rs12821256 in the KITLG gene, strong evidence for selection was found with a coefficient around 0.016. This SNP is linked to traits like blonde hair color and has also shown significant selection signals recently.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The rs1861494 SNP in the IFNG gene was found to be associated with IBD disease severity, influencing both the methylation of IFNG and its protein secretion, as delineated by Gonsky et al. in 2014.
title: Identification of differentially expressed genes and enriched pathways in inflammatory bowel disease using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs3741869 was identified as the most significant SNP within the OASIS locus 12p11.21 containing the gene DDX11. It was discovered to be a cis-eQTL regulating the expression of DDX11, with a GWAS p-value of 3.2E-05 and an eQTL p-value of 8.62E-05. This finding was confirmed through multiple expression datasets, showing that DDX11 was significantly downregulated in systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) patients.
title: Genomic convergence of locus-based GWAS meta-analysis identifies DDX11 as a novel Systemic Lupus Erythematosus gene

finding: This SNP was associated with SCARB1 and showed relevance as a GWAS variant for inflammatory traits, supporting the genetic architecture of immune response pathways.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The variant rs11066320 was linked to high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol levels (p=1.03e-08) and was situated in the Ptpn11 locus. This association contributed to understanding of CAD risk, as HDL levels are important determinants for this condition.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The SNP rs2463169 was found to be associated with height, with the positive G allele increasing height in African populations where its frequency was 23%, compared to 84% in Europeans. The effect size was approximately 0.034 standard deviations per G allele in Africans, contrasting with a negligible effect of about -0.002 standard deviations per G allele in Europeans. Additionally, this SNP is conditionally independent from European-derived signals, indicating unique contributions to height variation in non-European ancestries.
title: A Saturated Map of Common Genetic Variants Associated with Human Height from 5.4 Million Individuals of Diverse Ancestries

finding: This synonymous SNP in the SOX5 gene, which is connected to Lamb-Shaffer syndrome, was observed at a MAF of 0.069 in the IGSR dataset and 0.026 in gnomAD. Despite being within a gene implicated in a disease, it was not associated with any specific phenotype and demonstrated a variation in MAF across populations. It had a high ADS of 0.496, indicating its broad presence across multiple populations.
title: Allele Dispersion Score: Quantifying the range of allele frequencies across populations, based on UMAP

finding: This SNP was linked to the gene NAB2, which plays a role in neuroprotective maintenance and is the target of the SCZ drug cinnarizine. The analysis indicated that rs324017 contributed to a significant decline in binding affinity for the transcription factor PURA, which is critical for neural function and development.
title: Unveiling causal regulatory mechanisms through cell-state parallax

finding: Erola P. C. et al. identified rs10735079 on 12q24.13 in a gene cluster related to antiviral activity (OAS1, OAS2, OAS3) among 2,244 critically ill COVID-19 patients, highlighting its role in severe COVID-19.
title: Human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 severity are enriched in immune and epithelium regulatory networks

finding: Associated with blood cell traits, this SNP also linked to breast and endometrial cancer risks, demonstrating its relevance through the hematopoietic pathway.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: This SNP strongly disrupted CEBPB regulation of TNFRSF1A in the Hippocampus, suggesting a role in severe AD pathology.
title: Predicting gene regulatory networks from multi-omics to link genetic risk variants and neuroimmunology to Alzheimer’s disease phenotypes

finding: This rare essential splice acceptor variant in TAC3 was found to be associated with later age of menarche, where the minor allele showed an effect of 0.57 s.d. (95% CI 0.41-0.74, or approximately 11 months, p = 1.0·10⁻¹¹) in the XBI cohort.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: SNP rs623853 showed differential regulatory activity in a neighboring context of the YEATS4 gene, linked to eQTLs observed in whole blood. Mass spectrometry analyses revealed binding variations of transcription factors in K562 cells, influencing enhancer activity.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: SNP rs554591 was associated with altered transcription factor binding in K562 cells. Changes in binding of ZNF787, among others, were observed, which supports its role in modulating transcriptional regulation of neighboring genes such as YEATS4 and LYZ.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: SNP rs4572196 was linked with various red blood cell traits in GWAS. In SuRE analysis, the G allele exhibited significantly higher activity compared to the A allele, suggesting that the G allele enhances the activity of regulatory elements influencing SH2B3, a gene involved in erythropoiesis.
title: Systematic identification of human SNPs affecting regulatory element activity

finding: The SNP rs324017 was linked to the gene NAB2, which is implicated in stress-induced neuroprotective maintenance. This gene is also the downstream target of the SCZ drug cinnarizine. The association was supported by findings from both the GrID-Net algorithm and the original SCZ GWAS study.
title: An econometric lens resolves cell-state parallax

finding: The SNP rs183902574 was identified as a loss-of-function variant in the LRRK2 gene among a cohort of 749 individuals confirmed as carriers through Sanger sequencing. This finding emerged from the 23andMe dataset and points to its potential significance in the context of LRRK2 inhibition, demonstrating characteristics associated with pLoF (protein loss-of-function) alleles.
title: Human loss-of-function variants suggest that partial LRRK2 inhibition is a safe therapeutic strategy for Parkinson’s disease

finding: The study demonstrated a successful knock-in of the SNP rs704074 (A/G) using a CRISPR-Cas9 complex targeting the SNP located in the DUSP6 gene. The methodology included transfection of the MICCNi002-A cell line (which had an AA genotype) with a donor molecule containing the G allele at the SNP site. Among 50 positively transfected single-cell clones screened through high-resolution melting analysis (HRMA), 5 clones were identified as successfully knocked-in, achieving a heterozygosity (A/G) genotype with a success rate of 10.0%. This findings linked the SNP to potential implications in the genetic mechanisms related to attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, highlighting the utility of the method in stem cell disease modeling.
title: Integration of Xeno-Free Single-cell Cloning in CRISPR-mediated DNA Editing of Human iPSCs Improves Homogeneity and Methodological Efficiency of Cellular Disease Modelling

finding: This SNP shared a genetic signal with proteins related to hypercoagulation in COVID-19 patients and was highly linked to the lead ABO signal for respiratory failure.
title: Genetic architecture of host proteins interacting with SARS-CoV-2

finding: This SNP was associated with C-reactive protein levels across the African-American (PAGE), European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts, showing its widespread relevance.
title: Enrichment analyses identify shared associations for 25 quantitative traits in over 600,000 individuals from seven diverse ancestries

finding: rs1169310 demonstrated significance in European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts, indicating a conserved association with C-reactive protein levels.
title: Enrichment analyses identify shared associations for 25 quantitative traits in over 600,000 individuals from seven diverse ancestries

finding: This SNP was significant in European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts, reinforcing its connection to C-reactive protein levels.
title: Enrichment analyses identify shared associations for 25 quantitative traits in over 600,000 individuals from seven diverse ancestries

finding: rs7953249 was associated with C-reactive protein in multiple ancestry cohorts, including European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American.
title: Enrichment analyses identify shared associations for 25 quantitative traits in over 600,000 individuals from seven diverse ancestries

finding: This SNP was significant across European, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts, implicating it in C-reactive protein level variability.
title: Enrichment analyses identify shared associations for 25 quantitative traits in over 600,000 individuals from seven diverse ancestries

finding: rs7979473 was associated with C-reactive protein in the African-American, East Asian, and Hispanic and Latin American cohorts.
title: Enrichment analyses identify shared associations for 25 quantitative traits in over 600,000 individuals from seven diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs4766428 was identified as a significant eQTL for ATP2A2 in subtypes of radial glia and mature neurons. Notably, it was associated with cognitive ability, risk of schizophrenia, and risk of anorexia nervosa, reflecting its relevance to several brain-related traits in the context of neurological disorders.
title: Oxygen-induced stress reveals context-specific gene regulatory effects in human brain organoids

finding: The T2D risk allele of rs1617434 at the MPHOSPH9 locus significantly decreased beta-1 chromatin accessibility and was predicted to disrupt a binding site for HNF4A. This variant was associated with reduced expression of genes ABCB9, RILPL2, and MPHOSPH9, indicating its role in the pathophysiology of type 2 diabetes (T2D).
title: Integration of single-cell multiomic measurements across disease states with genetics identifies mechanisms of beta cell dysfunction in type 2 diabetes

finding: This variant was confirmed to have a strong cis-acting association with the gene DRAM1, located downstream, in multiple tissues. Additionally, it was associated with height in the UK Biobank, showing a significant p-value of 1.47 x 10^-14.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: Identified as a lead hotspot located within the 3' UTR of the LYZ gene, associated with multiple traits including monocyte counts. The analysis revealed significant pleiotropic effects, indicating strong biological connections.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: Discovered as another lead hotspot near the LYZ gene, sharing a high r-squared value of 0.89 with rs10784774. This SNP exhibited significant pleiotropic effects and was implicated in transcription factor binding in monocytes.
title: EPISPOT: an epigenome-driven approach for detecting and interpreting hotspots in molecular QTL studies

finding: CYP27B1 rs10877012 was investigated along with rs10766197 in relation to multiple sclerosis susceptibility in a case-control study conducted by Agundez et al. in 2021.
title: Identification of biomarkers and pathways for focal segmental glomerulosclerosis using next generation sequencing data and bioinformatics analysis

finding: This SNP's significant associations with blood cell traits and cancers suggested potential clonal hematopoiesis interactions.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The SNP rs3184504, a missense mutation in the SH2B3 gene, was highlighted by the omnibus approach and is noted for its association in over 40 publications, especially related to Type 1 Diabetes (T1D), celiac disease, and other autoimmune disorders.
title: JASS: Command Line and Web interface for the joint analysis of GWAS results

finding: The variant rs73192811 was associated with the TPCN1 gene and revealed positive associations in the putamen, influencing calcium signaling pathways.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The variant rs10842717 was associated with the ITPR2 gene and demonstrated negative associations in the right putamen, pertinent to calcium release mechanisms.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The presence of the A risk allele (AA/AG) of the SNP rs1006737 was associated with a deficit in reward responsiveness compared to the non-risk genotype group (GG), indicating that genetic variation in CACNA1C may contribute significantly to impaired reward processing, a symptom relevant to various psychiatric disorders, including those characterized by anhedonia.
title: REDUCED CACNA1C EXPRESSION PRODUCES ANHEDONIC REACTIONS TO PALATABLE SUCROSE IN RATS: NO INTERACTIONS WITH JUVENILE OR ADULT STRESS

finding: Variant rs104894368 was associated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, and its presence in a word cloud suggested enrichment in cardiomyocytes and heart epithelial cells, highlighting its relevance in cardiac tissue.
title: Fast searches of large collections of single cell data using scfind

finding: Variant rs104894369 also correlated with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, appearing in a word cloud that contextualized its relationship with cardiac tissue, similarly to rs104894368.
title: Fast searches of large collections of single cell data using scfind

finding: The SNP rs11830157 was classified as an eQTL associated with KSR2, aligning with GWAS annotations.
title: Interpreting coronary artery disease GWAS results: A functional genomics approach assessing biological significance

finding: This was noted as a non-coding transcript exon variant in AC024257.3, contributing to newly identified associations with height in the study.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The SNP rs1169284 within the HNF1A locus was positively associated with delta age (ΔAge), with a p-value of 3.0×10^-23. This finding was contextualized in relation to its known associations with diabetes and cancer, suggesting that individuals carrying certain risk alleles might exhibit a higher ΔAge due to the physiological impact of these age-related diseases.
title: A Physiology Clock for Human Aging

finding: The variant rs2072449, located in the 3' UTR of C3AR1 and ~25 kb from the TSS of FOXJ2, acted as an eQTL for FOXJ2. It was associated with an expression enhancing effect on FOXJ2 in whole blood studies. However, in EBV-transformed lymphocytes, the G allele was associated with reduced expression of FOXJ2 and NECAP1. Additionally, this allele was linked to a decrease in monocyte count and an increase in neutrophil count in GWAS studies.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: Being newly identified and replicated, this SNP was associated with circulating vitamin D levels, suggesting a potential role in vitamin D phenotype research.
title: An atlas on causal role of circulating vitamin D concentrations in human complex traits and diseases

finding: Interacting exclusively with excitatory dentate gyrus neurons, rs4765913 was significantly associated with bipolar disorder, showcasing relevance to both bipolar disorder and its role in schizophrenia heritability.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: It was one of the SNPs associated with the CACNA1C locus, demonstrating a PIP ≥ 0.1 and intersecting with excitatory neuron populations that were relevant to schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: Also linked with the CACNA1C locus, this SNP intersected with excitatory neuron populations, presenting relevance to schizophrenia as well.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: This SNP intersected with OCRs in multiple cortical layers' excitatory neurons, linking it with potential modulation in relation to schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: This SNP intersected with both excitatory and inhibitory neurons, suggesting modulating effects in the expression of the CACNA1C gene relevant to schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: Like rs1860002, it intersected with both excitatory and inhibitory neurons, indicating a broader modulatory role in the context of schizophrenia.
title: Leveraging mouse chromatin data for heritability enrichment informs common disease architecture and reveals cortical layer contributions to schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs11060877 was found to be significantly associated with the immune checkpoint pathways in natural killer (NK) cells and played a role in the regulation of immune responses against triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). This was specifically highlighted in the study by Sanchez-Correa et al. (2019), which indicated that variations in this SNP could influence the efficacy of NK cell-based cancer immunotherapies.
title: Microfluidic system-based time-course tracking of physical proximity between cells and its effect on gene expression for elucidating live single cancer-immune cell interactions

finding: The rs11062091 SNP (NG_008801.2:g.87418G>A) was identified as a sQTL for DCP1B affecting mRNA processing and linked to increased obesity and BMI based on splicing effects.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The rs2470397 SNP (NG_008801.2:g.31165T>C) was a sQTL associated with BMI, reflecting on variations in transcript decay rates due to splicing interactions.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The rs10774018 SNP (NG_008801.2:g.82974G>C) was implicated as a sQTL related to visceral obesity and height, with effects on DCP1B splicing contributing to obesity traits.
title: Z-Flipon Variants reveal the many roles of Z-DNA and Z-RNA in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs11178649 was identified at the TSPAN8 locus, found to be in complete linkage disequilibrium with another missense variant. This SNP was associated with a potential risk for asthma characterized as 'probably damaging'.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The rs1861494 SNP in the IFNG gene was found to be associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) severity. This association indicated that the polymorphism led to functional changes in IFNG methylation and protein secretion, thus demonstrating its relevance in the context of gastrointestinal mucosal dysfunction.
title: Epigenetic modulation of NLRP6 inflammasome sensor as a therapeutic modality to reduce necroptosis-driven gastrointestinal mucosal dysfunction in HIV/SIV infection

finding: Although its association with human lifespan was indirect, rs6489785 near HNF1A was referenced as one of 37 'longevity SNPs'. It underscored the genetic factors that could contribute to lifespan variation and was part of the broader analysis concerning variants in HNF1A that affect numerous health traits.
title: Pleiotropic Influence of DNA Methylation QTLs on physiological and aging traits

finding: The SNP rs11060761 was linked to mitochondrial ion channels contributing to chemotherapy resistance in cancer cells. This indicated that variations in these genetic loci could affect cell metabolism and responsiveness to treatment in the context of cancer.
title: Monitoring extracellular ion and metabolite dynamics with recombinant nanobody-fused biosensors

finding: The study identified that the SLC2A3 rs12842 polymorphism was associated with an increased risk for Alzheimer’s disease, indicating its potential role as a genetic marker in this condition.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs11111789 related to DNA repair efficacy was initially highlighted in studies focusing on the response of cells to ionizing radiation. It was part of a broader investigation into the dynamics of non-homologous end joining (NHEJ) in vertebrates, where variations at this locus influenced the repair capacity of DNA double-stranded breaks. This finding was crucial in establishing a link between genetic variations and repair mechanisms, particularly in the context of cancer susceptibility and treatment outcomes.
title: Single-molecule imaging reveals the kinetics of non-homologous end-joining in living cells

finding: The SNP rs10846742 was found to have allelic heterogeneity due to sex, BMI, and urban status, highlighting its impact in the context of LDL-cholesterol.
title: Accounting for heterogeneity due to environmental sources in meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies

finding: The rs11178649 SNP, part of the TSPAN8 locus, was associated with asthma. It was in complete LD with rs3763978, a missense variant, and was also predicted to be 'probably damaging' by PolyPhen.
title: Genome-wide association analysis of 350,000 Caucasians from the UK Biobank identifies novel loci for asthma, hay fever and eczema

finding: The rs76904798 variant in the LRRK2 promoter was associated with an increased risk of idiopathic Parkinson's disease (iPD), independent of LRRK2 missense mutations. This finding suggested that the presence of this SNP could be a contributing factor to PD risk, indicating its relevance in the genetic landscape of the disease.
title: Single molecule array measures of LRRK2 kinase activity in serum link Parkinson’s disease severity to peripheral inflammation

finding: The index SNP rs112581165 was identified as having a strong association with a downregulation of multiple TE families, including the L1 family, indicating it had notable regulatory impacts despite the absence of linked protein-coding genes.
title: An eQTL-based Approach Reveals Candidate L1 Transcriptional Regulators in Lymphoblastoid Cells

finding: The SNP rs3184504, which results in a trypsin to arginine variant in the SH2B3 gene, was associated with over 12 phenotypes including hypothyroidism, blood pressure, type 1 diabetes, coronary heart disease, arthritis, myocardial infarction, peripheral arterial disease, and several medical traits such as eosinophil counts.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The SNP rs1002552 was categorized with a PVS score of 0.308, placing it in the L1 category of pleiotropy. It was associated with acute lymphocytic leukemia and acute leukemia.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: The SNP rs11060819 was associated with the observation that AZD1775 inhibited WEE1 rather than PLK1 at therapeutically relevant concentrations. This finding linked the genetic variation to the differential inhibition of specific kinases, providing insights into drug response related to cancer treatment.
title: Development of Cell Permeable NanoBRET Probes for the Measurement of PLK1 Target Engagement in Live Cells

finding: The SNP rs11059921 was identified as influencing the expression of <italic>SLC15A4</italic> in pDCs, suggesting its role in linking genetic risk factors of SLE with disease pathogenesis.
title: Autotaxin may play a Critical Role between the Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of SLE in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: The SNP rs1800693 was found to regulate the skipping of exon 6 in TNFRSF1A across 35 tissues. Previous studies showed that the G allele of rs1800693 led to exon 6 skipping.
title: Junction-skipping regulation in complex disease

finding: The index variant rs10735079 was found to be associated with a 22% reduced risk of needing intensive care when infected with SARS-CoV-2, detailing its protective effect against severe COVID-19.
title: A genetic variant protective against severe COVID-19 is inherited from Neandertals

finding: The SNP rs4766664 was reported to be associated with severe COVID-19, with frequencies in Eurasia and the Americas often reaching or exceeding 30%, highlighting its significant association with the risk of severe outcomes from COVID-19.
title: A genetic variant protective against severe COVID-19 is inherited from Neandertals

finding: The SNP rs10774671 affected a splice acceptor site of the OAS1 transcript and was associated with protection against West Nile Virus, with an odds ratio of 0.63, suggesting its functional importance in viral infections.
title: A genetic variant protective against severe COVID-19 is inherited from Neandertals

finding: The missense variant rs2660 in the OAS1 gene was associated with moderate to strong protection against SARS-CoV, indicated by an odds ratio of 0.42, marking it as a significant finding in relation to viral infection resistance.
title: A genetic variant protective against severe COVID-19 is inherited from Neandertals

finding: The SNP rs11060819 was associated with the response to WEE1 inhibition in a study that indicated WEE1 inhibition was critical in the mitotic entry process. The research suggested that the presence of this SNP might influence the effectiveness of AZD1775, which inhibits WEE1, thus altering the duration of mitosis and affecting overall mitotic factor expression.
title: Wee1 inhibition decouples Cdk1 and Plk1 activities: a role for gradual Cdk1 activation throughout G2 phase

finding: The SNP rs11111726 was associated with the expression of Stat5b, a key factor related to the disruption of adult neurogenesis due to Derlin-1 deficiency. This finding indicated the role of Stat5b in regulating neural stem cell behavior and was linked to alterations in cognitive function and seizure susceptibility in mice.
title: Homeostatic Regulation of Seizure Susceptibility and Cognitive Function by ER Quality Controller Derlin-1 through Maintenance of Adult Neurogenesis

finding: This intronic variant in <italic>CCDC77</italic> was associated with reaction time and controlled expression of nearby genes relevant to cognitive functions.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: This SNP in <italic>PTPN11</italic> was linked to complex processing speed and revealed significant related eQTL activity.
title: Exome-wide analysis reveals role of LRP1 and additional novel loci in cognition

finding: Within the context of major depressive disorder (MDD), rs567868887 on chromosome 12 showed a MAF of 0.0009, an Info of 0.28, and an impressive p-value of 1.57 * 10<sup>-55</sup>. This was well above stringent thresholds, marking it as a significant finding for MDD.
title: DISTMIX2: robust imputation of summary statistics for cosmopolitan cohorts using a large and diverse reference panel

finding: The SNP rs2283290 was reported to have a significant role in triggering diabetic cataract, based on a study involving 2,501 Scottish cases and 3,032 controls. This finding indicated that rs2283290 was associated with the risk of developing cataract specifically in the context of type 2 diabetes.
title: The putative causal effect of type 2 diabetes in risk of cataract: a Mendelian randomization study in East Asian

finding: The SNP rs34637584, associated with the LRRK2:G2019S variant, was noted as a common genetic cause of both familial and sporadic Parkinson's Disease (PD) as well as Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD). This particular finding elucidated the significance of the LRRK2 gene in the context of PD and IBD, providing insight into the genetic underpinnings that may link these two disorders.
title: Peripheral Blood Immune Cells from Individuals with Parkinson’s Disease or Inflammatory Bowel Disease Share Deficits in Iron Storage and Transport that are Modulated by Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs

finding: The SNP rs11059921 was shown to influence the expression of SLC15A4 in pDCs. This SNP is in linkage disequilibrium with the SLE GWAS SNP rs11059919, suggesting a connection between genetic risk factors and the pathogenesis of SLE.
title: Autotaxin is a Potential Link between Genetic Risk Factors and Pathogenesis of Systematic Lupus Erythematosus in Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells

finding: The intronic polymorphism rs10506151 of the LRRK2 gene was shown to interact with Type 2 diabetes, thereby influencing neurodegenerative diseases. This highlighted its significance in both diabetic complications and neurobiology.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: SNP rs1025607 was found to be associated with hardness, contributing to increased hardness in yam tubers.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: SNP rs1038631 demonstrated significant associations with hardness, indicating it influences this culinary trait.
title: Detecting the genetic variants associated with key culinary traits in Dioscorea alata

finding: This SNP in GRIN2B was significantly associated with non-word reading performance and indicated potential transcription factor regulatory implications.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Found to be associated with NWR:VIQADJ and demonstrated suggestive evidence of involvement in reading performance.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: This common variant showed significant association with NWR and suggested regulatory roles potentially affecting dyslexia susceptibility.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Significantly associated with poorer performance on multiple reading assessments, indicating its relevance in dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: Demonstrated significant links to dyslexia-related traits, particularly affecting transcription factor binding sites, implicating its role in dyslexia.
title: Targeted analysis of dyslexia-associated regions on chromosomes 6, 12 and 15 in large multigenerational cohorts

finding: The SNP rs11111783 was noted in the context of targeting integrins in cancer nanomedicine, specifically highlighting its applications in cancer diagnosis and therapy. This finding was considered original and positive, suggesting a significant linkage between this SNP and integrin pathways that may play a role in the modulation of the immune landscape in tumors.
title: Hypoxia-inducing cryogels uncover key cancer-immune cell interactions in an oxygen-deficient tumor microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs11066188 at the HECTD4 locus showed a rise in frequency over approximately 9,000 years, which contradicts earlier notions of a more recent selection process.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: At the ATXN2 locus (rs653178), strong positive selection was also confirmed, with frequency increases noted over 9,000 years, related to protection against urethral-related conditions.
title: The Selection Landscape and Genetic Legacy of Ancient Eurasians

finding: This SNP showed compelling evidence of T2D association in males, suggesting unique interactions influencing T2D risk, particularly with its linkage to ALDH2 and its effects in alcohol metabolism.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: Associated with ALDH2, rs557597782 was noted to have conditional signals in males only, contributing to the understanding of T2D risk under the context of sex differences.
title: Identification of type 2 diabetes loci in 433,540 East Asian individuals

finding: The SNP rs11050660 was associated with histone H3 mutations, particularly the G34R mutation, linked to pediatric glioma. This SNP contributed to understanding the resulting phenotypes such as reduced H3K36 trimethylation and acetylation, increased genomic instability, and defects in DNA repair mechanisms.
title: Surprising Phenotypic Diversity of Cancer-associated mutations of Gly 34 in the Histone H3 tail

finding: The SNP rs10774671 was highlighted as it corresponds to an A>G change in a splice acceptor site. The G allele, which was noted as protective, generates the p46 isoform of OAS1 that has antiviral activity against WNV replication. This finding suggested that variations in this SNP are significant in determining the susceptibility to flavivirus infections, paralleling findings in human populations regarding neuroinvasive diseases caused by WNV.
title: Neuroinvasive flavivirus pathogenesis is restricted by host genetic factors in Collaborative Cross mice, independently of Oas1b

finding: This SNP demonstrated association in trans with LINC00936 in CD14+ monocytes, further indicating its involvement in monocyte differentiation mechanisms.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: This SNP was associated with RP11-290F20.3 in FCGR3A+ monocytes, indicating potential influence on gene expression linked to monocyte function.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The lead eBMD SNP rs2722176 was associated with increased expression of the GLT8D2 gene and decreased bone mineral density (BMD). This finding was consistent with data from Glt8d2 -/- male mice, which showed an increase in BMD, aligning with the hypothesis that GLT8D2 could be causal for its association with BMD.
title: Systems genetics analyses in Diversity Outbred mice inform human bone mineral density GWAS and identify Qsox1 as a novel determinant of bone strength

finding: The variant rs2072449 was identified as an eQTL for the transcription factor FOXJ2 and was located approximately 25 kb from the canonical TSS of FOXJ2, situated in the 3' UTR of C3AR1. The G allele exhibited an expression-enhancing effect on FOXJ2 in whole blood studies, though multi-tissue comparisons showed a reduction in expression in EBV-transformed lymphocytes. Additionally, in GWAS studies, the G allele was associated with a decrease in monocyte count and an increase in neutrophil count.
title: Single-cell gene expression prediction from DNA sequence at large contexts

finding: The SNP rs113315762 was associated with eosinophil counts in a multi-ancestry GWAS. Although it did not serve as the lead eQTL in the JHS study, it was found in the secondary credible set of the FBXW8 gene. The study suggested that this intergenic variant might play a regulatory role on the expression of FBXW8, particularly in relation to eosinophil levels.
title: Gene Expression and Splicing QTL Analysis of Blood Cells in African American Participants from the Jackson Heart Study

finding: At the SNP locus rs2650044, it was noted that this locus exhibited the median per-locus FST estimate of approximately 0.0961 among loci with a minor allele frequency of at least 10%. The study highlighted that allele frequencies showed strong geographical correlations, indicating that the human population structure did not conform to the independent subpopulations model, thus illustrating the complexity of human differentiation. The analysis was conducted using the Human Origins datasets, encompassing K=244 subpopulations.
title: FST and kinship for arbitrary population structures I: Generalized definitions

finding: The study showed that in obese subjects carrying a C allele in the rs1878022 polymorphism of the ERV1/ChemR23 receptor, there was a protective effect against adipose tissue inflammation. This finding underscores the relevance of the host genetic variation in response to RvE1 treatment.
title: Targeting the resolvin E1 - eicosapentaenoic acid axis improves hyperinsulinemia and hyperglycemia in a host genetic dependent manner

finding: The SNP rs11050619 was associated with the modulation of local and systemic cancer metabolism, particularly in the context of cancer-associated fibroblasts impacting the tumor microenvironment (TME) in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDA). This finding was significant as it related to the redox homeostasis and proliferation of PDA cells, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus could influence the metabolic interactions within the TME.
title: The Pancreatic Tumor Microenvironment Compensates for Loss of GOT2

finding: As a lead caQTL SNP, rs1515555 was associated with higher chromatin accessibility but showed discordant MPRA activity when compared with a nearby SNP, rs1515556. This was indicative of complex interactions influencing transcriptional activity.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: This SNP is located 24 bps from rs1515555 and demonstrated opposing MPRA activity effects, contributing to discordance in MPRA and chromatin accessibility outcomes.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: As a putative causal variant, rs7957197 was implicated based on its significant transcriptional effects identified through MPRA.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: This SNP showed significant allelic skew in MPRA activity, implicating it as a potential causal variant among the 45 tested SNPs in its locus.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: rs42447 identified at 83.31 cM on chromosome 7D is likely related to novel sources of resistance to leaf rust since no previously mapped Pt resistance genes or QTLs were found in this region.
title: Identification of novel leaf rust seedling resistance loci in Iranian bread wheat germplasm using genome-wide association mapping

finding: The presence of the rs2596144 T allele in the HPD gene was linked to elevated tyrosine levels in neonates, highlighting its significance in type III tyrosinemia and metabolic regulation.
title: A genome-wide association study of neonatal metabolites

finding: The SNP rs10674957, located in the TRHDE gene, was noted to affect the change in white matter cerebellum volume. TRHDE is involved in neuropeptide metabolism and its knockdown in Drosophila has been linked to altered cell morphology and sensory neuron response.
title: Dynamics of Brain Structure and its Genetic Architecture over the Lifespan

finding: Identified as a lead SNP in the B4GALNT3 locus for height, validated in trans-ethnic studies with high causality probabilities.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: Lead SNP for WHRadjBMI, associated with significant eQTLs in thyroid and relevant tissues.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: The SNP rs3184504, located near SH2B3, was identified as a strong outlier associated with the candidate trait of higher risk of coronary heart disease (CHD). Through the analysis, 15 traits were putatively causal for CHD, and rs3184504 contributed to the identification of these pleiotropic paths.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The SNP rs653178 was detected as an outlier associated with various traits, including anthropometric measures, cholesterol levels, and conditions such as thyroid disease. This finding suggested a complex interaction with coronary heart disease (CHD) risks.
title: MR-TRYX: A Mendelian randomization framework that exploits horizontal pleiotropy to infer novel causal pathways

finding: The SNP rs590429 was linked to the gene ADAMTS, showing a trans-eQTL association with a q-value FDR ≤ 0.11. This association extended from the cis-association with OLR1, indicating its involvement in the network under glucocorticoid exposure.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The SNP rs4329754 demonstrated an association with the gene OLR1, which subsequently extended to an association with the gene ITGAV, showing a q-value FDR ≤ 0.13, underlining its importance in immune and metabolic pathways.
title: Causal Network Inference from Gene Transcriptional Time Series Response to Glucocorticoids

finding: The SNP rs11050619 was positively associated with the modulation of local and systemic cancer metabolism as described by Sanford-Crane et al. in their study on fibroblasts. This finding highlighted the role of fibroblasts in the tumor microenvironment, particularly in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDA), where they influence metabolic processes and potentially impact tumor behavior and response to therapies.
title: The Pancreatic Tumor Microenvironment Compensates for Loss of GOT2

finding: The rs11057401 variant, CCDC92<S70C</sub>, was associated with significant reductions in visceral abdominal fat and increased leg fat mass. Specifically, it was noted that the minor allele caused a reduction in total abdominal fat mass (β = -0.065, p = 3.5E-8), visceral abdominal fat mass (β = -0.063, p = 1.3E-7), and an increase in leg fat mass (β = 0.075, p = 4.9E-10). This finding also extended associations with waist-to-hip ratio previously reported.
title: Regional fat depot masses are influenced by protein-coding gene variants

finding: The SNP rs7132434 overlapped an ATAC-seq peak in mesenchymal stem cells and was included in a credible set of SNPs linked to the ITPR2 locus in the DIAMANTE dataset. It was suggested to have enhancer activity and was predicted to facilitate greater chromatin accessibility, potentially impacting type 2 diabetes risk.
title: Human and rat skeletal muscle single-nuclei multi-omic integrative analyses nominate causal cell types, regulatory elements, and SNPs for complex traits

finding: The study presented evidence that SNP rs10860964 was associated with schizophrenia (SCZ), as it was found overlapping with cEnhancers that were linked to genes such as Ascl1 and Emx1. Additionally, gene ontology analysis indicated that genes interacting with these cEnhancers were enriched for certain biological processes relevant to SCZ, highlighting the potential developmental implications of this variant.
title: Integrative analysis of the 3D genome and epigenome in mouse embryonic tissues

finding: The rs3217893_C>T variant was found associated with medications gliclazide, which is a sulfonylurea used in the treatment of Type 2 diabetes.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: This SNP was part of a novel height locus in B4GALNT3, with high posterior probability for causality and evidence of enhancer histone marks in relevant tissues.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: rs772557 was identified as a causal variant that alters a MYB transcription factor binding site in the intron of PPM1H. This modification downregulated PPM1H expression, leading to an increased proportion of certain hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell (HSPC) subpopulations.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: Part of the credible set variants in PPM1H intron 1, rs772555 showed chromatin looping interactions and a potential regulatory role concerning PPM1H expression.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: rs772556 was also part of the credible set variants within PPM1H intron 1, associated with regulation of PPM1H expression.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: As part of the 12q14 association, rs772559 was included in the credible set, showing regulatory potential in PPM1H expression regulation.
title: Genome-wide association study on 13,167 individuals identifies regulators of hematopoietic stem and progenitor cell levels in human blood

finding: The rs55958994 variant was shown to interact with multiple gene regulatory elements through extreme long-range chromatin interactions, which controlled tumor progression in prostate cancer.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs2279744 within the MDM2 gene was found to be associated with colorectal cancer risks among Asians and Africans. This relationship was demonstrated through stratification analysis, indicating that individuals with certain genotypes of this SNP had varying risks for colorectal cancer.
title: Genomic analyses identify significant molecules and biological processes in colorectal cancer cells with DNA damage

finding: The SNP was newly identified as significant after applying Flexible cFDR, and it also replicated in the UK Biobank data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP rs192592111 C>A in gene PAH had an allele frequency 9 times higher in the Vietnamese population, contributing to a carrier frequency of 2.5% (1 in 40) for phenylketonuria, a metabolic disorder that can lead to significant health problems.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: SNP rs199475650 G>T in gene PAH was similarly found to have elevated allele frequencies in the Vietnamese population, driving the observed carrier frequency for phenylketonuria (2.5% or 1 in 40), which is rare globally.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1131017 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis with a p-value of 1.3×10^-8 and was in high linkage disequilibrium with a type I diabetes GWAS SNP (rs11171739, R^2 = 0.94). It demonstrated an interaction with the gene RPS26, leading to the identification of 1,701 co-expression QTLs in unstimulated conditions.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: This SNP was identified as a co-expression QTL in CD4+ T cells, showing high linkage disequilibrium with rs1131017 (R^2 = 0.92), suggesting similar regulatory mechanisms in both cell types.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: SNP rs11171739 was noted to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs1131017 and associated with type I diabetes, indicating interactions in the context of immune responses.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: SNP rs12230244 was prominently involved in co-expression QTLs affecting CLEC12A during pathogen stimulation, particularly after 3 hours, suggesting a strong role in the regulation of interferon pathways.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: SNP rs999185 was found to be in near-perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs12230244 (R^2 = 0.9943), highlighting its potential role in the regulation of CLEC12A co-expression through IRF binding sites.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: This SNP was also identified to be in near-perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs12230244 (R^2 = 0.90), supporting its involvement in the regulation of CLEC12A expression.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing reveals widespread personalized, context-specific gene expression regulation in immune cells

finding: The SNP rs76895963 was identified as a primary signal at the CCND2 locus with a TOA score indicating shared regulation across islet (TOA=0.53) and adipose (TOA=0.47) tissues.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: With a MAF of 0.0018, rs762349492 was identified as a T1D risk variant (OR=1.99) located in the SH2B3 locus, suggesting its relevance in the disease.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs1006737 in the CACNA1C gene was found to be associated with schizophrenia. This genetic variation had significant implications in the context of norepinephrine functions within the brain, particularly relating to synaptic strength and signaling pathways involving L-type calcium channels. The findings suggested that dysregulation in this pathway may contribute to the developmental mechanisms underlying schizophrenia.
title: α1 adrenergic receptor - PKC - Pyk2 - Src signaling boosts L-type Ca2+ channel Cav1.2 activity and long-term potentiation in rodents

finding: The variant rs7953706 in the DDX11 gene was identified as a strong variant affecting gene expression. The analysis demonstrated that replacing the reference base at this position with the variant allele was predicted to increase gene expression, which was specifically illustrated in the in silico mutagenesis study by indicating a shift to a red coloration in the attribution heatmap.
title: Benchmarking of deep neural networks for predicting personal gene expression from DNA sequence highlights shortcomings

finding: The SNP rs2277339, identified as a missense coding variant in DNA primase subunit 1 (PRIM1) on chromosome 12, was positively associated with OSA. It linked plateletcrit and mean corpuscular volume to the apnea-hypopnea index (AHI). In the UK biobank, it was significantly associated with height, waist-to-hip ratio, age at menopause, and multiple red blood cell-related traits.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy to discover and interpret GWAS results for sleep-associated traits

finding: The variant rs147730268 was linked to HCAR2, identified as a causal variant in association with BMI, supporting its role in metabolic regulation with a significant PPA.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: SNP rs3897102, along with rs147730268, flanked HIP1R and contributed to the BMI association, demonstrating its potential causal role.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The SNP rs11060818 was associated with changes in gene expression regulation during tumorigenesis and aging processes in relation to the RhoB gene. This finding indicated its possible relevance in cancer development and progression, showcasing its potential applications in understanding and targeting these processes.
title: From miRNA target gene network to miRNA function: miR-375 might regulate apoptosis and actin dynamics in the heart muscle via Rho-GTPases-dependent pathways

finding: The top eSNP (rs1131017) for RPS26, located in its 5' UTR, was a cis-eQTL for SUOX in resting and stimulated T cells, revealing regulatory interactions in gene expression.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The SNP rs7954905 was employed to reconstruct the CD163 sub-network in visceral abdominal fat, with associated target confidence established at 15% FDR.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs3184504 demonstrated a strong association with numerous traits, as indicated by its identification in multiple risk factor and disease pairs. Specifically, it appeared as a single significant contributor to a multimodal effect of stroke on LDL-C, which highlighted it as an outlier. The analysis revealed that when this SNP was removed, the identified mode related to stroke disappeared, implying its pivotal role in contributing to these relationships. Thus, it was concluded that rs3184504 was associated with extensive pleiotropy across various complex traits.
title: Causal Inference for Heritable Phenotypic Risk Factors Using Heterogeneous Genetic Instruments

finding: The SNP rs1108075 was part of amplicon #3, which was validated for enhancer activity in postnatal brain, indicating its role in modulating gene expression.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Included in amplicon #3, rs11062166 contributed to the significant enhancer activity in the study, showing its potential regulatory role in the brain.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: As part of amplicon #6, rs12315711 was validated for significant enhancer activity, indicating its relevance in developmental gene expression within the brain.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: The SNP rs2159100 was linked to amplicon #6, which demonstrated significant enhancer activity, establishing its importance in gene regulatory processes.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: Located within amplicon #7, rs11062170 was associated with demonstrated enhancer activity, reflecting its involvement in neural development.
title: Parallel functional testing identifies enhancers active in early postnatal mouse brain

finding: The intronic polymorphism rs10506151 of the LRRK2 gene showed an interactive association with type 2 diabetes, indicating potential implications for neurodegenerative diseases.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs2292239 in the ERBB3 gene was associated with an increased risk for type 1 diabetes mellitus in a Brazilian population.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs6332 polymorphism in the NTF-3 gene was associated with the onset time of Alzheimer's disease, providing insights into the genetic basis of the disorder.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The T allele of rs6489630 in the NTF-3 gene exhibited a protective role against Alzheimer's disease.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The OAS1 gene variant rs1131454 was associated with Alzheimer's disease, underlining its potential role in neuroinflammatory pathways.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs11060750 was identified as having a positive original finding in the context of its association with the gene <italic>Ldh</italic>, which plays a crucial role in lactate metabolism. This finding was significant as it related to the adaptive metabolic response that neurons exhibit when mitochondrial fusion is disrupted, particularly in relation to the Warburg effect and chronic mitochondrial fragmentation.
title: Chronic mitochondrial fragmentation elicits a neuroprotective Warburg-like effect in Drosophila neurons

finding: The SNP rs10847864 was identified as a trans-eQTL for the gene SYNJ1 in the adult brain cortex, linking familial studies and PD GWAS loci for SYNJ1 for the first time.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: This SNP was shown to function as a cis-eQTL that increased LRRK2 expression in multiple peripheral tissues, including the enriched oesophagus, indicating possible implications for PD risk.
title: Establishing gene regulatory networks from Parkinson’s disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs11050726 was identified in relation to TGF-beta signaling in breast cancer. The study highlighted that the variant had implications in the epigenetic reprogramming associated with breast cancer susceptibility and progression, including its association with triple-negative breast carcinomas (TNBC). This finding emphasized the role of rs11050726 in influencing the cellular environment, which may affect the efficacy of oncolytic virus therapies in cancer treatment.
title: Identification of oncolytic vaccinia restriction factors in canine high-grade mammary tumor cells using single-cell transcriptomics

finding: The SNP rs2302685, identified as a nonsynonymous variant in the LRP6 gene, was associated with late onset Alzheimer's Disease (LOAD). This variant led to a conservative substitution at amino acid position 1062, changing isoleucine to valine (Lrp6-Ile-1062-Val or Lrp6-val). This mutation conferred reduced Wnt signalling in cell lines and was linked to synaptic defects and increased vulnerability of synapses in the context of Alzheimer's pathology.
title: A genetic variant of the Wnt receptor LRP6 accelerates synapse degeneration during ageing and in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs192592111 C>A in gene PAH was linked to phenylketonuria with a carrier frequency among the Vietnamese of 2.5% (1 in 40), and its allele frequency was found to be 9 times higher than that in the East Asia population.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: Similar to rs192592111, the SNP rs199475650 G>T in gene PAH also contributed to the higher allele frequency associated with phenylketonuria, reinforcing the elevated carrier frequency in the Vietnamese population.
title: Genetic landscape of recessive diseases in the Vietnamese population from large-scale clinical exome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs11111675 was associated with voltage-gated sodium channel expression in carcinomas, as noted in the study by Djamgoz et al. (2019). This finding highlighted its potential role in the mechanisms underpinning metastasis in cancer cells.
title: Membrane voltage fluctuations in human breast cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs34637584 was mentioned in the context of LRRK2, known for its previously established association with PD. Its role within the PD GWAS was important for understanding the contribution of rare coding variants to the disease.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: rs167769 had an FDR value of 4.04e-04 in the original GWAS but became significant after flexible cFDR application with a new FDR of 4.34e-05. This SNP is located in the intron of the STAT6 gene, closely linked to allergic responses.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: The SNP rs16917496 was identified as having a significant correlation with colorectal cancer in Iranians. This finding related to the binding site of the miR-502, suggesting an influence on tumor behavior and potential implications in cancer susceptibility.
title: TERT-mediated induction of MIR500A contributes to tumor invasiveness by targeting Hedgehog pathway

finding: At locus 12q13.13, SNP rs3842942 was identified as one of the lead SNPs associated with male-pattern baldness (MPB). This SNP is located upstream of a cluster of 20 keratin (KRT) genes, out of which 17 genes were associated with a Mendelian phenotype impacting the integumentary system. Importantly, 6 of these genes were directly related to hair and scalp phenotypes.
title: MendelVar: gene prioritization at GWAS loci using phenotypic enrichment of Mendelian disease genes

finding: Similar to rs3842942, SNP rs7961185 was also a lead SNP at the 12q13.13 locus linked to MPB. It was part of the same cluster of keratin genes, contributing to the phenotypic effects on hair and scalp through its association with 6 prioritised genes, including the closest gene (KRT71) to the index SNPs.
title: MendelVar: gene prioritization at GWAS loci using phenotypic enrichment of Mendelian disease genes

finding: The study revealed that in obese subjects, carrying a C allele in the rs1878022 polymorphism of the ERV1/ChemR23 receptor offered protection from adipose tissue inflammation. This finding indicated a significant role of host genetics in the biological response to RvE1, showing that genetic variation could influence the effectiveness of metabolic interventions.
title: Eicosapentaenoic acid prevents obesity-induced metabolic impairments through the host-genetic dependent effects of resolvin E1

finding: The SNP rs1861494 in the IFNG gene was found to be associated with increased disease severity in inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). This association corresponded with functional changes in both the methylation of the IFNG gene and the secretion of the IFNG protein, indicating a potential mechanism through which this SNP could influence the clinical outcomes in IBD patients.
title: Helicobacter hepaticus as disease driver in a novel CD40-mediated model of colitis

finding: The SNP rs11111634 was associated with the activity of the Bromodomain protein BRD9, which cooperated with the oncogene KRAS to promote MYC activity and enhance tumorigenesis, suggesting a significant role in cancer progression.
title: BRD9-containing non-canonical BAF complexes safeguard cell identity and prevent reprogramming

finding: The SNP rs3003-T was associated with increased abundance of activated NK cells that expressed TNF-α response programs, as indicated by a p-value of 1.96×10^-11. This csaQTL colocalized with increased risk for psoriasis, with a GWAS p-value of 4.17×10^-9, suggesting a genetic basis linked to an autoimmune response that is responsive to anti-TNF treatments.
title: Identifying genetic variants that influence the abundance of cell states in single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs11053802-T was identified in a prior meta-analysis as being associated with psoriasis (p=4.17×10^-9). It was noted to be in linkage disequilibrium with rs3003, suggesting a shared genetic influence in psoriasis risk.
title: Identifying genetic variants that influence the abundance of cell states in single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs11060750 was associated with metabolic pathways relevant to tissue regeneration. In the context of the study discussing lactate dehydrogenases in tumor microenvironments, it was highlighted that metabolic processes such as glycolysis are fundamental in reprogramming processes, specifically in the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) to neural retina transition. The finding indicated that this SNP could impact cell fate decisions in regenerative contexts due to its regulatory role in metabolism, particularly in relation to RPE cell responses during regeneration and conditions such as proliferative vitreoretinopathy.
title: DISTINCT METABOLIC STATES DIRECT RETINAL PIGMENT EPITHELIUM CELL FATE DECISIONS

finding: The rs3751129 variant was associated with activation strength in both the R-VTA (P = 0.0188) and L-VTA (P = 0.0059), indicating its potential role in the dopaminergic reward system. This synonymous variant is located in the WASHC3 gene.
title: Gene Set-Based Analysis of the Endosomal Sorting Processes Cargo Selection and Membrane Tubulation with Human Reward System Reactivity

finding: The SNP rs76895963 was a primary signal at the CCND2 locus with shared regulatory roles in islet (TOA=0.53) and adipose (TOA=0.47) tissues, indicating its contributions to T2D pathophysiology.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes
