finding: Part of a clustering of SNPs upstream of <italic>HMGA2</italic>, this SNP was linked to non-coding RNAs that could influence gene expression, emphasizing its importance in osteoporosis.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: Associated with <italic>HMGA2</italic>, this SNP's role was related to regulatory mechanisms affecting non-coding RNA interactions, thereby influencing bone health.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: Another SNP linked to <italic>HMGA2</italic>, providing context for its regulatory role through non-coding RNA pathways that may impact bone mineral density.
title: Prioritization of osteoporosis-associated GWAS SNPs using epigenomics and transcriptomics

finding: The variant rs11060180 in CCDC62 was associated with a significant decrease in AAO in homozygous alternative allele patients. This presented it as a potential risk factor, highlighting its individual influential role despite being included in the analysis of AAO modifiers.
title: Identification of representative trees in random forests based on a new tree-based distance measure

finding: The rs3217893 variant, identified in the context of type 2 diabetes, was causally associated with gliclazide, a medication for treating type 2 diabetes, evidenced through the inclusion of genetic correlation data.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The SNP rs428073 was linked to a risk for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus, with a variant-disease association score of 0.7, indicating at least one curated source supporting this finding.
title: Comprehensive assessment of Indian variations in the druggable kinome landscape highlights distinct insights at the sequence, structure and pharmacogenomic stratum

finding: The SNP rs76895963 was associated with a reduced susceptibility to type-2 diabetes (T2D) based on genome-wide association studies (GWAS). This variant was highlighted as a provisional therapeutic target for beta cell proliferation and was identified as pleiotropic for HbA1c levels in blood, indicating its role in glucose metabolism and diabetes control.
title: Causal inference for multiple risk factors and diseases from genomics data

finding: The SNP rs1716183 was found to correlate with the gene OGFOD2 in excitatory neurons and showed association with schizophrenia (SCZ) and intelligence quotient (IQ). It was associated with neuronal ATAC and H3K27ac peaks and connected to the OGFOD2 promoter through a PLAC-seq loop, highlighting its role in neurodevelopmental and neuropsychiatric disorders.
title: Single-cell Mendelian randomisation identifies cell-type specific genetic effects on human brain disease and behaviour

finding: The SNP rs11060837 was found to be associated with the regulation of HOX cluster miRNAs, specifically impacting miR-196b expression in acute myeloid leukemia (AML) cells. The context of this finding relates to the aberrant expression of HOX cluster miRNAs linked to the leukemogenesis process, where inactivation of HOTTIP or miR-196b is implicated in enhancing apoptosis and increasing FAS expression, showing the significance of this SNP in AML pathology.
title: A coordinated function of lncRNA HOTTIP and miRNA-196b underpinning leukemogenesis by targeting Fas signaling

finding: The SNP rs10774625 was strongly linked to systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) through genome-wide association studies (GWAS). It tagged a haplotype block encompassing the SH2B3 gene and acted as a significant expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL). The study reinforced the connection between this SNP and SLE pathogenesis by demonstrating that novel and rare variants in the SH2B3 gene lead to impaired protein function, which in turn disrupts B cell development and tolerance, predisposing carriers to autoimmunity.
title: Rare SH2B3 coding variants identified in lupus patients impair B cell tolerance and predispose to autoimmunity

finding: The SNP rs3184504 is a relatively common missense variant in the SH2B3 gene, which exhibited a strong linkage (r2 = 0.92) to the GWAS-associated common variant rs10774625. This study added to the understanding of SLE risk by showing that rare variants in SH2B3 led to dysfunctional protein activity affecting B cell tolerance, further implicating this locus in the pathogenesis of SLE.
title: Rare SH2B3 coding variants identified in lupus patients impair B cell tolerance and predispose to autoimmunity

finding: The SNP rs653178 at ATXN2 was highlighted as another locus previously shown to be selected in West Eurasians. This finding contributed to understanding the genetic variations associated with complex traits related to neurological functions.
title: Ancestral contributions to contemporary European complex traits

finding: At locus 12q13.13, SNP rs3842942 was identified as one of the lead SNPs in the male-pattern baldness (MPB) GWAS. It was located upstream of a cluster of 20 keratin (KRT) genes, of which 17 were associated with a Mendelian phenotype affecting the integumentary system, with 6 specifically affecting hair and scalp. Among these, KRT71, KRT74, and KRT73 were the top prioritized genes based on previous FUMA analysis.
title: MendelVar: gene prioritization at GWAS loci using phenotypic enrichment of Mendelian disease genes

finding: SNP rs7961185, also a lead SNP at locus 12q13.13 in the MPB GWAS, was noted for its proximity to keratin (KRT) genes linked to hair and scalp phenotypes similar to those affected by Mendelian diseases. The overlap underscored the significance of these KRT genes in understanding the genetic basis of MPB.
title: MendelVar: gene prioritization at GWAS loci using phenotypic enrichment of Mendelian disease genes

finding: The SNP rs10877012, located in the CYP27B1 gene, was found to be associated with colorectal cancer in patients, suggesting its possible role in cancer susceptibility.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs7138803 in FAIM2 was investigated among autoimmune thyroid diseases, indicating potential connections to inflammatory responses relevant to conditions like Crohn's disease.
title: Identification of hub genes and key pathways in pediatric Crohn’s disease using next generation sequencing and bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs3184504 was identified as a missense variant in the SH2B3 gene. It represented an original finding in relation to its association with the trait of platelet levels.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome

finding: The SNP rs72650673 was also noted as a missense variant located in the SH2B3 gene, and it was considered an original finding linked to platelet activity.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome

finding: The SNP rs1029388, classified as an intron variant within the ATXN2 gene, was reported as an original finding concerning its potential association with platelet traits.
title: Multi-resolution localization of causal variants across the genome
